spake vnto either shalt thou scythian beare away thee goodly prize glorie without losse thine owne bloud else made honorable glorious death thou shalt enriched spoiles ornament vp receiue vnto thee enemie thy owne desire hath sought purchased albeit kindes fight befitting proper fierce sauage beastes valiant men may ought honestie refuse notwithstanding let lawfull contemne neglect safetie person regarde thy selfe oughtest haue great reason keepe thy lymmes thy life daunger destruction vile account safetie bodie man hunteth praise vaineglorie day therefore also make present bloud vnto made stay holding conuenient passe till ordained set order certaine affaire consequence importance shall heare hauing sent secretely principallest towne come vnto speciall care conceale keepe thing secret therefore disposed iourney might arriue thither night discovered vnto secret thought obtained al thing content much one person found report goeth would thing gainesay demaund either feate grand seignour mistrust act dangerous owne disposition would haue done contrary owne desire long time nourished incomparable reputation himselfe conceiued many yeares great furtherance vnto withall loue singular desire liberty wonderfully wrought good grace fauour euery man therefore generall emulation sometime great ioy triumph sometime sheading teares excessiue gladnesse long embracement kissed handes others face one head another feete yea al part body seeming rauished ioy good fortune shewing singular contentment resource restitution albanois name maiesty presenting vnto mean vtmost power ability offered vnto body heart child whatsoeuer better accompt value euen vnto liues first thing tooke order set good speedy watch ward feare affair aduertisement come turke gouernour croy might discouer practise aduised also touching leuy made force take armes first signal token giuen three hundred horse brought reseruing smal number determined ride croy present packet gouernour receiue gouernment residue sent well neare many dibrians knew passage countrey willing closely ambush selues wood thicket next croy til time gotten possession town would couertly let cut throates garrison thing well disposed order selfe night came thither end autumne night began grow long ardentnes desire make impatient delay held least stay great importance endanger enterprise earely morning breake day departed dibria accompanied troupe horse baggage certaine dibrians attended drew directly towards croy great speede might approched towardes towne willing deuise set better colour vpon deliberation make seeme probable commanded way amese two others seruants goe cary newes vnto gouernour aduertise traine farre young man excellent quicke spirite good courage well dissembling selfe habite speach bene turke naturall receiued towne went speedily finde gouernour vnto hauing maner done reuerence good grace began make mention scanderbeg saying secretary great modesty told withall master traine onely would speedily god would amese deliuered point point beleeued thence forward barbarian began prepare make selfe ready depart either read letter notice pleasure prince trussed vp baggage prouided dislodge sort scanderbeg come packet opened letter read credit giuen vnto obeyed thereunto according tenour content albanois wasthe gouernment croy resigned vnto scanderbeg gouernor receiued great ioy called vse ordinary garrison auncient inhabitant towne age estate great renow dispersed ouer partes made much esteemed welcommed euery man turkes loued naturall disposition popular familiar occasion whereof tooke good part vnder command croians saw eye race good prince forth take heart courage neither lesse presently bene deliuered long captiuity misery began sodainely conceiue inward thoughtes wish secret counsailes enterprise scanderbeg especiall eldest yeares amongest yet retaine auncient desire carying mindes apparaunt signes vertue shining infancy would discourse education beginning birth natiuity curious presage parent yet one durst open conceite vnto new captaine yet betake armes till saw selfe aduaunce forward set foote chiefe leader regaine liberty concluded betweene castriot others stirre vp youth towne time serued prouoke take armes forbidden make signe token alteration till succour men armes lay neare towne ambushment let within gate enioyned done secretely dead time night put execution brought towne porte shutte streetes crosse wayes strongest passage filled armed souldiers turkes knowing thing counsailes least feare dissembling errour night augmenting feare daunger scanderbeg gaue signall beginne massacre first thing done oppressethe massacre butchery turkes croy sentinel dispersed vppon walles manner litle standing cabinet woode easily subiect violence soone put sword others disposed place lesse furie priuate house forced open band croie first marched scanderbeg himselfe office commander souldier shutting vp gate many surprized suddenly throtes cut bed alarme come one rest great number wakened ran presently armes according tumult darknesse night giue leasure rendring selues vpon place endeuored cast themselues order battell intent either die honorably making head enemie gaining one port saue selues flight notwithstanding passage shut vp one desseignes assayed vayne saw selues partes murthered slaughtered beastes thus hope flight taken away depriued good honest meanes dye honour recourse cryes lamentation long forborne teares abhorred generous heart called mercie scanderbeg praying adiuring make stay slaughter deface staine fortunate beginning estate bloudshed would make choyce rather let liue reserue seruile estate bondage increase ornament triumph disgrace shew bloudie slaughtered carcass much crueltie dishonor day ioy assurance estate innocent bloud howsoeuer iustly spilt merited thing deserued ill malice people bene iniurious friend rather enemy inhabited conuersed towne committed vnto amurath part would thenceforth debarre man regaining libertie laying downe weapon armes prostrate selues inuocating mercy vanquisher side heard horrible fearefull cryes clamour plaint howling sighes threat lamentation full confusion middest heate furie massacre castriot power causing souldiers retire sound retrait easily moued pitifull voyces miserable suppliant deferred course proceeding till morning following hope people beset side ouerwhelmed infinite misery mischiefes might peraduenture either faire fowle meanes flatterie threat brought drawen embrace christian religion neuerthelesse away certaine dibrians carrie tidings dibria vnto faction croie owne rest passed admonishing generall take armes sollicite ally neighbour recouerie libertie would faile troublesome change vnexpected astonishment partes expell driue away garrison enemy especially amurath yet know thing whilest occupied war hungarian soone cleered towne turk set state thereof good peace quietnesse would incontinently best brauest troopes could possibly assemble next morning sunne rising desirous make end rested vndone within towne caused cried sound trumpet would baptized become professed christian shoulde retire selues neare vnto without armes haue liues giuen indifferently admitted place charge dignity within towne neglect refuse fauour held enemy lawfull euery man punish extremity cruelty terrour proclamation much moue wretched soules obstinate mindes hearken vnto good wholesome counsaile liuely old preceptes auncesters fixed feeble spirites deepely taken roote itthe obstinacy turkes engrauen within bone could disswaded willingly therefore make choise miserable body accompany guilty soules destruction rather would enioy exceeding clemency god men turkes therefore desisting prayer condition propounded vnto christian seemed vnto vnreasonable hauing recourse vnto vaine bootelesse flight rather delay auoide torment reason corpes du gard armed souldiers disposed wayes easily oppresse amazed dispersed albeit many enraged hideous image imminent death destruction present selfe eye naked swordes make selues passage street middest enemy yet could auoide handes rest though ranne birdes shutte vp cage wander crosse wayes towne hauing way escape yet ouerthrowen souldiers comming vppon else murther selues owne weapon sayed slaine owne hand others getting temple sacred place hide selues drawen souldiers desirous bloud made sacrifice common liberty libertie euery man mouth euery sounded sweete name liberty many yet feare gotten house keeping themselues within dores shedde owne bloud excepting retiring selues inner secrete partes corner house time beguile souldiers notwithstanding wilinesse diligence great number also refuge vnto scanderbeg feare hideous spectacle withdrawen former intention onely prolong long might course vnhappy liues fury appeased tumult ceasing within towne euen castriot making preparation haue baptized part faire intreaty supplication cease importune would wils force therunto well might faine themselues feare horror present death yeeld selues christian could forget auncient lawes ceremony elder meant obstinately oppose selues resist commaundementes though present cruell death neuerthelesse could enter thought ceremony tradition ought vsed willing constraint violence required faith plighted vnto reuenge sufficiently late taken parent brother would least wise make messenger vnto amurath straunge hap maruellous accident scanderbeg wrath together arm abated laied aside seeing disarmed handes erected humble themselues easily intreated giue life liberty albeit esteeme faithlesse infidell nation worthy fauour compassion litle ioy benefite departure townes destiny deliuer indiscretion others outrage mercilesse greedinesse communalty baptized besides exceeding shewes ioy triumphe made townes men conuersion abundantly also prouided necessary house victualles pension seruiceable commodity publique common charge notwithstanding ordained good gard till time new seale religion knowen haue taken roote increase within heart yet fresh newly begun principally doubt least vpon alteration attempt kind treason afterwards come forth diuerse hole secret place lighting vpon inhabitant milde curteous disposition kept prisoner hauing promised great summes money raunsome rest killed vpon place thinges thus accomplished thing chaunged reformed withinthe countrey croy reuolteth turkes fauor scanderbeg towne standard ensignes turkes either torne burnt wheresoeuer found token remembraunce vtterly abolished defaced castriot speedily dispatched best appara person towne throughout next place depending iurisdiction croy acquaint successe dealing make take armes needed neither messenger solicitour almost found ready armes attending onely one chiefe leader resolute couragious stomackes therefore moment good sufficient troupe souldiers enrolled passing thence went forwardes incite others doe hadde done garrison turkes whome encountred put sword gathered partes number men thought sufficient tooke way backe againe croy scanderbeg houre hauing made company march together long iourney arriued direction fall least occasion opportunitie may giue hope plausibilitie purchasing thereof attempting onely thousande swordes million peril manifest death apparant hazard loose life good might haue diuerted turned v purpose matter vaine attempted made knowen endeuors either must haue endured cruell punishment bondage farre hard intollerable hope beene quite taken time come oportunitie let slippe beene lost euer fact must haue bene enterprised succeeded first future mean accomplish bene vtterly lost without hope euer returne againe cause speake freely hardly durst trust selfe owne conceipt enterprise neither could thinke selfe assured communicated owne thought mistrusted least tongue impatient case important discouer walles priuate chamber witnesse thereof amese nephewe chiefest friende counsellour time faithfull companion trauels fewe besides whose faithfull forward assistance diligence v good seruice execution action albeit liued together familiarly one course life though eate one table though wee manner breath ioyntly one soule neuerthelesse neither man aliue euer heare mindefull countrie onely warre hungarie neither euer anie man heard vse speech vtter one worde time might argue mee christian free man till time sawe perceiued might freelie doe without feare daunger well therefore might albanian haue sought found person prouince neuer destitute excellent spirites whome might haue made author libertie might haue aduanced meanes courage thereunto pleased may god would haue attend deliuerance rather though somewhat latest go seeke others owne vertue purchase obtaine griefe vnto neither magnanimitie minde albeit nourished libertie suppose time thing long tedious helde long subiection haue courage kept vnder villanous barbarian still liue hope one day see state wherein nowe doe vnder patience vsurpe vnto selfe name deliuerer haue brought hither libertie vnto haue founde libertie scarce set foote within countrie scarce eares heard sounde name made haste meete strong holdes rest vnsubdued consider discommodities al place either taken v besieged howe nothing left enclosure walles haue hope good successe contemplate difficultie strength place force garrison placed tyrant behoueth v either vse notable policie surprise singular resolution obstinacie forcing hereof shall better conueniently consult determine come vppon place face enemie armes hande nowe absent mindes altogether doubtfull vnresolued let v march aduance ensignes speedily let v take vnto v courage conquerours fortune shall seconde endeuours hitherto action place hath singularly accompanied followed v petrella place wee must first set vppon inferiour vnto others strength naturall site thereof neerer citie haue good hope terrified fame report good fortune haue croie manie spectacle presented eye valure owne calamitie may happen thinges may somewhat moue appale conceite make tremble shall wanting assuredly owne resolution obstinacie must shall supply one thing must holde resolutely build vppon place caried come therein ende desire must neuer thinke returne vnto house let v trie therefore meanes arte cunning policie paine trauaile patience sworde golde siluer successe may finde beginning commencement good fortune may make first good signe augurie victorie please god enter force must remoue pittie compassion obstinate miscreantes wee ought rather vse victorie obstinacie seueritie greater discouragement shall rest vnsubdued composition without bloud wee meanes gaine requisite wee carrie selues towardes courtesie vse friendly fauourably generall particular intent wee may make others tractable keepe obstinate desperate modestie scanderbeg oration principally made knowenthe siege petrella highly commended armie neither aduise counsell point either chaunged ill accepted moses three thousand horseman vauntcurrers sent petrella followed neere hande castriot led residue force say hee caried certaine ordinaunce founde within croy sooner astonishe within towne others doe affirme whole seruice enterprised ended without anie helpe artillerie parte true saye reconquered estate within space one moneth onely hardly beleeue hee would charge trouble himselfe trayne cariages especially winter wayes hard frozen full yse neither horse man could easily trauell great difficultie though beene little nothing loaden burdened armie albanoys arriued walles company quartered diuerse partes towne quickely enuironned aduantage might deuised greater parte force lodged tyranna greater named reason lesser seated neere croye thetyranna greater place thereabouts seemed conuenient next hande encampe besieger besieged one minde neuerthelesse castriot endeuoured first faire courteous speech great large promise sounde determination hauing made choise one owne companie faithfull expert facultie whome brought reliques warre hungarie epyre hee sent vnto thecomposition offred garrison petrella petrellians offer ouer aboue safetie liues baggage anie reasonable composition vpon condition would render vp place case would abide exchaunge lawe maister together rather returne owne prince againe promise good store siluer besides rich giftes vnto gouernour souldier quicke spirite verie subtell speech fitte appertinent purpose finding people alreadie enclyning yeelde themselues brought reason himselfe desired tooke beginning perswasion concerning scanderbeg regarde mishappes great businesse amurath vppon discomfiture hungarie conspiracie christian turkes firme assurance came instruction captaine often time insinuating colour mindes hearer prosperous fortune garrison croye miserable condition others laie dispersed throughout corner prouince left abandoned foode vnto wolues dogges open fieldes trueth perswasions beeing parte heard part seene owne eye soone verie easily beleeued condition accepted freely depart armes bagge baggage presentes regarded gouernour therefore appointed certaine treate scanderbeg vppon pointpetrella yeelded ratifie agreement solemne oath matter beeing concluded ended barbarian departed newe garrison receiued within petrella prince albanie mindefull promise honoured kindly entreated enemy good speech furnished money horse victual sent moses certaine horseman conduct frontier epyre feare least suffer outrage meanes secret ambushmentes open violence one side owne follower diuerse others suffered like vsage beholde nowe discourse affaire howe exceeding wonderfull good fortune chiefetaine doth bewray selfe lesse singular excellentscanderbeg fortunate vertue god succour preseruing traines amurath abode likecase may iustly auerre verie time setling reestablishment signiorie onely fauour also fight towne petrella though small inthe situation petrella circuit notwithstanding inexpugnable reason situation nature place height mountaine vppon toppe whereof seated besides aboundantly prouided men armes munition neuerthelesse winter time verie hard vnfit season siege townes made little resistance hee lost winning thereof much one souldier common saying worde wast vaine herein also haue commende singular patience stoode great purpose bodily strength hardened trauailes besides infatigable vnwearied vigour spirite whereby executed office dueties charge great promptnesse celeritie matter fortresse regayned thinges necessarie ordayned prouided made anie abode much day houre anie moment time verie instant trussing vppe baggage hee ledde force townes speedily though fledde away place couered snowe face men euen shronke colde handes frozen body benummed almost senselesse yet would suffer man enter towne saue onely garrison neither would himselfe set foote within make others ashamed example himselfe gaue one thing reportedthe property scanderbeg farre greater maruell may suffer forgotten first day entred epyre euen perfect full recouerie estate neuer knowen slept time full two houres night may bee reputed miracle proper bodie diuine nature supernaturall force vigour may well attayned patience labour sufferance hardnesse custome often watching daily exercise greatnesse force doe holde auncients also excuse great personage papirius cursor great eater drinker vse fight combat arme bare naked tooke care either heate colde thing may thought maruellous credible posteritie let v nowe returne whence digressed next course taken directly petralba distant mile petrella petralba description thereof much croy petrella croy fiue twentie mile castle emathia vpon height mountaine besides small entertainement able yeeld great reliefe sustenance forced famine onely moreouer hauing riuer emathy neere vnto washeth foote mountaine cause yeeldeth vnto place lesse ornament beautie defence commoditie sooner souldiers planted ensignes towne helde yeeld vp one companie sent purposely scanderbeg like condition graunted accorded vnto petrellians inuiolablie obserued certaine epyrots assignedpetralba yeelded conuoy garrison dislodging towne violence countrie inhabitant towne furnished thing necessarie scant leasure breath themselues marched onstellusa descripion thereof like heate furie stellusa distant petralba fiue twentie mile petrella fortie croy fiftie thereabouts litle hamlet likewise notwithstanding meriteth great commendation greatnesse yet may good right accounted reason naturall fortification pleasantnes thereof healthfulnes aire plaine champion field armathia runneth high mountaine seated bene purpose middest valley toppe excellently well enuironed walles maketh castle place epirots arriued sunne setting nothing done day attended day following early morning castriot hauing sent heraulds besieged nothing wordes neither certaine answere giuen barbarian distracted diuerse opinion litle wanted fallen mutinie reason obstinacie speake properly firme resolution gouernour contradicted others vpon capitulation agreement perswading multitude stand defence notwithstanding vanquished greater number yet willing accept reasonable offer made end constrained receiue yoke farre disgratious vile pitifull souldiers able disswade word theystellusa yeelde vnto scanderbeg ison ade gouernour prisoner led bound pinioned others faction vnto scanderbeg contenting themselues condition former deliuered place handes vnto rest christian friendly sort vse notable bountie liberalitie greater sort reason crime treacherie committed ottoman would returne countrie still continue place baptised residue left owne libertie discretion vse religion owne choice pleasure one wanting maintenance entertainment publique common charge remained yet vnrecouered citie sfetigrad sclauoniansfetigard besieged language signifieth holy citie thither therefore without stay made stellusa prince epyre marched armie making speed might towne seated vpper dibria frontier albanie vppon high mountaine haue saide also former stoode aloft verie eminent nest eagle well neere great compasse stellusa allof antiquitie originall chiefe townes epyre place v mentioned founder great antiquitie ancient king macedon epyre strange prince sometimes builded meandria heraclia togla nicopolis echina leucas certain others bene destroyed razed enemy latines may fitly terme firebrandes plague mankinde gothes gallogretians time inuaded ouerwhelmed whole world reason inhabitant countrie particular lord place long time desirous recule reassemble one multitude miserably dispersed reduce forme prouince knewe matter difficultie restore reliques ruines auncient townes repayred yet would neuerthelesse still subiect exposed calamity iniuries enemy come bene time past part seated plaine open champion made choice therefore toppes mountaines seates dwelling build fortress small litle compasse site platforme said mountaines would yeeld larger space circuit walles intent also might easily bethe founda croy defended enemy come assaile although croy capitall chiefe citie realme farre beautifull larger beyond comparison others neuerthelesse find founded one named charles man rich wealthy noble family tholoyes time scanderbeg enioy souereigntie epyre hadscuria scodra tyranna duraz gouernment seigniorie lordshippe scuria scodra part prouince sufficiently famous notable lyeth betweene tyranna duraz assoone castriot come sight enemie deuided company ech quarter set good watch ward partes thesfetigard summoned scanderbeg campe demanded parley towne prouoke example made knowen put mind point point done croie petrella petralba stellusa chiefly liberalitie gratious vsage entreatie garrison stellusa side captiuitie gouernor place shortly see executed others likewise obstinate message astonish euerie one aboue captain garrison hauing eye signes markes men fortune durst beginne declare open aduise yet make answer enemie mistrusting inconstancie common multitude mutablethe oration acommon souldier garrison sfetygrad perswading hold good scanderbeg mindes popular sort part nothing resolute wherefore hauing honorably receiued feasted herauld addressed himselfe souldiers great modestie beganne thus speake vnto thinke valiant men faithful souldiers shall say ambassade enemy one stander wel perceiuing intent meaning gouernor speech sword drawen shaking aloft held hande captaine quoth seeing thou doest terme v valiant faithfull doest repute scanderbeg enemie sword shall make answere v reason hath man alleadge vnto v precisely expresly hath passed croy stellusa thinke thereby feare terrifie courage men free resolute great diuersitie countenance men different visage great varietie habilitie dexteritie spirites ech man wise himselfe ech man foolish owne action neither petrellians stellusians receiued lawes v commaunded v shall commaund prescribe lawes vnto v let v take heed example slaues base infamous way enter hart valiant generous couragious mindes highly disdaine onely case shamefull reproachfull euen honest action imitate deedes person ech man liueth owne guise disposition let gouernor stellusa sacrificed eye companion likewise massacred thinke also shall die body spirit shall extinguished likely blood spilt happy rather body venerable soules excellent desire affection keepe faith libertie haue equally contemned gold siluer sword thing else wretched nature condition mankind doth either affect affraid returne therfore messenger backe againe enemie carrie message thy generall priuate souldier tell intention impose vpon v termes commaund let shew v strength arme yet men courage nothing feared redoubted may god v may force bring v subiection perswasions good word draw v thereunto sure shal neuer moreouer seemeth case scanderbeg man reported namely spirit gentle courteous readie pardon lesse iust enemy owne wherfore gouernor stellusa detained prisoner king faith libertie freelie valiantly iustly became honest man hath deliuered mind opinion wherfore hereserued butchered hand executioner hath deserued put sword suffer death honorably hath neglected owne safetie sought hazard death preseruation libertie souldier heard great admiration without interruption person till ended speech owne accord disposition incontinently beganne great tumult infinite people assembled round clattering swordes buckler together great noise signe token followed mightie clamor alow approue discourse turk gouernor better assured encouraged see souldiers well resolued licenced christian ambassador depart instant bending care studie prouide sure safe keeping towne commanded souldiers withdraw themselues euerie one place deuoyre call although order bene taken manie pointes defence wall altered notwithstanding whole order course thereof disposed otherwise either augmenting changing thing neede required besides middest preparation would euer among vse exhortation good encouragement telling gaue manifest proofe shew wherof euerthe gouernor sfetigrade encorageth souldiers seeing resolute stand defence conceiued certaine hope assurance example place faintly cowardly yeelded neck yoke enemie ought much increase constancy perseuerance thinke vpon great reward recompence prepared amurath alone epire middest disloialtie tretcherie others manfully stand defence name libertie empire ottoman side want courage cowardise carrie regard dutie haue iust occasion expect farre rigorous hard intreatie petrella stellusa infidelitie others apparance excusable seeing theselues besieged part hard beset enemie hart enemy countrie seemed euen forced render themselues whereas vpon limit frontier enemy dominion couered protected place greater stregth inpregnable matter meanes arte onely naturall strength fortification place themselues people hath euer good successe contemned insolencie turkes death scanderbeg albanie subiected subdued singular libertie freedome nature liued long time without knowledge anie forraine yoke time vnderstand hauing voluntarily called vnto made choyse certaine garrison company spaniard apulia haue betaken selues obedience one chiefe lord doe liue excellent forme pollicie george nephewe ofgeorge streese iohn boye streese streese sonne balsee companie also iohn boye brother left home young yeares make vnable warres vnfit called counsell betweene croie lissa laye territorie enioye soyle large rich lesse pleasaunt delightfull musachees familie surnamed camethe familie musachees verie manie one disposition like conformitie minde scanderbeg hold estate signiorie anie way separated deuided ioyntly together ouer besides presented selues two magnanimous valiant prince nicholas paule ducagin armes well appointed butnicholas paule ducagine zadr paule knowen aboue rest certaine singular obseruance religion lordes countrey epirotes call vpper zadrime side riuer dryne euen higher misia region verie spacious fertile watered fountaines wholesome brooke inhabited people fierce warlike place seene manie token shewes antiquitie townes building famous temple manie defaced throwen downe euen ground ruinated toppe verie bottome within heart region doe remaine appeare certaine monument marble vpon might read name manie emperours romanes others amongst markes also testimony paule apostle preached lawe sonne god vnto people thither also came like manner luke zacharie afterward followed thele luke zacharie part scanderbeg like course felicitie good fortune singular good affection perseuer therein euen ende man worthie greater heritage possessed reasonable large portion ground within vpper zadrime together towne daina founded auncestersdayna descended vnto right succession pretie litle towne planted vpon high mountaine almost townes epire yet territorie fat rich excellent good aire healthfull full venison fowle well replenished kinde tree fruites pleasant riuer dryne maketh course part lyeth towards west whichthe riuer drine drin n prerogatiues excellency place haue bene celebrated auncient writer kinde contention great diligence perfection almost left come anie matter worthie speaking neuerthelesse although many thing day falleth haue disguised blemished former grace beautie yet peraduenture shall amisse also part doe time word two intreate floud dryne say doth deuide epire dalmatia sclauonie illiria andepire deuided fro dalmatia slauome riuer dryne gulfe rizique catarra acrolissa island lassa whit inferiour greatnesse famous riuer po italie hath source head amongst people macedonie towardes north swift course doth water walles lissa within entermingling streames waues sea doth discharge selfe adriatique sea gulfe rizique catarrea ioyning neare acrolissa also thither island make continuall abode place greater suertie occasion together selues transported thither also name old towne citie ouer besides also sameotherwise peter span assemblie peter spaniard facility crediting beleeuing hath without doubt ruinated destroyed sort tyrant part haue nothing left repentance simplicitie ouersight neuerthelesse whilest powre forth plaint mind carefully repeate cautels treason ottoman yet withall long contemplate cast thought vpon consider prudence vnitie mind affection doth greatly strengthen biddeth good hope seeing hardly neuer hath subdued destroied people either nation deceipt fraud proper ouer easie beliefe credence ciuill dissentions domesticall hatred go let anie man tell whether ottoman euer prowesse atchieue anie great conquest whether innumerable prouinces infinite realmes time hath gotten purchased haue bene annexed vnto crowne force armes puissance let account recken vp number triumphes victory shall epire inuincible flourishing armes replenished prince valiant captaines many warlike stout people vnited agreeing within themselues shall epire say onely credulitie made subiect outrage greatly barbarian doth estimate redoubt vertue selfe giue certaine assured testimonie euen haue liued many yeares warre peace would euen enterprise vndertake warre verie necessitie doth constraine good great matter effected executed courage forced violently drawne vnto braue resolute souldier soone tell v howsoeuer affection matter iust griefe carie away speaking vnto yet ignorant many hauing bene long time accustomed peace though smally honorable highly aggrieued discontented shall see themselues inuited participate misery mischiefes warre sticke say whatsoeuer fortune successe armes yet nothing done without expence losse bloud like case thinkes see mother discomforted shall see child sent daungers hazardes warres wiues heard lament great griefe sorrow care haue husband safetie verie infant left home house seeme crie feare made orphanes men generally call cruell detest thinke without horror new authour warres peril bloudshed murther whereas ought rather spoken without vaunting name occasioner preseruer libertie neither carelesse publique common good carefull mine owne priuate profite interest endure heare manie complaint aamongst see many mischiefes light vpon common counsell worthie prince lordes seeme good liking occasion entring armes found profitable weale publique held honourable readie willing yeeld vp vnto amurath thinke good croye reliques vnfortunate realme kingdome desiring much rather particular daunger mine owne life prouide suretie raigne publique detriment dammage one thing onely griefe whereof doeth greatly presse miserable condition people innocent bloud cittizens whome heart suffer offred vp sacrifice enemie without chiefe without gouernour seeing faith loyaltie presenteth selfe daily remembrance time restitution kingdome euen late haue left sufficient good proofe vnto age shall succeede hereafter immortall god giue leaue lord speake freely vnto reason fellow citizen countrie man still abide tirant middest many danger euer dwell damned religion continuall fugitiue natiue countrie rather spend rest life epire place natiuitie societie christian middest owne countrie men possible epire see endure hereafter seate auncestors scepter father sepulcher temple especially may speake god longer remaine vnder tirannie circumcised miscreant ala doth seeme small thing haue euen vntil day seene hand filled blood subiects haue dwelt long wicked vnmercifull bloudsucker haue spent well neere best pleasant season age manifest certaine danger life henceforth let v seeing god hath permitted let v say ashamed condition great shame infamie v longer endure master mishap constraine call time father one base ignoble towne scythia could scarcely suffer slaues villaines contemptible time accustomed rapine theft robbery haue encreased euen till day wherin haue growen hardie threaten menace christendom kind extremitie wherfore magnanimous couragious prince assure countrie wiues child defend restore true repose quiet libertie tranquilitie owne estate seeme vnto tollerable leastwise betake rightfull iust armes behalfe albanois sonne prince kinsman poore exile banished person speake men refuse iust lawfull warre would haue master defend iohn castriot prince carelesse good welfare liuing would recommend present vnto valure fidelitie calamitie doe yet moue preferre ignominious peace honorable warre haue recourse owne nation owne people citizen resolued submit selfe quietly hazard aduenture fortune shall send constant free hart haue vowed consecrated owne liues safetie neither courteous prince thinke forsake abandon end assembled deuotion warre seeing cannot serue selues vse purpose say defend though euen wils shall vnderstand land afflicted amurath shall implore craue aide assistance shall know enemie insolent puffed vp victorie subuert ouerthrow seigniory libertie bloudy throat full rage polluted sacrilegious hand wil run make hast furiously sucke swallow vp bloud let intreat stay attend extremity doe make long stay tariance till see comming perhaps late implore succour euen rather presently conioyning force force armes armes let v driue compell enemy speedily take field let v first rush vpon inuade territory shall see v vnited sure certaine either change thought aduenture march forward may well cost loose come short wretched greedy desire victorie conquest doe thinke meane time troupe shall commit vnto remaine shut vp restrained within enclosure walles one faint courage degenerating ancestor hide selfe corner high place tower amongst child take vp stande beholde enemie spoyling fieldes suffer destruction landes liuings like calamity assured cowardize shall neuer come within heart enemie shall see daily continually euen face ensignes souldiers trie fortune assay attempt plaine battell open fight god aiding better kind pollicie may verie litle small losse men shall make desseignes audacitie amurath turne smoake vanish away nothing hencefoorth shall haue enough constrained giue ouer quarrell leaue baggage vnto prey bootie leastwise loue see campe long continuance enemy countrie field stranger midst many discommodities brought passe shalbe rather estate armie forced besieged besieger one forceth others vp noble catholique prince let v set aside delay let v visite prouince let v set downe good lawes order discipline let v leauie muster souldiers let v lead force infidel come sight sound trumpet doe call souldiers battell vnprouided seeke counsell time let v make shewe vnto posteritie let v make knowen vnto age come hereafter men worthie christian empire oration scanderbeg ended great personage tributarie scanderbeg loue shamefull libertie better warres accompanying occasioning misfortune doe thou receiue valiant prince consent god man receiue say gage pledge good heart great magnificent yet leastwise ingrate vnthankefull adiudge giue thee freely libertie albanie mine owne maintenance estate crowne people child praying thee hencefoorth thou wouldest vse common men force thing either fortune vertue sufficiently tried knowen haue reserued vnto handes enemie doe present vnto thee redoubted prince albanois letviz amurath scanderbeg chosen king epyre first call acknowledge thee name worthy defender libertie doe offer thee without exception time warre peace immediatly vpon act many others moued certaine iealouzie theirprinces epyre ioyne league aide scanderbeg owne motion sesse taxe themselues becomming tributary vnto according qualitie power abilitie andrewe tanusee nephew inferiour none liberalitie meanes great summe money gathered instant defray charge warre may report ranne partes reuenue scanderbeg amountreuenewes scanderbeg crownes yeare two hundreth thousande crownes yeare possessed within prouince large compasse circuit prince yet gainesaide hee ouerchargeable burthensome subiects exacting vpon alone huge summe especially time warre kindled partes without ceasing inhabitant man may say one hande holding plough sworde yet man peraduenture alleage supplie asalt belonging scanderbeg campupescupi selite nicholas great part charge benefite certaine excellent good saltpits part countrie called campupescupi betweene mountaine place named selite one side nicholas de la pierre side countrie verie famous rather infamous reason notable desaster great mishappe befell romaine senate besieged time caesar dictator take armes pompey owne natiue countrey purpose residue companie power abilitie furnishe tax subsidy promise imployment person liberally freely continuall labour trauell venetian woulde derogate anie thing maiestie greatnesse would taxe selues bee tyed residue aduauncing anie certaine ordinarie contribution promised readie time ayde helpe victualles anie kinde succour nowe worthie personage beene made thus beholding vnto infinite number prayses officious courtesy according striue therein either lesse surmount solemne publique prayer procession generally made better strengthening fortifying league companie accompanie croie rest retyred themselues owne home first appointed come thithersfetygrade yeelded moses moses hauing streightened neere pressed sfetigrade rendered vnto composition beene called backe troupe frontier excepting left vpon certaine mountaines keepe good watch besides put garrison within towne bandes exceede number fiue thousand men castriot comming thence former assembly licensed many depart meanes whereof without delay commission made dispatched many great men sent abroad leauy souldiers part whilest thing thus within epyre may thinke braynes amurath also vnbusied forget anything touching subiect warre hee enterprised hatred fiercenesse courage nowe raised armie fortie thousande horsehaly bassasent armie scanderbeg men choise committed haly bassa one leader man valiant person matter aduise counsell well tryed approued sufficiencie attayned manie high degree great charge honour warres much brauerie troupe reputation chieftaine giue easie hope good assurance happie fortunate successe talke heard amongst turkes armie warre epyre opinion conceite generall iourney whosoeuer heard would haue iudged scanderbeg beene alreadie taken prisoner hee beene euen nowe going suffer punishment execution doe wee see sometimes siege towne assaylantes taken doe thinke haue victorie without bloud doe often fall contention amongst themselues parting deuiding spoile bootie propertie vsuall accustomed spirites mortall men reckon without hoast promise themselues great matter without paine difficultie cause euen epyre nowe nothing disorder confusion reason trouble seemed approch brute comming bassa made thing seeme greater fearefull truth deede man might haue seene side dwelt field hastinga notable description tumult confusion amongest common people inuasion expected saue themselues townes driuing cattell burgess fortifying walles appointing gardes porte enemie beene alreadie discouered olde men quaking trembling would put young men minde countrie wiues child honour god religion especially would cry vpon good courage hardie would neuer cease inflame animate might better doe deuoire dutie neither weake tender sexe woman free publique feare terror embolden runne streetes amongst armed husband sometimes stirring vppe vertue manhood iust pitifull lamentation sometimes extreame care running temple holy place making vowes prayer orizons vnto god altar prince large ample testimonie loyaltie like manner one thing scanderbeg also shewe notable example hiscourage resolute assurance scanderbeg maruellous courage assurance giuing world occasion wonder yea haly bassa enemie sort considered fact doe doubt would haue made greatly abashed whereas many fierce warrelike people nation resort vnto great abundance partes might well haue made one many great mightie army comended magnified good affection would admit choisest retaine himselfe eight thousand horse seuen thousand foote ouerplus old band new encrease licensed depart notwithstanding disposed certaine place diuerse accidentes occurrence euery man wondered abashed deuise prince hardie aduenturous opinion act proceeded doubt least haue disgrace ouercome set battell afterwards want meanes relieue himselfe occasion beleeue furnish many fortress force garrison willing reserue supplement remainder defence time come inconueniences ouerthrow meanes wherof might way surprise extort victorie hand enemie beginning perhaps waxe insolent prosperitie notwithstanding neuer heard speake matter continually cheerefull countenance promise himselfe assured good fortune successe thing answerable desire maketh thinke affirme reason retayned time small force beleeue proceeded singular confidence remained thing commonly seene especially great excellentconfidence fortune seldome faile great excellent nature nature seldom neuer doe find themselues abused deceiued fortune marked yea admired scanderbeg almost continually verie small force obtained infidel many often victory almost incredible hauing oftentimes rauished held suspence hath made history deliuer many aduentures posteritie truth wherof yet sunke owne mind opinion yet may hereafter amisse inconuenient beleeue denied age doe bring foorth strange case accident intent haue matter maruell true may beholde principall example like valure good fortune looke euen age hunyades whohunyades despot transiluania father mathias coruinus king hungarie many time manner alone foile confounde puissance turkes small number obtained trophees victorie manie others haue bene much better accompanied whose number haue exceeded stand longer curiosity vpon truth credit matter seeing without singular impudencie man denie thing fresh late memorie whereof litle wanteth father might eies haue bene witness scanderbeg hauing enrolled taken generall view muster souldiers publique vowes prayer offered vnto god euery man according owne fancie departed croy encamped neere lower dibria euery day heard newes enemy approched therupon bethought himselfe newly made chieftaine captaine ought vse speech new souldiers cause commaunding silence thus beganoration scanderbeg souldiers marching speake vnto would wish companion happened vpon captaine might haue enioyed notable faithfull seruice affaire bene greater prosperity time wherin reigne bene happy fortunate nowe ashamed many bondes obligation whereby see selfe tyed vnto would haue inuited discommodities new warres many fresh mischieues hauing bene well receiued entertained citizen would haue yeelded ease leisure patience due thankes recompence long time prepared selfe render vnto chieftaine seeth souldiers embrued couered blood would make spare selfe recompence labour trauels daungers blood enemy haue heretofore shed valiantly seeing destiny haue ordained pleaseth fortune must discouer vnto affaire must occasion rather paine tranquilitie rest consider pray standeth v vpon endure valiantly patiently submit selues whatsoeuer difficulty warre shall bring intent one day may liue peace quiet behoueth v willingly francke readie mindes take armes breake bondes long seruitude bondage enemie chased partes afterwardes reioice selues happie kinde life perdurable lasting libertie whereunto needfull paine selfe animate incense doe shew selues affectioned take part certaine wordes saying doe increase hardinesse men couragions ad hereunto canne say vnto weapon hand armes ought know owne selues enemy haue nowe neare aduerise thereof sufficiently indignitie many iniuries wrath hatred haue conceiued doe admonish doe arme yoke bondage shaken broken libertie body soules mortall hatred amurath qualitie barbarian cruell commandementes horrible execution wherewith doth aduance himselfe sucke vp blood last proces finall ruine destruction v past fully concluded doe inuite take armes countrey loue whereof containeth loue ought thinke haue neuer shed sufficient blood particular vertue euerie one v honour nobilitie kindred doe strengthen courage anie man let animate friendes betake armes sharpen launce haue pursuite procurement speedily without losse one drop blood recouered croie seate forefather spare defence thereof shed bloud neede daye wherein hope oportunitie doe present themselues vnto recouerie countrey long time lost raysing great high fortune haue chosen either companion captaine wil last labor hazard whatsoeuer peraduenture thing forwardnes shal seconded good fortune yet neuerthelesse make known vnto condition conceites wile policy enemy may diuine ordinance haue spent part yeares owne hindrance haue bene instructed end might serue ayde present would vnpleasing vnto heere report vnto base vile condition hope maketh promise victorie lesse painefull doth render souldier resolute deliberate thing dreg scum slaues raskals gathered together accustomed theftes robbery true warre iust kinde fight combat certaine sort men whose name famous amongst person fearefull timerous turkes slaues fugitiues scythian originall turkes whose father say dwelling beyonde ryphean mountaines isle tarracont euen heart bosome north northerne ocean nation filthy villanous opprobrious nourished dennes secret corner filthie place discerning flesh wolues vulture doe fill satisfie hunger vpon humaine abortiue body hardly glorifie themselues one battell gotten well honestly may haue vsurped fraude deceite large ample dominion time time daily purchase better fayrer long matter shall giuen whereupon exercise treason infidelitie nowe thinkes see amurath betaketh himselfe wile sleightes subtelties assayes shall able preuaile beholde marke well subtell cautelous ottoman make faire goodly promise vppon hope others misfortune seemeth vnto belike kinde people like vnto greekes bulgarian misians beeing inueigled blinded owne misfortune destruction conuenient simply good faith yeelded themselues vnto good prince either driue exile banishment depriuei side e amurath greekes others sight mangle deforme member wholly disfigure nowe tell friendes admonish esteeme set whome haue consecrated life bloud intent may glue subiect ample large occasion either commende accuse present doe thinke needefull either prayse dispraise man iudgement made souldier onely brauing vaunting himselfe within campe make censure desert see swordes smoaking bloud turkes selfe beholder encourager immitate prowes prodigall life safetie time heape vpon sortes commendation rewardes one doe feele courage waxe colde cowardice measuring force enemie thinke surmount number surmount also vertue let freely depart dislodge hence speake good houre feare least going v hee serue rather make vppe number giue v ayde succour let retire hence owne home presentlie opinion feare common vnto generall neither god man make ashamed let v reenforce strenthen armie newe supplyes else let v turne face retire speedily shall redoubt stand feare page missing follow troupe horse couer themselues vnder side meanes whereof might better able safe gard themselues enemie endammage barbarian grieuously mistrusted kind matter ordering betweene one troupe stoode george strese knight hardie couragious accompanied souldiersgeorge strese youth croy round hauing disposed purposely might beholder encourager citizen squadron archer followed maine bodie infanterie namely band pike targatyers conducted aidyn brother gnee musachee vranocontes sage andaidin vranocontes expert warrior rest horseman led rereward supply strong close batallion compounded flower olde souldiers best men holding themselues firme like bulwarke rallay retraite troupe broken forced recule romaine named triarij troupe footman marched commanded charge assoon see fellowes breake forth buscado enemie charged behind entangled betweene two point wing armie suddenly spread themselues opening rancks giue way vnto men armes new terror disorder enemie one charge strike vpon alreadie wearied sore trauelled said footman closing ioyning themselues againe troupe owne place together supply stand fast keepe batallions broken endammaged till time might see manifest apparant likelihood victorie enemie full disaray disorder manner scanderbeg martialled troups caused holde close without suffering trumpet giue signall fight till sawe bassa also arranged order battell aduancing forward feared least souldiers disbanding themselues ouermuch haste rashnesse encounter breaking order reason great furie desire aduance themselues bring estate whole armie encombrance generall turkes considering order battelles aduanced forwarde way mockery often repeated wordes euer euer quoth doe greater deuour lesser open throate laughed see themthe battell betweene scanderbeg haly bassa raunged foolish pompe christian marching formally thought owne funeral one ottoman legion come forward great hardinesse others charged speedily neerely forlorne hope christian gaue backe forsooke place suddenly two army affronted ech verie first beginning suffered theselues beaten backe euen within trench retyring themselues faster good pace prince albanie misdoubting turkish stratageme sent forth part horseman stay furious pursuit souldiers bring euery man place like hapened left wing therefore one retyred troupe prepared themselues againe future conflict come vnto full battell army mahometists encouraged mockerie deceiued many christian wherefore maine fight beganne tanuse moses parting betwene two wing enemie went fiercely encounter castriot like furie pricking forward cheerefully horse assaile batallion enemie himselfe made choise one time also ambushment ready breake forth wood high loud cry clamour enemie force giuen vppon squadron come equally medley manie company turkes perceiuing especially rereward possessed sudden feare leauing campe charge betooke themselues flight vowarde surprised inclosed two wing christian see themselues exposed butcherie slaughter middle legion one batallion onely enemie scanderbeg able breake durst set vpon well defended reenforced barbarian made greatest number people sure safe rampier safetie whole armie soone knowen bassa haly enuironned stoutest strongest force armie maintaine euent hazard battell verie long time wauering vncertaine meane aydin hauing charged vpon middle warde turkish armie pressing hard vppon legion filled murther bloudshedde tumult bloudie desperate anie part fight enemie seeing meanes fasetie left onely armes greatest furie might forced vppon men swordes point intent might die vnreuenged hazarde vnfortunate errour warre brought thither encounter came others still running succour thinking accesse force haue relieued companion sorte turkes made head thitherwardes thicker resorted encounter much longer doubtfull would resistance haue beene vranocontes fresh lustie courage force dismarching instant falling pell mell amongest wearied wauering ended battell ouerthrowen remayned moued christian chiefetaine minde hoast inuade infidel late come ayde men harde estate sawe two winges cornet garde selfe prince side beset busied hauing handes full beginning would remaine altogether vnfurnished destitute supplyes succour therefore deferred employment horseman made choice time occasion fitte proper weaken force giue checke ouerthrowe hence grewe anie one almost escape awaye safetie passed vnder sworde christian excepting onely three hundreth vppon lifting vppe handes mercie casting awaie weapon people wearied spent woundes castriot would permit extreame rigour victorie vsed occasion whereof troupe scanderbeg goodly exploite militarie trauell accomplished ended came exceeding great reioycing andvictorie scanderbeg haly bassa turkes acclamation presence generall founde thing wished desired croyans wholy broken battallion bassa wonderfull slaughter pursue turkish generall saued himselfe losse horse nothing seene heard side bloud massacre cryes lamentation men drawing end tooke prisoner others leauing behind trunkes dead body deformed cut heades make present generall manie also fell rifling baggage according mind men egerly set gaine profit finally throughout campe mention made victorie memorable almost incredible euen especially ouercome vanquished euerie man abashed maruellous execution short time fight continued sunne rising till third houre battell besides foure twentie ensignes taken turkes prisoner slaine vpon place two twentie thousand christian therenumber turkes slaine died verie said missing one hundreth twentie wounded farre greater number manner men day obtaine notable victorie vpon miscreantes according expectation hope generall withall hard encounter nothing forgotten might onely inuite also compell fortune fauour euent issue battell oportunitie place good order notable reason might esteemed iust necessarie drawe man hazard battell carefully diligently obserued speake captaines souldiers dare well affirme iourney lyon lyon leader conducters great number olde souldiers time borne armes euen vnder father scanderbeg would haue taken souldiers master teacher arte militarie sort thinke nowe haue made end warre meanes winning battell haue abated bragges audacitie turkes scanderbeg nowe master fielde held himselfe quiet within campe residue day night following next morning courage yet boyling good hap encounter busied himselfe taking order remained especially animate souldiers enterprise verie conuenient needefull lesse delightfull themselues witte ouerrunning sacking enemy countrey thereforeoration scanderbeg souldiers inuiting spoile turkish territorier vsed like wordes vnto hitherto souldiers haue foughten prince euen till day till nowe haue shewed done deuoire countrey henceforward owne profession doth inuite owne good fortune doth summon continue haue begunne behold partes legion enemie vertue ouerthrowen discomfited nowe may number recount owne prowes valiant deedes may secretly thoughtes promise yourselues great reward singular recompence prepared prouided many labour much blood many trauels suffered battell protest vnto faith expectation shall frustrate farre forth shall find meanes possibilitie verie well sufficiently conceiue minde commendation praise generall particular onely reward shall expect let make selfe litle merrie courage souldiers canne content themselues praise onely good haue time wherewith may honour valure hereafter shall haue thing abundance dispose assure selues depart vnto bountifully receiue pleasing better courage according men iudgement opinion honor glory ech shall carie home triumph conquest atchieued owne arme proper vertue beholde neare hand territorie enemy rich plentifull wealth sort gallantise prowesse hath disfurnished made bare naked defence therefore good leysure ease doe charge loade selues prey spoyle thereof left abandoned pleasure discretion let feare enemy farre wide know conquerours euen say natiue countrey shall presently see retourning home chearefull ioyous triumphant small encrease benefite vnto come peece seruice excellent neuerthelesse intent may sayed also sort haue rewarded dayes victory one haue occasion enuy seeing vertue fight alike equall doe ordaine appoint footemen shall take horse slaine enemy henceforth shall serue horsebacke men armes therefore vnder fauour great god let euery man follow chearefully maie goe reape acceptable gladsome fruites perfect full deuoyre souldiours listened verie attentiuelie speachesspoile sack enemy countrey permitted sca derbeg souldiors verie great signification ioy gladnesse men ouerioyed hope prey booty expect spoyling enemy countrey approue encouragement ran therefore euery without discretion without order without conduct stirred pricked assured sodaine contempt negligence proceeding seemeth happy good successe prince well aduised hauing affiaunce inconstant fickle fauours fortune stayed fury violence souldiours till time hee sent make discouery bring backe word daunger sacke pillage permitted freely men armes altogether puffed vppe late victory gotten dispersed diuerse place cast selues vppon enemy country caried away good husbandman person cattell neither furie spare shew selfe vppon verie tree nothing pardonned kinde soeuer whereunto fire sword might doe dammage displeasure excepting onely woman child booty gathered drawen together driuen confusion noise debate man woulde haue iudged bene begun new tumult warres fieldes bene full men fighing combatting woundes withhold hinder anie one greedie desire pillage drawen thither many wounded battell paine trauels lately taken quite forgotten cleane vanished away neither labour waightinesse burthen discourage one excesse aboundance spoyle commonly causeth wearinesse satiety satisfie content much griefe sorrow souldiors greater leauing could beare away ioy contentment caried thus continued long enough spoyling foraging rage souldiours mitigated appeased vppon countrey enemy castriot caused sound retraite men ouerloaden prey bootie marched awaie presentlie great gladnesse ioy captaines made themselues mery sloth lazinesse souldiors reproaching braue valiaunt warriours become sheepestealers defendours glory renow albanie men might see chaunged habite trade sheepeheardes thus scoffing sometimes one sometimes another many pleasaunt iestes wordes mockerie like manner sayed woulde halie bassa saie reliques discomfiture hee euen nowe place see point dragging vile base baggage neither worth valour fitte reward couetous greedy souldiours would hee blushe extreamely vile shamefull conquerours would hee reproach men faintnesse cowardize hadde suffered selues surmounted ouercome sort base companion hadde yeelded vnto men honour glorie combate thus souldiours full mirth merriment diuerse sportes song full ioy gladnesse case mittigate hard trauell way till time high cry clamour saluted guardes campe marched night following past within campe scanderbeg next morning daie breake commaunded trusse vp baggage hoast triumphaunt marched directly towardes croie multitude scattered euery throughout high way passage salute call generally priuately triumphant valiaunt euery man admired greatnesse spoiles gotten enemy hardly new made men beene wound wee may continually bewaile much one mishappes misfortune time iohn castriot father god pardon prince vnderstand excellent merite desert oppressed amurath taken world vngratefull destenies deuout men armes christian v long since ready armes well appointed thing doe wee attend ensignes sure meane time refuse fitte opportunitie god graciouslie sendeth v vanquishe common troublesome enemy wholly determine warre chase driue away turkes dispossesse europe long time occupied wrongfully vsurped neede take vse kinde perswasion vnto cause quarrell defence whereof doth purchase v safety light liberty contrariwise abandoned forehalsen may come wee christianso christiant would well payze consider wordes haue beene slacke backeward deuoyr helpe succour flame hath well neare consumed v yet haue none meane time bene aduised perswaded fire would passe come neare vnto selues doth estate greekes represent vnto v condition triballians last mine owne loss iliade recount vnto v mischieues wee haue endured doe daily menace v many braue valiaunt prince bulwarke defence hungarie loose time time aswell puissant army consumed brought nothing one fatall chaunce warre almost wholly extinguished dayes iourney andrinople streight gulfe betweene two pointes promontory vppon one seated galata vpon macropolis bottome valley right hand inhabited husbandman seuerall small village hamlettes slenderly peopled frequented left hand galata standeth great marshe foot hils extending forth still standing water euen valley neare hand bendeth towards occident amurath aduertised trouble towardes whit discouragedamurath marcheth christian hauing liuely repulsed caramanian reassured countrie natolia made doubt difficultie anie thing onely howe might transport armie ouer sea reason fleete bishoppe rome duke burgundie take hope passage sort thatinfidelitie able auarice christans helping turkes passe europe streight hellespont made great haste march christian till time certaine marchants genowayes true reported free deliuer care consideration great rewarde promised agreed vppon giuen certaine narrow vvhich old named bosphorus thracius mile halfe aboue constantinople streight sea suspition faith greekes subiects within europe armie transported marched speede celeritie incredible within seuen day came pitch tentes within foure mile christian campe neere thevarna dionisiopolis continued vantgard turkish armiethe battell varna betwen vladislaus king hungarie amurath great turke receiued couragiously pressed furie christian victorie beene alreadie gotten soone disordered put flight pursued two mile much amurath himselfe beene driuen shift owne safetie two bishoppes varadia strigonia better skilled portuisse practised armes disbanded selues vnaduisedly forsaken thebishops varadia strigonia folly hinder victorie christian place assigned onely chasing enemie side broken occasion great freshe troope turkish archer horsebacke charging flancke side abandoned left vndefended finde easie entrie vppon greatly troubled rankes footemen shower tempest shotte arrowes powred vppon thicke thinne hunyades valachians running speedily thither presently vppon arriuall chaunged fortune fight continued long time doubtfull vncertaine afterwardes hauing eye open partes occasion wheresoeuer saw owne force haue worst succoured left wing also sore encombred able sustaine endure shocke enemy notwithstanding still vphelde maintained good point yet would hinder amurath meane time founde leasure opportunity really himselfe encouragement haly bassa made head squadron ianissaries renued perill encounter hunyades great doubt feare young king whose fiery haughty courage giue great cause suspect hazard misaduenture rashnes temeritie indeede fell vnfortunate prince hardie inuinciblevladislaus ouergreat hardinesse rashnesse courage broken vpon rankes ianissaries fighting beating men armes vpon troupe horse serued gard amurath person great number men horse laide ground slaine others hauing legges cut maymed much could longer march vppon plaine ground constrained make themselues way vppon heapes dead body ech pressing rushing vppon others egerly fiercely man would haue iudged rather meere rage furie ardent vehement desire victorie animated conflict ianissaries stoutly sustained force violence hungarian company king yet himselfe end breake amongst politiquely receiued middest battallion whereof ensued held either dead taken prisoner instant turkes turning backes readie flie away christian also side hauing left king beginne abandon place steede fighting disaray fearefully shamefully forsake rankes made himselfe way middest thickest presse come place vladislaus thenhunyades perswadeth vladislaus retyre preuent vtter ouerthrowe shewed disorder affray confusion christian hee cryed called vnto requested entreated turne bridle yeelde vnto present mischance hazard vtter mischiefe misfortune entire discomfiture yet great good hope victorie attended onely hazard endaunger owne realmes dominion state europe whole bodie christendome perswasions reason notwithstanding king still thrusting himselfe vndiscreetly midst enemy sharpe furious conflict notable good seruice greennesse prouince macedonie fresh remembrance despot good desert great force efficacie much moue men vniuersally opinion affirme openly safest fittest time needfull necessarie abate pull downe strength puissance scanderbeg feare lest roades made vpon plaine countrey often molestation townes village might seeke occasion vsurpe vpon macedony make himselfe lord master prouince malicious mind rage furie stomacke sufficiently shew selfe late manner wholly disfurnished disarmed owne dominion left without anie defence garrison onely ioyne himselfe vladislaus greatest force puissance intent thereby abolish extinguish memorie turkish name empire fiercenes speedily repressed doubt would soone solicite procure puisance power christian ioyne vpon consideration sultan fully resolued make warres vpon scanderbeg thinke forthwith andvvarre determined scanderbeg speedily haue gathered force haue leauied armie forasmuch greater part better men bene slaine consumed warre hungarie misfortune haly bassa yet continue fresh remembrance put mind difcomfiture besides olde growen yeares desirous passe spend remainder life rest quietnesse bethought himselfe deuise inuention strange new vaine foolish whereby supposed notable arte cunning singular deceit falshoode found good happie successe deceiue beguile others might likewise ouerreach entrappe open violence force armes could conquer bring vnder iudgement shall seeme neither strange vnpleasant mindes shall peruse ad place manner stile letter sent ottoman endeuored entise allure minde scanderbeg trie turne wind side amurath ottoman soueraigne turkes emperour orientletters amurath scanderbeg scanderbeg ingrate foster sonne neither wisheth health sendeth greeting honor benefites wherewith could adorne raise thee greatnes court long thou wert neuer made spare bestowed bountifully vpon thee scanderbeg men liuing vngratefull want fit word termes speake vnto thee multitude thy crime disloialties wherewith thou hast offended maiestie wounded verie soule know well kind speech vse vnto thee thee say wert domesticall household seruant neither rough sharpe language mollifie thy hard harted courage whose nature fierce arrogant neither doest thou deserue anie gracious wordes kindnes speech hast mightily exceeded excelled kind fiercenes beastiallitie thou mightest omit occasion make thee hatefull odious vnto mee thou hast growen madnes thou diddest cast aside care thine owne benefit safetie thy citizen comparison loue affection thou diddest carrie hungarian lately armed could content let passe silence matter touch handle wound thou hast made minde might perswaded forget many deceites notable example ingratefull part deserue concealed neuerthelesse hold necessarie length though perhaps somewhat late sort admonish thee lay open thee thy ill desertes farre least furie thy pride arrogancie suddenly carrie thee away headlong ruine destruction together thy vnhappie vnfortunate kingdome thou wouldest willing make confession obstinacie error time thou shalt haue left vnto thee helpe remedie thy affaire brought exigent extremitie desperate estate haue hitherto enough much endured outrage much hast thou prouoked ottoman empire thy great intollerable iniuries yet haue shewed selfe patient suffering tollerating manie wronges mischieues dost thou think thou shalt acquitted thy treacherie wherwith thou betraiedst armie hungarie doest thou imagine thou shalt goe vnpunished withdrawing many townes obeysance epyre many garrison thou hast caused slaine murthered doest thou suppose thy misdeedes lately done perpetrated shall go free vnchastized armie haly bassa destroyed manie inuasions fierings territory tumult warre hungarie vttermost thy abilitie euen late thou diddest set forwarde besides spoyling father lawe dominion would suffer thee haue passage countrie would thou wouldest last remember thy selfe wicked wretch continue longer expecting wilbe end issue displeasure iust indignation take heede slight enlargement thy prosperitie doe animate encourage thy disordinate appetite draw thee foolish desire passe thy fortune hereafter made much miserable doe moue euen hate thee selfe especially pitie compassion thy hard wretched estate lest curtesie humanitie thy desperate gracelesse mind remember thy selfe yet last bountifull benefites thou hast receaued giue longer occasion repent haue bestowed vnthankefully although vnseemely vnciuill part obiect vnto man good liberalitie hath bene shewed yet token great ingratitude soone easilie forget merite forepassed benefit wherefore cannot sorrowfull thy forrune scanderbeg take pitie vpon thy vnhappy estate setting apart safetie thy soule whereof man past hope vtterly giuen ouer phisitian thou takest care makest account reckoning yet speake thing thy contempt lawes mahomet small estimat thou makest diuine prophet one thing vaine blind delight wherein thought men take pleasure haue bountifully yeelded vnto thee art caried away base vile regard thy poore sorie kingdome hadst thou plentie armour horse great huge traines slaues aboundance gold siluer superfluitie thing commonly allure entise estate age affect diddest thou euer want fit continuall occasion exercise thy vertue aduance thee glory great estate place charge either peace warre kinde honour fit agreable thy yeares summe court greater fauorite grace thy selfe either stranger naturall subiect amongst inward secret friend pleasing acceptable vnto carefully diligently prouide haue thee nourished brought vp time thou wert first brought vnto knowledge learning good manner discipline willingly continually aduaunce forwardnesse thy vertue saw grow encrease daily sometimes recompences rewardes sometimes possible meanes praise commendation honor renowne armes nothing accounted helde honourable commendable therein made thee glorious kinde seruices whatsoeuer neither take notice souldier regard thee neither seeme set captaines comparison grace honor vnto thee merit good desert thou scanderbeg hast length well rewarded hauing shewed thy selfe one seemeth haue exalted man tooke thee haue norished plague pestilence within mine owne house familie loue thy natiue countrie wound thy soule sollicite thee doe thou hast done thou hadst required restore vnto thee doest thou thinke would haue denied vnto thee seeing often vndemaunded thou list remember freely voluntarily make offer vnto thee thou notwithstanding haddest rather haue thy selfe thy owne misdeedes iniquitie benefite receiued gift proceeding bountie keepe therefore still name god neither shall discontented therewithall protest vnto thee great clemencie towardes haue beene sort familiarly knowen vnto doe nowe freely pardon former fault offence merit thine owne iust none doe euen middest publique hatred dislike pleaseth call minde manifolde benefites thou hast receiued first faith loyaltie finde thee thou wert longer time continuance good seruice thou diddest offence wherewith thou hast wronged mee croy state thy father although thou hast seized vpon fraude treacherie doe permit thee enioy frankely condition thou doe voluntarily resigue restore townes epyre wherein thou hast right interest doe equitie appertaine vnto haue heretofore purchased fortune warres mine owne vertue besides thou doe presently without delay repossesse father law good misians farre may wanting supply make good money hencefoorth thy life thou holde lesse crime fellonie offer violence either anie repute friend manner meanes whatsoeuer grace aide comfort enemy thou maiest euer shunne auoide malice hatred turkes shalt thou haue good grace fauour neither lesse thou hast heretofore time past thou haddest rather though vaine seeke place repentance thou hast bene beaten rod thine owne miserie thine owne presumption audatious obstinacie shall haue drawen thither person take reuenge thereof mercilesse implacable maner thou knowest well puissance force thou art ignorant force strength mine army thou hast thine eye notable example calamitie hungarie therefore needest admonishmet conclusion whatsoeuer thy determination would least thou write vnto thou maist haue coference airadin airadin gent amurath scanderbeg agent man secret faithfull thou shalt vnderstand residue would commit writing farwell thou well aduised andrinople iune generation iesus scanderbeg
