reparation wrong bene offered confederate set downe manie condition without reason equitie intent might obtaine reasonable commodious doubt would contented accept peace yeeld vnto termes submission castriot himselfe would set downe prescribe vnto without would make question either losse epire warres misia albanois could content abstaine armes assure peace quietnes wherfore make peace ottoman vpon termes conclude abstinence warre time could greatly honor aduantage rather himselfe first motion inuite parley therefore would otherwise many great commodity would thereby redound inhabitant prouince accident issue warre verie doubtfull point small wisedome neither well aduised would preferre trouble rest quietnes neither ought man ground course successe good fortune vpon first beginning good happe prosperitie hungarian often happily foughten turk albanian yet ouerwhelmed late misfortune might vaine frame complaintssentence record vnspeakeable dammages loss therefore farre better acte shew courtesie humanitie make frend enemie incense disdaining refusing peace profered franckly discourse thus debated presence scanderbeg albeit partscanderbeg excepteth messenger peace amurath appearance truth yet presently impugne contradict seeming bewaile complaine follie epirots onely nation world owne excessiue dammage last would take notise wile deceites ottoman strange thing vaine idle impertinent letter amurath meete encounter beleefe credulitie farre vaine sottish purchase credit faith among wit people could dull sencelesse thinke airadin spie intelligencer reputed one sent vnto name credit ambassador besides admit danger deceite matter thing according amurath written yet lightnes inconstancie giue faith credit enemy rather owne actes estate owne affaire fortune rather owne make chaunge counsailes determination concerning peace warres true quoth amurath declining life turkes battell varna haue receiued mortall deadly blow besides accident inuite barbarian desire rest quietnesse thing giue occasion albanian either abate loose courage receiue condition peace enemy vanquished dare present vnto vanquisher neither thing regarded imagined condition might allowed reiected could way accept peace would ignominious neither could warelie circumspectly handle matter sultan would soone perceiue fearefulnesse mindes difference meanes admit peace made let imagined amurath would sit still glad quietnesse till tumultes growing vpon late ouerthrow hungarian throughly appeased till time quenched flame beginning kindled might till epirots enioy benefite peace notwithstanding afterwardes likelihood would turne whole violence war vpon neckes full force would seeke oppresse vaine obiect vnto violating article agreement concluded betweene neither age amurath impotent decrepit would make vtterly vnapt vnable warres counsell wisedomesentence generall ought respected bodily strength puissance prudence leader matter age vsually redoubted promptnesse hand rash temeritie foolish hardinesse vsing sword weake feeble body remaine spirite sound quicke watchfull aduantages opportunity hart full fraught mortall hate extreme mallice though ottoman would dealing yet could find enemy forgot also shew small short could profit peace make one old drawing last end fierce hautie courage restlesse minde sonne mahomet would aime attempt greater matter sure peace warre profit faile warre would glad rest quietnesse meanes whereof benefit good epirotes profit aduantage turkes reason therefore desire peace seeing victorie euen already hand enemy himselfe seeme auouch lesse openly confesse wherefore follow prosperous winde pleasant gale good fortune enioy occasion freely offered whereof opportunitie slide away let passe vaine would repent hereafter laid better hold vpon shame speake composition woundes lately receiued battell haly bassa yet cured first recouer seate ancestours assure libertie many people subiectes finde oportunitie accord either propounding accepting honest honorable condition peace composition possible remembrance discon iture vladislaus giue notable impression feare terrour accident chance warre alienate mindes epirotes warre hungarian sustained ouerthrowe report went amongst common people huniades burne vehement desire reuenge losse ignominie battell varna secretly plot deuise meanes raise new armie vpon reason alleadged men wonderfully encouraged thissubiects scanderbeg resolued holde warres amurath matter obedient vnto scanderbeg people also verie much aggreiued repented opened mouthes matter liking vnwilling haue conceipt wise matter concerning seruice would refuse aduise counsell euer followed field campe whereupon prince albania hauing first called turkish ambassadour presence held long discourse sometimes apart sometimes full assembly subiectes long narration loss damage publique priuate complaining himselfe greatly disloialtie periurie amurath thus hauing gratiously entertained bountifully feasted fiue dayes cheerefull glad countenance full confidence assurance feare least sent spie coniecture imagine kind apprehension feare led owne companie shewed rampiers fortification courtes garde men warre giuing also sight forme manner campe returned answer writing effect george castriot otherwise scanderbeg champion iesus christ prince epirots ottoman prince turkes sendeth health time wherein thou writest thy selfe diddest surmount inletters scanderbeg amurath number multitude benefites vanquish thee modestie temperancie speech hold nothing base seruile abstaine euen deadly enemie leud speches dishonest termes causesentence haue seene entertained thy messenger haue receiued thy message good frendly manner speake truth thy letter haue giuen cause matter laughter rather wrath anger considering euen beginning entrie preamble thou aduenturest taxe great ingratitude infidelitie yet presently seeming moued tender kind affection thou alledgest vnto losse perdition soule whereas thy selfe vehement obstinate defender inuerterate grounded error art wholly ignorant wretched end destinie doth attend thee matter without obseruing anie rightes warre good forme proceeding vnaduisedly imprudently say impudently vanquisher one vanquished thou dost propound set downe many condition peace strange hardly free eares endure giue hearing assuredly amurath although outragious speech might arme patient man liuing returne like againe yet impute part thy aged yeares andsentence thy naturall disposition seeing propertie incident old men lauish tongue residue attribute thy griefe discontentment difficult hard moderate especially content suffer part meaning deliberation contend thee vaine dispute reproches iust armes courage true enmitie notwithstanding purpose pray thee ottoman doest thou take god man though giuen thee thou first offence doest thou count infidelitie reuolted following thee compelled thereunto necessitie doest thou obiect crime reproch vnto recouered countrey vertue industrie go let neither doe greatly care held guiltie trespasse benefites also shewed thou large orderly doest reckon vp selfe could bee verie well content remember knowledge thereof doeth draw dolorous remembrance infinite number great greeuous mischiefes calamity one bee compared recompensed assuredly greatnesse desertes merites would soone buried ouerwhelmed vnder greater heape mischiefes misdeedes hadde rather shame make mee blushe heare thy selfe thou doest recount driuen rehearse recite yet one thing soeuer knoweth cannot wonder greatly maruell either could haue power suffer endure thou heart neuer satiate satisfied many cruelty continuall daily practises mortall deadly hatred father kingdome wrongfully iniuriouslie hast thou detayned mee bretheren hast thou caused murthered cruelly selfe doubting suspecting anie matter diddest thou late wickedlie vowe destinate death yet doest thou amurath thinke straunge minde euen vnmindefull libertie hath sought meanes escape winde selfe hard bondage subiection long diddest thou thinke would haue endured thy insolent proud gouernment yet long time suffer many thing neither time refuse yoke thy seruice life time expose selfe peril daungers publique priuate mine owne disposition willingly thy commandement shewe obedience duty vnto thee euery day heare speaches dispersed concerning thee amongest friendes familiar heard talke ordinarily thy snare trappe layed yet perswaded long time thy wordes deedes free fraud malice treason till time thy wicked blouddy counsailes deuises discouer themselues apparauntly began time dissemble also carying watchfull care regard continually vpon thy sub leties pollicies till might finde honest conuenient meane enfranchise liberty thou hast thereby cause agreeued complaine seeing saying thou art wounded thine owne weapon yet trifle amurath respect thing hope desire heart hath conceiued doth ayme leaue therefore henceforth thy sharpe threates menace desist obiecting vnto v often lamentable mishappe misfortune hungarian man good sir hath owne courage one owne nature v whatsoeuer fortune shall please god send v wee take beare patiently meane neither take consell enemy haue doe neither seeke intreate peace thee relying vpon diuine fauour clemency endeuour triumph ouer thee glorious triumphant victorie adieu campe twelfth iulie ottoman hauing perused contentes scanderbeg letter learning ayraden word mouth rest cogitation deliberation nothing well pleased neither one contrary fierce liberall speach man wonderfull trust confidence knew proceede nothing ingender mighty feare terror rather sharpen anger displeasure formerly conceyued tooke manifest presage augurie difficulty warre albanie notwithstanding might bewray vnto people appearaunce feare cowardize reported smiling wise oftentimes stroaking hisamurath scorneful desp tefull speaches vpon receipt sca derbeg letter beard hand vtter speech thou doest couet vnhappy vnfortunate wretch thou doest couet memorable famous kinde death thou shalt haue beleeue thou shalt haue selues see thy obsequies perfourmed without expecting thy commaundement mightie king albanian honour reuerence thy funeral presence least hereafter hell thou doe complaine thy end ignoble dishonourable notwithstanding imagination thought sultan vncertaine irresolute middest difficulty rumour arose daily part huniades often message vnfaithfull despot misia pernicious old wretch infamous double treason enuious destiny reserued euen till time many misery calamity christian consideration say transport cary away mind else hinder trouble bending force turning waight burthen whole warre vppon kingdome epire meane neuerthelesse intent late iniury offered contempt refusall friendshippe confederacy might rest without present kinde punishment concluded nothing else yet would trouble molest peace quietnesse scanderbeg though able vtterly abolish effect imagined fit conuenient oportunity negligence christian heard growen carelesse secure manifold good fortune happy successe war scanderbeg hauing dismissed army keepe field horseman onely daily careleslie range abroade farre campe dispersed scattered desire prey pillageferisey sent scanderbeg amurath cause hee caused ferisey sent one bassaes man stirring fierce disposition quicke ready spirite hee gaue charge nine thousand horse chosen picked men hauing heaped vpon many great large promise case returned victorie hee wished desired commaunded enter epire speede secresie might comming might felt perceyued enemy reason made ottoman time send greater force either feare delay protracting time might worke dammage disaduantage rumour comming blowen abroade diuulged might awaken christian giue time leysure aduise themselues eschew perill addressing preparing new ambushmentes euent afterwardes made manifest frustrate disappoint traines master art subtelties whilest doe confidentlie sette downe matter touching thevarietie opinion touching amurath profession religious life counsailes amurath concerning manner mannaging forraine warres administration estate doubt many maruell iudgement opinion repugnant contrarie others maie inquisitiue knowe make mee differ varie common opinion seeing matter yet fresh memory many also haue committed lesse writing iustifying posteritie amurath latter dayes immediately vppon battell varna meditating lamenting sometimes vppon misery inconueniences prince sometimes vppon temeritie inconstancie fortune hee orderedhaly bassa gouernour mahomet sonne amurath domesticall affaire appointed halie bassa gouernour eldest sonne mahomet hee presently depriued himselfe crowne empire leauing andrinople care publique matter retayning small number companion counsell hee retired selfe asia vowed professed religious godly life according superstition forefather neither hee forsake kinde life till time despotte transiluania namely huniades come sophia cry daily sodainely man went euer furnished appointed casualty accident warre taking occasion time place first seized vppon certaine streight narrow valley namedthe valley mocrea mocrea onely place turkishe violence sodainly vnexpected presented selues enemy footman number one thousand fiue hundred besides two thousand horse least reserued better peece seruice turkes enough doe sufficiently beaten continue place enemy first charged horse rather hurt hinder benefite succour maisters end losse ouerthrow rider men besieged receiued tooke wound far could giue inflict vppon enemy yet appearaunce likelihood escaping daunger cleane taken euen shew themselues valiant hardy euer maintained fight greater obstinacy almost keeping selfsame place death set footing taken possession whilest aliue came put execution carefull diligence captaine let passe neglect one point charge bene giuen occasion serued hee added many good respectes hee came consider nature countrey haue view situation place scarcely displaied ensignes within confines christian bearing march campe large open field first sent forth three hundred horse beat ouer plaine champion discouer farre neare passage sound couerts troubleth comon rest others owne pleasure doth moue procure warres till time end miserable wretched issue receiueth iust chastisement vaine conceite imagination example hereof good friend represented vnto v enemie lesse proud presumptuous vnhappy audacity excessiue fortune growen point dareth raise warre vpon warre molest prince consider benefit hath receiued one thing excepting temeritie may attribute vnto wholly good hap affaire hath peruerted sens behooueth v onely time take armes publiquely priuate also hate mortally behold turne aside eies pitifull estate dainians intent iust wrath shold restore libertie else hauing lost hope cofort must enforced shamefully submit theselues leaue liues mercy castriot vnder view pride insolent vnmercifull victory like found one hauing bin long time nourished vp amog barbarian doth excell barbarousnes inhumanity omit matter greater temeritie folly notable leud example debarre men fro libertie protecting others right good possession meanes thereof wickedly purchase selfe al seize vpon vnder vaine pretence know copact agreement excuse greedie desire comand abrogating meanes taking away men right libertie ambitious mind enraged venetian preferred dainians impugneth voluntarie mind mother disposition heritage sonne deceased may see malladie infirmitie owne mind vehemency despight hath blinded inueigled transported enuie runneth headlong destruction could endure put care warre till time hauing chased away enemie turke daily dores might haue bin better able vnite force haue come al whole power execute hatred venetian neither hath bin well aduised ioyne battell v great force though sight towne besieged expert warrior hath separated force shewing therin vpright iudge cause whilst siege dayna one side care doubt mustapha doth suffer mind enioy rest quietnes hath reserued army fit enemie able encounter sacrifice rather slaughtered wherfore seeing many braue warrior handful robber goe charge valiantly cease till haue vtterly ouerthrowen let valure prowes enforce foolish vaineglorious heart either loue constraint acknowledge confesse theselues guiltie iniustice warre haue vndertaken iniuriously chastised folly shal need take care redoubt force remaining dayna pursuing good successe battell may one instant preuent purpose going charge first within issuing vppon backes shall enclose hedge side meanes whereof shall finish bring ende notable peece seruice exceedingly famous oration king epire milde sharpe inuectiue neither replenished ill speech tending disgrace others say neere effect followeth whether cause present warre iust time goodthe oration scanderbeg armiefriends quoth make question seeing come armed field nether debated view enemie considering especially self man made take armes neuer yet iust cause agreeued either refusing war lawfull seeking quarrel vnlawfull vniust seeing humain affaire nothing doth torment conscience good men curiously respected men warre come fight enemy enquire iustice quarrell may resolued whether shall contend god aswell men part good citizen content therfore thinke motion vndertaking war condemned rashnes temeritie thinke greedie desirous new warres trouble shall well pleased say neither hinder presently trusse vp baggage returne euery man home would traine force hazard person know wherfore neither desire troublesome estate affaire chiefest tumult epire obstinate minde seeke new quarrel cause contention segniorie venice therefore attempt purpose exempted free blame cause warre doe seeme vnto iust necessarie part also none haue reason interested cause effect vertue couragious perseuerance happie end euent shew testifie armes accompanied right equitie nothing reprochfull nobly minded neither anie thing repugnant dignitie maiestie prince suffer timorousnesse pusilanimitie right vsurped holde man would say finger vnder girdle knoweth right force armes none knoweth hartie amitie inwarde conuersation euer betweene seignior lech zacharie whose death lesse cruell grieuous hath stirred part many trouble induced thereunto mutuall affection one consent set downe lawe inuiolable soeuer v two first decease without issue seized compact right suruiuorship heritage dominion venetian haue gotten land left heire teares lament iniquity fortune agreemet hazard renouncing patrimony accident danger death comon men taken first away life haue reason therefore neither determined giue ouer warre except god put worst inuested quiet possessio dayna none fooles blame war whereunto good reason honest cause doth perswade let man maruell see armes christian venetian next neighbor seeing haue giuen iust occasion themselues haue manner put weapon hand true streight siege presse towne countrie owne kinsman owne bloud alliance yet ill intention imagine neither lead thereunto either vpon greedie desire comaund empire delight murther bloudshed wring citie hand aduersary draw vngratefull inhabitant least confession acknowledgement error obstinacie come fight enemie hath first prouoked v diuers act hostilitie resolue therefore courage assured honest resolution maintaine honor reputation may seeme souereignty dayna propounded reward co queror giue sufficient ample occasion take armes let pray conceipt enter thought comonly baites allure ambitious mind entisements base popular vulgar sort desire praise commendation sufficient animate stirre valiant yet obtain day victory al shal without controuersie enemie chased away besieged seeing hope frustrate copanions pressed extreame famine soone open gate receiue coquerors touching victory need say thing vnto haue always accustomed victor make proofe valure new enemy new kind glory doth attend doe venetian surpasse number honor haue purchased many battels haue alwaies bin lesser number hath euer heretofore made famous free gentle heart doth disdain ouercome euery man deuoire cannot seene purchase particular praise commendation againe aduantage haue number greater seeing amongst diuersitie language variety habit different vse armes great diuersity disagreement mindes courage army compounded many sundrie nation sclauonians italian albaneezes diuerse fashion confused kinde ignorance followe vnder one colour crie noyse fight diuerse sundrie sound much lesse auaileable encouragement leader march therefore good souldiers entrie beginning battell valiantly doe beate backe repulse disperse enemy better disposed flight fight see doe nowe renewe honour dayes iourney glorious renowne manie trophees victory haue heretofore gotten obtained vppon turkes neuerthelesse would carie selues towardes enemy rather vse moderation lesse choller inclined mercie clemencie doe labour rather haue prisoner haue slaughtered fieldes anie case doe either intemperate furie warre heate anger indignation pollute defile victorious handes bloud shall yeelde render themselues mercy barbarous fierce sauage nation haue deale christian contende according right lawes armes equitie iustice onely repulse iniustice liue rest quietnesse great modestie scanderbeg made shew speech morethe affection souldiers scanderbeg oration vehemently animate mind souldiers made affectionate vnto matter rare seldome seene bewray himselfe respectiue good lesse carefull enemie cause flocking prince praised applauded counsell ech affirming readie make proofe resolution offer themselues hazarde fortune battell defence onely increase also augmentation renowme glorie armes venetian redoubted opinion attributing much vnto make meane forget owne dutie deuoire dishonour ignominie offered danians faintnesse slouthfulnesse remaine vnpunished iniurie would common subiectes honour discouraged middest great broyles time wherien busied surcharged weight burthen double warre men able doe thing worthie honour commendation euerie idle consultation restraine suppresse vehemencie courage examine euerie particular kinde blockish slouthfull deliberation hardie man valiant ought aduenture himselfe march resolutely beare daungers head shoulder becommeth looke matter much curiositie augment owne feare strict examination thing interprete reueale vnto men mischiefes hidden many high difficult affaire haue beene surmounted ouercome furie resolute souldier fiercenesse courage stirred enflamed whereas mind free quietly disposed would dare aduenture vpon man ought also relie cast care wholly vpon god assisteth continually warre partie whose cause quarrell iust rightful neuerthelesse safety depend vpon valure yet state albany sufficiently defended protected faith mutuall amity owne people moreouer amurath withheld kept warre hungary knew power puissance venetian great withall ignorant italian farther drawn fro home slowly march proceed vnwillingly many like speches vttered confusedly amongst whole troupe souldiers according euery man disposition intent purpose also prince hearing deuises might take better notice good willes affection might shewe better countenance praysing extolling affection euery speaking aloud vnto manner iesting merriment smiling tolde nature much blame placed noble generous spirit albanois higher better fortune done castriot caused souldiers go refresh themselues hauing taken repast matter throughly prouided midday mind cheerefull confident drewe forth troupe field archer others lightly armed placed front ensignesorder armie albanoys corslet whose armes weightie made two wing appointing vnto horse tanusee giuen middle battell wherein likewise amongest men armes mingled certaine foot men touching rereward supply tooke care determined make knowen accounted victory sure enemie much easie vanquished venetian seeme make shew either assurance countenance furie forwardnesse first charge little regard take garding campe left emptie fewe defende hardly could haue held meanest companie theeues robber resolute assurance chiefetaine could haue beene exempted blame temeritie appointed strength force retraite company held siege dayna contrarie expectation seene enemy haue better purpose retire thither campe neither number souldiers situation nature place profite fortifie owne campe yet iudgement counsell farre vnworthie wisedome prudent inuention great captaine seeing troupe happened haue beene broken flight manner bene much dangerous pernicious courage obstinacie fight could haue wrought assurance venetian victorious pursuing taile passage riuer drynon made difficult great affray confused tumult must needes haue destroied swallowed remained wherfore truth must needes confesse opinion owne vertue accustomed vanquished make place hope himselfe onely venetiansorder armie venetian manner likewise affront ensignes pykes italian wing disposed order albanian daniell himselfe tooke charge right wing enuironned strong guard garrison sclauonians made choise purpose certaine men armes italian placed head rereward battallion colla humoy scutarie seconde man next thecolla humoy generall armie leading left wing accompanied owne citizen make head moses souldiers dybrians andrewe brother symon volcathagne guiding middlevolcathagne battell briefe rankes filled indifferently souldiers sundrie sortes seruing rather hinderance impediment anie defence good assurance venetian litle lesse thirteene thousand men andthe battell betweene venetian scanderbeg number battell foughten fight begunne pykemen first encounter repulsed archer came approach ioyne neere ech vse arrowes serue little purpose targatyers couering selues target residue light armed came sword fought enemy hand hand meane time scanderbeg couering archer troupe horse causing little retire selues gaue meanes vse againe bowes conueniently pike men safely armed good strong corselet aduentured selues hardly came assault enemy cruelly whereby put fellowes good hope victorie began wing ioyne side high mighty cry madethe aire resound againe albanois exceeded number goodnesse horse yet place indifferent vantage one place field foughten middest goodly large plaine champion neare adioyning riuer drynon venetian equall enemy rather force courage long time maintaine fight generall variable doubtfull fortune till time prince albanie certaine horse charging middest breake battell meanes wherof many wounded great number dispersed disordered hope victorie bene taken venetian bene illirians rallying selues side trouping together grosse agillitie quicknesse nation singular made head againe enemy greater strength reassure corp du garde venetian generall valiantly keeping enemy yet seemed rather stand vpon defence way offend aduersarie mayne battels side stood still kept ground seeming rather take view entermeddle fight long wing point fight doubtfull euent encounter assoone tophia saw right wing enemy hardly bestead taking courage former example scanderbeg troupe best horseman part infanterie presently charged vpon middest left wing enemy bringing also new feare confusion illirians placed front beare shocke enemy able endure charge made presently right wing stood vpon owne defence betraying companion one side forsaken side brought comming greater difficultie vnto scanderbeg striuing inforcing selfe breake corp du gard illirians like also footemen departure able make partie good albanois horseman scattered selues hauing best assurance legges made meanes safety occasion also horseman scutarie left naked open enemy saw selues sodainly disabled broken albanois leader many others taken prisoner abandoned forsaken footemen despairing safety hauing farther recourse armes yeeld selues disposition scanderbeg souldiers made company also greatly feare least scanderbeg hauing broken battell illirians already charged afterwarde charge also backe wing enclosing side might presse furiously successe vanquisher fell according fearefull imagination vanquished mightily doth prosperity oftentimes dull mind men leader saw themselues haue aduantage tooke greater regard thing held themselues contented could present vnto souldiers shewe triumph enemy bounden captiue castriot likewise regarding common souldiers disdaining bloud inferiour priuate sort wholly enforce himselfe enterprise vpon generall great strong troupe horse hinder approching neere meanes disappointed purpose fight thus continuing handes moses charged vpon left wing venetian armie scutarie serued draw men regard beholding fight side great labour daunger either partie shewing themselues stout inuincible maintaine fight egerly couragiously vncessantly contend ech force though fortune fight depended vpon onely seemed vnequally matched respect fought long time like aduantage hardly could discerned whether partie better length strength force dybrians seeming weakned faintnes wearinesse themselues horse well nigh tyred continuall fighting men vanquished willingly would haue giuen ouer almost readie leaue battell beene moses colonell sharpely reprehending euen beganne recuile sometimes blame faintnes wearinesse sometimes accuse feare cowardice thus point almost vanquished taught howe vanquish victor ouer enemy cry manner vnto shame friend lewd foule example yourencouragement moses soldier vnwonted feare timerousnesse possible dibrians forsake ranckes place assigned long liuing content lose honor glorie purchased armes giue enemy souldiers discomfited force haly bassa tamed pride ferisey abated puissance mustapha spoiles turk haue enriched house albanois fiercenes haughtie proud courage look full threat menace within campe promise victorie triumph way recouer dayna scanderbeg way prepare entry towne haue besieged neuer proue vertue valure enemy till haue found else stout valiant neuer see swordes brandizing place onely behold howe fellowes companion side victorious alreadie ech quarter field recount frutes valure hardinesse tanusee hauing taken captaines caried bound campe hath either dispersed vtterly defeated destroied middle battell enemie see pray scanderbeg hauing broken strength bodie sclauonian troupe doth passe away time binding together like beastes taking prisoner onely side haue nothing feare terror memorie flight shamefull dishonorable souldiers seeing themselues sharply reproued rebuked moses tooke hart themselues courage enflamed ardent desire repaire fault man would haue iudged haue bene men horse men bene chaunged euen instant conflict renewed fortune fight grew likewise chaunged scutarians litle litle beganne repulsed yet hold good meanes rather multitude great number hardinesse greatnesse courage last humoy coniecturing former speech enemie brother misfortune griefe whereof verie impatiency made scarce able holde weapon forgot companion went though late succour brother striking middest enemy assured victorie dibrian left also vnto posteritie euident testimonie needfull requisite chiefe generallsentence keepe amongst troupe greatly importeth good order safetie company enioy benefit presence sooner departed charge suddenly dispersed side turning back blowes furie enemy likewise side generall venetian forsaken left destitute strength corp dugarde yet holding still good keeping troupe close order pure shame strength puissance sustained force enemie maintained fight continually perceiued souldiers side put doubtles flight made default alike himselfe also setting spurres horse companie least made partner others misfortune prouided speedie flight forthe victory scanderbeg ouer venetian owne safetie scanderbeg leisure pursued scattered ouer fieldes long continuall trauell souldiers greatly detaine hinder reason battell bene foughten obstinacie held extreamitie hardly able haue continued fight longer yet wearie suffer flight free without disturbance scanderbeg publikely commaunded ensignes pursue follow chase euen gate scutarie may great captaine led anger glorie hold goodly matter enemy stood infinite thicke number vpon walles see armie conqueror many place light vpon tayle rereward fled themselues troupe farre company thus arranged high cry exceeding signes ioy presented prisoner eye townsman wondefully sad pensiue misfortune affliction concerning neare publike particular one side grieuous sight miserable condition friendes ally suggest vnto new prickes warre despight side late losse confound abate courage furthermore care captiues staied withheld keepe attempting thing enemie doubt least incense vanquisher vse prisoner extreamitie scanderbeg permitted souldiers pleasure reioice themselues honor victorie caused sound march day well neare spent euerie man prepared himselfe albeit sudden discomfiture friendes confederate necessitie victual encreasing daily within towne redouble griefe care daynians reason company albanois left place expressely intent purpose hindered foraging making prouision yet conceiue one dishonorable thought within heart redemption themselues many mischieues want oppressed euen middest extremity prouiding disposing thing notable constancie singular good discretion began sparingly accustomed share munition victual vnto souldiers allowing either much onely suffise sustaine faithfull soules saying might hold bodie soule together aged person order taken supposed person want anie meanes wherewithall helpe themselues either naturall strength situation place fidelitie assured rampier castriot ioyned victorious troupe lay towne pained perceiued hath bene recited scanderbeg knowing perswasions force efficacie towards men throughly resolued began treate yeelding towne certaine kind confidence assured demanded garrison venetian might yeelded hand rash demaund notable answerthe liberall free answer danians scanderbeg well beseeming vertue franke free citizen telling desist terrifying eares eye sight menace faith grounded vpon light witnesse dismembred body neither loue affection beare owne captiuitie confederate hope thereby extort action pietie might tend staine ignominie prisoner selues put question would require vsed towards moreouer good hope seigniours venetian would suffer either bond captiuitie one perpetuall siege long continuance take example true proofe ensignement faith anie people ought tosentence change turne venetian captiues dayna hope taken away obtaine towne reason obstinacie yet shewed kind discontentment part prince naturally inclined neither recourse termes wrath furie desire reuenge least exercise crueltie vppon prisoner whereas might haue vsed himselfe listed contrariwise commaunded presently vnbound hauing gratiously entreated cheered set libertie sent away owne house may politique sage captaine purpose intent though allowed yet deuice inuention much commended notable way subdue walles danians might leastwise vanquish courtesie humanitie might gaine gratious vsage neither rigour force could way remoue determination purpose two onely prisoner men chiefestandrew humoi simon volcathagne prisoner scanderbeg marke qualitie named andrew volcathagne detained still certen pledge league amitie like ensue shortly surety though vaine preuent fiercenes scutarians men kept vnder good gard within fortresse petralba respectiuely bountifully receiued enterteined thing thus atchieued new deuise head bring towne vnder subiection intent therfore thing affectionately desired might brought good end perfection enterprised action whereby might facilitie commoditie aduance siege dayna meanes whole warre betwene venetian sometimes towne named baleze nothingbaleze remaining small shew ruines bene somwhat renowned founded man name memorie onely antiquitie thereof seated foote mount sardonicke common peoplethe mount sardonikor marra ay surscod countrey call marranay neare certen countrey called surscodra distant scutarie twelue mile driuasta fiue fifteene dayna scanderbeg determined reedifie repaire place old bene ruinated barbarian say scourge god attila place fortified defended good garrison force opinion might benefit thereof freely annoy venetian territorie keepe besieged hauing releefe succour reason enemie busied partes many occasion purpose caused one inst nt renewed partly walles parlybaleze reedified fortified scanderbeg pallissadoes fortification timber worke hauing founded manner towne furnished men appointed amese nephew marin span spaniard person birth albanie man approued prudenceamese marin span gouernours baleze fidelitie haue ouersight worke see brought vnto perfection done repassed day ouer riuer drinon prosecute siege dayna occasion time affaire would suffer case intermitted fortification walles new fortresse finished many bulwarkes raised within seemed expedient amese young man impatient rest owne peculiar reputation fresh renowne vncles vertue animating youthful mind hereunto somewhat happily made certaine rodes light inuasions vpon plaine countrey imagined fortunate matter greater weight importance therefore cast minde full resolution surprise driuasta towne neere adioyning made thence forward haddriuasta thought daily make readie companie though disfurnishedamese purposeth surprise driuasta new fortresse garrison thought commendation act augmented succour sent vncle ere knew newes thereof might suddenly send vnto markes notable exploit spoiles towne conquered subdued would secret argument vncles valure wane waxe old vnder wals dayna fondly boiling heate young man courage puffe vp hope vainely promising vnto himselfe fauours fortune marin whose industrie scanderbeg made choise made equal surer preseruation new fortresse hauing therein ioyned vnfortunately prudence one temeritie marin say old expert souldier reason long practise matter militarie venerable age fearing openly withstand wilfulnesse youth might grow secret dislike enmitie betweene pestilent mischiefe administration anie affaire cause thought would beginning breake enterpriese alienating deuotion souldiers secretly meanes would disappoint purpose afterwards sawe affection common inordinate lycense souldier encline partie resolued ende speake minde openly freely presence al whole company intent himselfe might discharged default likely another man counsell succeede vnhappily therefore speech like termes gaue admonition certenly amese scanderbeg hath left thee heere greater crosse vnto themarin span speech amese venetian enemy haue matter looke vnto reason heat warre throughout country constrained driuen new strife contention causing secret hate dislike betweene v thou art growen haue vehement suspition least desire contradict thee ielousie thy youthfull glorie reputation doe seeme disswade thee thy enterprise impute fault vnto selfe seeing god men sufficiently acquite counsell case concerning accident either neglected seemeth haue bene wanting followed allowed cannot well reprehended losse surely thine owne man else action whatsoeuer thy intent citie driuasta thy selfe thy vncle thou goest assaile thou doest hasten abridge day thy owne friend fellow citizen bath enemy ground blood thy souldiers haue end repaired new towne haue fortified strong company garrison many braue men end suddenly disarmed disfurnished force foolishly seeke others fortresse left deliuered prey vnto enemy expect attend nothing else say place regarded yet thinke townes surprized small mumber souldieres would scarcely suffice defend especially towne driuasta large populous respect may commend enemy likewise excellently well prouided armes men couragious valiaunt deceiued enemy doe expect one thing first old men weak vnable multitude battlement wals make iest foolish preparation vaine deuises seeking thus take city young men fierce lusty desire nothing much come fight issuing forth towne force v leaue assault chase v away shame ignominy else leauing port open receiue v sodainely vnaduised surprize set vpon v reuenge late losse companion iniuries scutarians townes take courage vnto ouercome vanquished become grow hardy nothing redoubt v lay aside therefore pray thee amese whilest thing well whole pernicious forwardnes audacity cause reuerent honorable name ofthy vncle great indignity disgraced rent asunder mouth aduersaries ill willers stay attend till god fauour thee presenting thee matter abundant greater glory greater safety security formoste man perswade thee cause thee take armes also accompany thee man vnwilling follow ensignes fortunate restraine therefore broyling heat thy courage though hard restrained learne thy ancient first thy selfe beare yoke thou desirest impose vpon thy enemy youth vncapeable good counsell let speakesentence freely thinke oftentimes hurtfull vnto selfe vnto enemy rather drawen beled thing burden laied vpon men vnaduised wilfulnesse youth dangerous war managed counsell good aduise let wisest captaine cary selfe action neuer sagely aduisedly yet hardly great difficulty doth fortune answere desert succeed accordingly graue prudent speech personage sufficient haue changed mind yong souldier hastinesse owne temerity rashnesse owne counsel hee already ordained prouided thinges expedient necessary enterprise seemed vnto matter dishonor giue ouer discretion attempt vndertaken misfortune put execution hee reiected therfore wholsome sound admonition preferring worst best held lesse shame disgrace follow humor though losse hinderace reforming himselfe vpon admonition take choise might benefit aduantage besides credit purchased company readines comon souldiers obedient command animate foolish desire withhold doubtfull eares harkning vnto good aduertisements therefore marin spaniard perswaded aduisedly first replied great insolency vncle hadanswere amese marin span left either like power commaundement authority hee appointed gouerne himselfe either peace war liking arbiterment another looke owne company part command souldiers owne pleasure notwithstanding within litle choller litle cooled speaking vehement immoderate passion mind somewhat setled abated began tongue much modest speaches grew milde gracious told colleague companion would willingly approue allow opinion affaire baleze driuasta might directed ordered neither would hinder disturbe force sufficient guard one cary inconsideratly vndertake attempt well knew would surprize driuasta sodainely vnprouided finde youth towne armes gate vngarded wals without sentinel besides many inhabitant summoned yeeld would gladly hearken vnto admit thing fall difficult expected meant obstinate make long abode preiudice souldiers saying tooke maryn hand praying good courage hopewell successe thus hauing recommended affair vnto god displaid ensignes marched chearefully onward remained behindeamese marcheth surprize driuasta marin gard baleze scant fully man enforced accompany iourney albanois exercised labor trauell lying idle rest souldiers kinde warre agreeable familiar vnto assaulting surprising townes holdes albeit amese hasten possible celerity conceale attempt much might yet could preuent newes comming driuastines aduertised approach men could soone descry purpose beginning war dayna ordinarily keepe maintaine great court guard certaine place towne great number purposely watch armes notwithstanding first greatly astonished mounting vpon wals made preparation thing requisite repulse enemy bringing partes stone munition fit throwen downe vpon annoy afterwardes sight enemy drew neare towne grew sodainely better encouraged lesse carefull contemning smalnesse number captaine alike notwithstanding good countenance made nothing apall diminish confidence yong chiefetaine summoned within towne name scanderbeg many faire offer promise render vnto rudely repulsed many sharpe tearmes reiected hee resting yet suspence doubtfull withall caried away choller indignation retired himselfe mile halfe towne vaine according variable diuerse opinion souldiers beate braines deuising mean might bring towne reason seeing ordinance wherewithall batter thus seeme consult besiege towne one time meane time assure troups surprize principally towardes scutarie placed skoutes watch round place hee encamped whilest thing thus driuastines worthy verie commendable care bethinke themselues free towne doubt siege conclusion whatsoeuer became thereof hazard combate enemy attempt force wals rampiers author resolution andrew angell one chiefest men accompt within towne noble owne worthy actes well knowen honor gotten long practise armes man hauing ranged men good order ofbattel lower gate city lieth west towards plaine wals city well manned port strongly garded salied forth vpon enemy began encorage language euer quoth good souldiers needlesse superfluous encorage oratic andrew angell driuastines men valiant magnanimious time day wherein see comming hither readily chearefully doth make shew thereof apparantly considering euery one leauing presence company father mother wife embracementes tender infant doth offer himselfe willingly without perswasions entreaty seeing fortune notable spectacle hath brought v wee driuen combat wals good companion louing citizen imitate example auncesters maintaine welfare town countrey house temple altar end recount vnto manifold triuphs gained vpon enemy selues haue yet fresh memory let suffice great many recite seeing shortnesse time permit long discourse remember well haue heard reported forefather barach turkish captainedriuastines valiant exploites enemy raigne amurath first horseman inuading territory beginning warre make demand vnto citizen key towne deliuered vppon condition would propound vnto willing submit selues vppon tearmes falling burning country destroying fruites fire sword people say driuasta came vpon full troups dispersed sort many left engaged dead fieldes many made prisoner enforced residue betake selues flight hauing meanes obtained notable victory returned towne rich triumphant tell steuen surnamed herceck duke bosina like manner entred within limit army fiue twenty thousand vnder pretence like expedition first summoned towne yeelde vnto braue driuastines stout lofty refusall put rage fury presently sent forth troupe ouerrun countrey make hauocke thing citizen went encounter good company horse foot charged great furye brake discomfited pursued chase greedily besides great slaughter enemy many ensignes gained returned triumphant loaden prey booty town honoring countrey preseruation liberty selues glory reputation march therefore good friend let selues messenger sencelesse enemy aunswere towne sendeth great vertue resolution let v take straglers robber vaine foolish hope winning town weak force ill accompanied thinke stout resistance dayna scanderbeg selfe great army hath long time bene busied wonderfull touch reproach infamy vnto nephew haue commission basely surprize v small force scant able within defend owne fortresse behold puissance strength nothing able make resistance discipline small none generall experience whatsoeuer reckoning respect army hath scanderbeg himselfe dayna mignion onely owne vnpatiency ofrest quietnes hath brought hither hath none skumme dreg campe mingle mangle rascall sort souldiers short speach animate driuastines began todriuastines sally forth driuasta amese make noise loude voice willed lead enemy began trumpet sound great cry clamour issued forth towne others vpon wals going comming ech seuerall charge like noise aloft encrease bruite alarme hue cry tumult comming sodainely vnprouided whereas amesen troupe doubted matter stroke great terrour court guard afterwardes perceiued many armed men discouer themselues party driuastines like fury make right towards encamped wished amese speedily mount horsebacke troupe best readinesse making head directly enemy might time put stand hold skirmish til time residue company scattered ouer countrey also within trench altogether vnited arranged order battell might issue forth ensignes displaied field incorporate residue one sage conduct expert chiefetaine aduerse part troubled vntimelie counsell young nouice apprentice art military hauing deuidedconflict driuastines amese troupe three part sent away speedily certaine italian intertained garrison continually part also horseman inuade campe vpper side thereof rest ho se part archer pesants sent shut vp passage campe keepe entring hold exclude one surprize intercept himselfe third troope making head amese first onset ouerthrow battallion put cleane resistance chiefetaine himselfe disfurnished guard great astonishment enforced flight notwithstanding making himselfe way squadron archer saued himselfe amidst open fieldes rest companion began cry renued part one side discomfiture captaine side sodaine approach enemy take away gards meanes rally selues together renue fight finally force enemy reioyned vnited made towards fort long debate aduantage fell driuastines thing enclining fauour amesens abandon defence trench diuerse side flying fighting retired selues plaine angell made reckonning pursue sacke campe thinking done enough depriuing victory caused sound retraite led backe compapany great reioysing city ioy good happy encounter long continue inhabitant amese hauing gathered souldiers together flight thinking vpon discomfiture shame wherof greater losse seeing himselfe frustrate hope gaine driuasta heeamese spoileth countrey driuasta turned impatiency anger else sparing thing whatsoeuer could found either encrease recreation house burnt ruinated sort tree plant cut destroied nothing left vntoucht except oliue tree abundance fertility doth make towne haue great traffique much esteemed spoiling ruines notwithstanding amese spoiled good way port driuastines though hardines succeeded happily yet would againe drawen field fearing range abroad farre returne might hindered might fall ambuscado giue account great forwardnesse ouermuch hardinesse might cost full dearely hold amisse lay downe sort description towne ofthe towne driuasta driuasta much renowmed neither foundation antiquity albeit credulous error inhabitaunts doth obstinately attribute originall thereof romains alleadging first founder herein glory affirme themselues colony romains precisely maintaine thence descent original part suppose humor men desirous glory rather pardoned opinion way credited neither testimony good authority ratifie perswasion neither monument confirme like fortune also hath antibara towne verie goodantibara accompt day within sayd countrey without cause doeth complaine vngratefull silence ancient notwithstanding seat driuasta iudgement seemeth vnworthy reason may perswade v haue colony erected regard pleasantnes place aboundance commodity thing may allure men inhabite manure territory city fertile fruitfull yeelding thing man life reason wishe euery side great store spring andscituation driuasta fountain arising descending pleasant noise hils adioyning nature orderly mounted bene disposed artificiall workmanship wonderfully doe adorne beautifie plaine countrey aire side soeuer turne eies exceedingly healthfull doth season temper thing maketh prosper singularly citie seated vpon discent mountaine bending towards south extending towards plaine watered brooke called clire may iustly tearmed name riuer reason streames thereof neuer faile drought distemperature sommer whatsoeuer circuit wals trench aboue two mile compasse fortresse castel seated vpon top mountaine descendedhelena wife negmana king misians bloud royall house fraunce espoused simeon nemagna king misians sclauonians lady deuout vertuous restore besides many townes neare adioyning bene likewise ruinated country shee builded also epire sclauonie many couents monastery religious house endowed great liuings possession manifestly seene marble engrauen testimony besides monument memorable markes bountifull princely deedes returne purpose choller amese fully discharged vpon plaine country driuastines made maner desolate desire returne anie baleze ashamed aduenture hee loath triall mishap proofe imprudency temerity come presence refused giue eare time place serued repented though late contemned good counsell turned therefore another way marched company directly towards dayna shunning vnaduisedly reprehension fellow marin endure displeasure far dangerous frowning countenance vncle grieuously incensed scanderbeg hauing tidings brought dwelling neare place thing passed assoone hee knew comming sent presence openly sight company hardly digested young gentleman extreame choller hee conuinced asscanderbeg reproueth amese temerity guilty fault bene committed accused debtor challenged demanding innocent bloud companion caused shed folly terming loud voice rash arrogant without commission plaied foolish part obiected vnto moreouer departure baleze commanded matter ought haue taken interpreted silence manifest prohibition apparat argument haue proceeding afterwards examined souldiers present seruice report certified matter altogether concluded executed without aduise consent companion fury grew much vehement minde full wrath indignation persisted seuerity saying grieued much besides temerity act added grieuous inhumaine fault destroying miserable example fieldes citizen vsing cruelty sword fire tree building amese one confounded hauing anie thing answere excuse replied word stood still silent turning selfe litle aside companion good god quoth nothing morespeeches amese vpon reproach vncle infamous man vanquished must one side accept endure insolency triumph enemy fearefull countenance wrathfull visage friend hereupon whole company assembling scanderbeg maketh prouisions resist armie turkes sent epire besiege sfetigrade vnto scanderbeg giueth ouerthrow notable stratageme amurath selfe commeth siege sfetigrade whilest christian thus stirring troubling ciuill tumult rather true proper warres whilest scanderbeg idle consume time waxe olde walles dayna amurath fully informed thing particular mustapha long time bene desirous try fortune battell also common fame report brain continually beating deuising vpon diuerse counsailes one would commend oportunity seeming fit excellent vtter confusion aduersary another would admire inuincible fortune prosperity withall speciall point kept vnresolute thought ambiguity suspence doubted least enmity christian faint colorable quarrel tumult fained disguised thus whilest prince vncertainety thoughtes penury counsell doth continue carefully discoursing debating matter still coniecturing one thing another litle litle occasion slipt handes reason anger discontentment venetian became somewhat mitigated asswaged yet often frequent importunity perswasions mustapha sought nothing fight warres hope deface abolishe shame former ouerthrow mightely prouoke ottoman draw finely betake selfe vnfortunate pernicious armes wherefore sultan hauing highly commended affection good bassa sent vnto speedely messenger letter tenour whereof followeth warre mustapha thou doest earnestly demaund henceforththe letter amurath mustapha doe freely graunt thee reportes bee true brought v concerning tumultes venetian thy vertue thy valour shall winne thee honour reputation vppon enemy yet see thou well aduised carie thy selfe discreetly let light beleefe vaine credulitie cause thee take armes afterwardes thou doest least thinke thou shalt bee enforced laye aside shame dishonour peraduenture apparance counterfeit deceiptfull warre betweene christian thon mayest bee deceaued dissembled contention looke vnto consider common saying quarrell short father child absent giue counsell one present yet doe wee aproue fonde desire fight without good cause inducement may moue thee thereunto thou oughtest haue eye discusse thy selfe particularly thou take armes thou hast taken armes put execution thou hast good store souldiours fresh resolute thy enemy partly wearied paine trauell partly weakened many battels rest referre thy sufficiencie discretion hinder thee enterprising thing shall seeme vnto thee honour aduantage mustapha obtained leaue amurath begin watre prouision made thing campe conceiued selfe wonderfull courage thinking one onely peece seruice ende determine toyle trauell whole warres thence foorth fashion manner deale closely cunningly conceale preparation openly apparantly bearing selfe countenance behauiour open enemy hee seemed bee man durst would hazard fortune battell place albanois would offer present vnto meane garrison left vppon confines macedonie sent word post hast castriot dayna enforming particularly whole case stood making knowen vnto whole estate affaire whereupon prince good resolution expert souldiour vsed lesse celeritie cunning action presently dispatched away fresh poast charged case giue bassa occasion opportunitie come fight retiring troupe sometimes thicket woodes vpon mountaines might secure enemy sometimes vnder colour timerous fearefull flight abuse little little protract aduenture hazard fight till time selfe arriued thither company giue order thing soeuer needefull accomplish desire purpose faile speedely assoone perceiued draw neare ioyne selues one traine follow intent selfe person also might ensignes squadron whole force strength campe done albeit greeued greatly see selfe withdrawen siege dayna calling amese friend faithfull companion danger peril vnto gaue charge haue carefull eye vnto siege spake vnto young man onely way counsell also entreatie praying alter thing absence wise make attempt besieged hauing bene sufficiently warned instructed owne former disgrace willed bowdge stirre foote walles gouerne selfe within towne might either make prouision victual either haue meanes refresh selues hereupon armie hee meanes greatly diminished made choise fiue hundred horse thousand fiue hundred foote best picked souldiers purposed strengthen old garrison new emotion turkes souldiours foyle dryuasta commaunded enforced stay siege vnder gouernement young gouernour greeued harte desired generall instantly request prince would permit make amendes former default vertuous act fresh marke memory purchase new honor abolish remembrance late dishonor notwithstanding request graunted reason present estate affaire disswaded taking force also could case gratifie without certaine discorde discontentment residue esteeme himselfe haue asmuch valour one companion tooke none chiefe strength armie namely old souldiours best hardened able endure armes well knew expert chieftaine difference betwixt besieging walles towne men lying incamped idle handes bosomes doe onely waite time enforce scutari go baleze enformed stirring turk deliberation also departure albanois assembled troupe possible diligence great prouision artillery seasing baleze confidered long garrison albany remoued thence place cleared enemy haue perpetuall war within owne territory able breath themselues road inuasions vpon occasion neither lesse company hungry wolues almost starued want food perceiuing negligence absence sheepherds rush without feare vpon fearefull flocke disperse dismember poore sheepe ill garded like maner scrutarians hauing bene time vigilant attentiue hauing intelligece departure scanderbeg far remoued called another warre great importance sodainely force prouisions made hast towards baleze began reuenge iniuries griefes endured litle wanted garrison hadmarin spa forsaketh baleze bene surprized obstinacie attended comming enemy soone marin hadde discouered went bring canon place trussing vppe baggage hee souldiours conueyed themselues secretelie dayna leauing nothing bare emptie neast naked rampiers scrutarians time passed gotten ouer brooke clyre aboue two myles baleze neither saw encountred thing solitarie wilde countrey hearing neither voyce rumour person seeing token appearance watch gardes vpon walles new straunge case great silence seeming verie suspitious first shew make fearefull full horrour afterwardes certaine companie sent foorth discouer enemie hauing brought word backe departed thence whole armie approched fort without feare sight place solitarie dislodging garrison mightely displease great hautie courage seeing nothing poore walles bend force towne onely without liuing creature aboue others humoy haue spoken great rage choller reason excessiue desire hee like match good hap reuenged brother captiuitie truth vexed extreamely could meanes obtaine deliuerance scanderbeg may went thither amitie friendship doth make mindes men vigilant intent surprising place might get handes pledge raunsome good worth thereby make exchaunge person brother detained prisoner side souldiours clime leape ouer walles razing ouerthrow ordinance needefull vse seruice stone cleauing slenderly together reason morter abaleze razed scutarians manner new lately layed beaten downe barres iron torne vp without great labour easily enough tumble downe selues alone small space therefore ouerthrowen ruinated rest made wood pallizadoes like defence long able continue fire put vnto altogether consume souldiours cabbines fortification likewise troden vnder foote layed euen ground thus scutarians ouer hastie desire satisfie hatred malicious mindes dead kinde reuenge left towne deformed hideous looke vnto whereof cause owne dammage greater griefe calamitie making subiect future reuenge enemy companie whose counsell march force dayna chase enemy siege trye fortune battell seeing thing seemed encline promise victorie scanderbeg beeing absent armie small number force made durst doe besides others would case agree hazard aduenture generall gouernour scutarie giuen charge commandement wherefore turned ensignes retired troupe home towardes scutarie without hauing done thing worthy glorie commendation either purchase bootie prisoner slaughter enemy side maryn hauing brought garrison backe dayna reuiue amese griefe see misfortune shame bee fallen publique yet priuately euen smile kinde contentment tooke owne particular mishap seemed onely alone thus shamefully foyled repulsed dryuastines colleague copartner enforced become also companion like griefe misfortune conceipt whereof made young prince open view hearing souldiours speake vnto manner well quoth hee friendes felowes armes let v still pitifullthe coplaint amese let v still bee mercifull compassionate towardes enemyes till time foolish pitie vnaduised clemencie haue vtterly ruinated confounded euen selues let v owne destruction let loose bandes scutarians set libertie prisoner intent may afterwardes v liues freely execute outrage crueltie may vncle thinke shall see deformed shape towne walles dismantelled ouerthrowne hee hauing late taken prisoner fieldes neare bankes riuer drynon curteouslie gratiouslie open view sight man restore libertie send home free without raunsome owne countrey intent new take armes renew old fiercenesse rancour harte go let v pardon driuastines let v forbeare touch inuade territorie whilest selues doe finde kinde hostilitie executed person come passe whilest carie selues clemencie proue pardon enemy doe animate stirre vp armes world v breaking bond wherein tyed bring yoke bondage vpon owne neckes entreatie ought enemy finde mercy ought exclude shew pittie compassion transported farre pittie pitifull standeth reason wherein man finde selfe iustly agreened v vse right law armes doth permit v man lawfully accompt call cruell standeth vpon tearmes like enmity betweene equall contention life death thus one side matter passe complaint murmuring onthe proceeding warre betweene mustapha scanderbeg side mustapha hauing sent forth souldiers countrey suffer garrison scanderbeg rest continuall daily roades inuasions made vppon terrifie albanois shunning fight continually stand vppon defence sometimes relying vppon strength trench fortified place rather vppon valour force armes sometimes sallying forth small troupe faining flight kind mocking skorning enemy entertaine gaine time vpon wherefore mustapha perceiuing endeuours vaine small hope oppresse garrison hee desire make attempt fort vnwilling pursue flight feare ambuscadoes like pollicies vsuall familiar enemy onelie good aduise ordayned prouided good guardes sentinelles imployed residue strength force wast spoile countrey neare adioyning vnto till time enfourmed comming prince albanie hee retired whole strength force armie went encampe selfe within litle lesse two myles enemie place made choise oforonochea battell called oronochea vpper dibria vppon certaine faire plaine yet great breadth sixe mile croie scanderbeg freshe new force likewise entred campe epirots sooner arriued caused proclamation made sound trumpet person issue foorth depart thence without especiall leaue license immediatly set euery man worke fortifying campe mustapha meane part stirring mouing whit side therefore quiet peaceable meanes whereof albanois hauing sufficientlie ordered affaire hauing strengthned armed force strong well defenced rampiers began fortifie likewise fortresse armes men souldiours scanderbeg making generall view muster company know number men certaintie force old bandes three thousand fiue hundred horse six hundred foote strong albeit castriot left little lesse fiue thousand men departure went make preparation warre venetian yet afterwardes drew foorth great many vpon diuers speciall reason good consideration whole number therefore force reckoned accounted present nearethe number scanderbegs force mustapha six thousand fighting men hee purposed affront force mustapha hazard fortune glorious triumph yet employed vigilancie circumspect prouidence pollitique chieftaine would permit fort remaine naked empty without defence soeuer chance betide ordained chosen men theorder scanderbeg armie mustapha gard custodie army aduisedly vpon good consideration deuide wing fore front cosisted altogether horseman made chief force strength battallions placing thousand fiue hundred horse feare doubt least footemen vnable indure beare charge enemy horse first onset disordered ouerthrowen cause placed fewe backe two winges greatest part infanterie reserued middle battell likewise couered supported fiue hundred horse intent battell troubled disordered first encounter partes one side horseman make head horse enemy whilest prince epire strength body armie thus ordered arranged containe souldiers great silence stirring ensignes attending dismarch setting forward enemy behold athe combat paule manessey caragusa certaine turke disbanding seuering himselfe rest company whose name caragusa presented himselfe middle space field lay betweene two army gaue signe defiance challenging one combat thence aduancing selfe neare ranckes christian high loftie voyce called hardy aduenturous person companie assay selfe body body first generall silence man gaue word euery one stood mute men lesse doubtfull refuse challenge feare shame disgrace accept combat hazard whereof daungerous paule manessey knowen bee verie readie horseman excellent man armes longer tollerate brauadoes barbarian nation countreymen company seeming cast regard vppon attend thing hee especiallie man challenge concerne fortune fight belong appertaine therefore aduauncing himselfe roundly great fiercenesse ioyfull countenance went seeke scanderbeg know mind good pleasure matter verie highly commended courage good hope much vehemently augmented animated meanes good speech scanderbeg gaue willed good houre vnder true conduct thepaul manessey encouraged scanderbeg combat great god march worthy president imitate whole armie generall could follow great ioy gladnesse vpon happie presage new gained honor reputation hereupon cornet flocking part round beganne praise extoll commend alreadie gotten victorie making longer stay whilest arming furnishing selfe thing necessarie ordinarie fight suddenly mounted horsebacke forthwith gallopping open plaine field addressing himselfe towards barbarian attended called vnto high voice wordes well fitting beseeming enemie willed prepare make readie combat turke bad stay litle onely giue hearing worde two deliuered manner victorie betweene v valure fortune decide determinespeeches caragusa paul manessey touching lawes victory selues take order destiny haue ordeined thee day haue honour losse ouerthrow refuse ouercome right armes thou shalt freely dispose slaughtered carkasse spoiles like case happen thou vanquished doest fall vnder mine hande like right done dispose thy bodie pleasure let general ratifie confirme feare least either heate furie fight deciding adiudging combat tumult vproare doe arise betweene battels fauour part one v heereunto paul gaue aunswere part allow lawe condition combatanswere paul manessey caragusa seemed fearefully demaund obserued spirite resolute full courage doth yeelde others fortune residue order law good right ought pleasure conquerour therfore fight securely without feare needed doubt anie enemie besides whose bodie became ghost lesse vnder hand also remaine disposed free pleasure election albeit himselfe could content bequeath vnprofitable reliques dead carkasse amongst fellowe souldiers bewaile lament misfortune yet scanderbeg would suffer member shewed themselues faint sluggish combat vanquished brought backe receiued campe audatious replie caualier slight regard account seemed make life appale astonish barbarian made manner repent himselfe euer prouoked imediatly summe agreement confirmed ratified chieftaines two combatantes left alone middest fielde euerie man eies fixed vppon present fight diuersely affected doubt hope stand abide rauished maruellous care concerning successe euent combat shew taulenesse two champion neere alike meane stature equall yeares age neither slouthfull heauie constitution yet youthfull ouerhot hastie disposition ech armes alike first launce shield barred ouer midst bar steele side cemitaries turkish fashion great heauy mace yron body armed curasses head helmet ouer armour verie rich cassockes made silke shining bright glistering albeit way profite victorie yet adde kind grace ornament vnto thus appointed either bewraying kinde fiercenesse cruelty countenance courage tooke field ech opposite setting spurres horse fetching strog carreer lance rest encounter ech christian knight running head paynim stroke aboue ouer shieldpaul manessey killeth caragusain combat right eye pierced quite wound tumbling fro saddle ground dismounting speedily disarmed dead carkasse cut head bodie thus loaden spoiles slaine enemie euery one sufficiently animated excellent testimonie vertue particular priuate person rather seemeth heauens could haue afforded notable example eies haue giuen better occasion spurre prouoke happie beginning first frutes victorie sufficient encourage braue setled resolution abate dismay courage enemy go therefore passe hardly path honour hath bene troden vnto commendable kind emulation immitate act fellow armes whose hand may see yet smoking bloud infidell carefull regard diligence companion hath vowed selfe hath vowed selfe victorie valiant puissant arme hath offered vp sacrifice likewise without bloudshed follow like fauour god march ouer body dedicated destruction handes may enioy spoiles promised valure desertes let v therefore giue onset charge presently vppon enemie first challenge rankes let v first challenge whole battell let v force field seemeth fatall vnto whilest feare griefe haue depriued strength whilst generall astonishment doth presse heart mind people sad sorrowfull silence assoone thus spoken body hauing beene refreshed seuenth houre caused trumpet sound verie instant marched forwarde battell array behold notable wonderfull kinde hardinesse man marke well resolution worthie inuincible vertue deseruing admired posteritie chiefetaine onely fine souldier time small troupe men brauely disdayning great force mightie puissance enemie durst open plaine forgoe trench putting himselfe vpon field giue brauado strong enemie bene vnready vnwilling come one readie flie awaie seemed force compell forth conflict maner maruellous clamor mightie crie made souldiers beganne aduance himselfe towardes fort enemie mustapha came forth meete encounter first squadronthe battell betwene mustapha scanderbeg tumultuously assembled afterwardes force like feare terrour set forwarde assoone easily repulsed verie first onset scarce come foorth trench placed good order battell manie suddenly betaking themselues flight flocke backe againe troupe making hast get within fort basely cowardly seeking fence warrant liues strength fortresse rampiers thing perceiued turkish generall neither ensignes souldiers keepe stande order intent might better encourage regard example owne forwardnes cried vnto follow see make way ensignes follow come therewithall bearing himselfe close lance rest broched horse spurres head shoulder gaue vpon front enemy full firme resolution either carie away victorie vnto amurath lorde maister else sell life dearely many leader captaines followed good number owne battallion residue also beeing ashamed leaue chiefetaine time neede little little came ioyne opposed themselues force violence christian diuerse sundriie place gathering trouping together mainetaine fight vttermost power thus side battels reenforced fight beganne speedily renewed yet anie appearance change varietie fortune one partie commonly seene fight alwaies partes like infidel without hope victorie christian euer surmounting continual encrease proceeding good fortune firmely successe two first champion verie beginning wrought confirmed fortune army engrauen mind ech man impression hope terror made either fearefull aduenturous moses side sometimes aduancing setting forward horse sometimes bringing footemen turkish ensignes disorder easily broke vpon great force violence contrary side opposed vanquished rather certaine fatall destinie valure prowes christian scant able shun auoide blowes wound giuen seeme men bond alreadie vanquished rather fit bind vanquish others paul manessey fighting middle battell bestirred himselfe notably leauing wheresoeuer went maruellous slaughter circumcised time rankes broken side neither horseman footemen continuing fight keeping place battell array confused mingled one another greater part well neere turkes hauing horse slaine footman albanois lance handes came serue footemen also one side body vnaccustomed vsed fight foot part discommoditie armour great much endammage hinder reason force decrease diminish imagined number multiplie increase neuerthelesse blinded shame still abide expecting attending successe generall side busily occupied accompanied assisted notable valiant men armie hauing made head middle battell scanderbeg himselfe remained thinke haue repaired forme good hap rest squadron sometimes presence paul manessey greatly vrge glorious honorable opinion champion lately slaine fearefull thought cogitation measure thing enemie greater made shew sometimes againe heart incensed inflamed wrath according either deformed image slaine champion shadowe dead bodie vnreuenged
