people desirous forwarde endaunger themseluespaul manessey assailed turkes meanes whereof manie reallied assembled troupe paul alone pressed vpon vttermost power men cared anie rest onelie ayme shoote anie one striue euen hazard owne life deadly wound purchase pretious reward head highly prized obstinate prowesse cauilier caused fonde foolish desire turkes turne owne pernitious extreame dammage well garded troupe hardie valiant able enough sustaine furie violence contemne vaine presumption length perceiuing farre one barbarian disbanded himselfe rest troupe verie hotte importunate vppon companie turned himselfe towardes without anie word speaking hauing gotten neere vnto discharged full blow strength ouerthwart head redoubled one two stroke vppon ouerthrew headlong horse making take measure tombe vpon hard earth champion sawe lie dead vpon ground beganne presently turne bridle neither caring reuenge death warrant body fro outrage enemy made epirots saw stande studie certaine flying presse vpon fiercely charge greater fury giuing time breath handled rudely till hauing full chase left aduantage honor conqueror paul pursuing still fled gleane take vp made least speed bitter biting termes thus tauntingly exclaimed vpon whether flie saied youspeeches paul manessey turk fled base companion forgetfull good fellowship hath caragusa neither brother cosin much friende amongest many honour corp lieth dead disfigured vouchsafe reuenge last good past aide helping behold see saie doe call vppon giue defie late selues first prouoke hope wrong conceited glory abide staie take bloudie spoiles companion voluntarily doe proffer vnto turkes mute dombe fish minde nothing speedie fight running away infamous kinde silence neither approue reproue tauntes reprochfull speech enemie thus within hauing litle litle gotten aduantage libertie open field quickely vanish sight hardly could heare sound noyse chased onely archer trouble great obstinacie rest troupe abstained pursuing wearinesse extremitie trauell dulled force spirit thethe dewse turkes ensignes christian notwithstanding hauing gathered vp ensignes half moones lay euery dispersed ouer field turk standard ensignes doe beare deuise souldiees wonderfull great ioyes making aire resound pleasant clamor rude riming song euen striue contend carie tent scanderbeg gone well side good turkes either slaine lie dispersed ouer fielde great heapes reserued according right armes hand fast pinioned behinde backes giue euident open testimonie owne bad deuoire clemencie enemy mustapha mustapha generall turkes taken prisoner twelue others likewise principall chiefest person brought prisoner vpon hungarian horse great pompe triumph intent might seene men making sight much worthy notable mitigating misfortune prisoner pernitious humor ambition pestilent desire purchase vnto himselfe greater glorie proofe triall resolution caried furiously squadron scanderbeg enclosed destitute aide defence souldiers meanes either escape away free die honourablie vnfortunate chieftaine made choise copound losse al thing yea libertie also sauegard preseruation life onely say certainly whether time warre held amurath victory christian exploit atchieued notable fauored diuine power worthily iorney make shew euery man good courage desert neuer leader souldier person degree soeuer euer returne honorably charged reputation glorie either publique priuate report slaine enemie taken onely prisoner standardes happie fortunate ouerthrow cost albanois much bloudshed lost say scarce men campe enemy greatly enrich christian souldiers turkes soiourned certaine monthes vppon march border prouince gotten together purchased good store pr ie booty also found goodly spoiles vpon slain notable number good horse albeit souldiers helde themselues reasonablie well satisfied pillage yet wrathfull fierie courage scanderbeg sufficiently appeased immediately assoone refreshed troupe part day remained spent imploied sacking spoyling territory enemie sort continuing course late victorie setting fire thing farre neere could destroied sworde burnt consumed fire neither meanest worst sort souldiers returne thence empty without bootie whersoeuer found thing good worth taking forgot behind besides brought away wonderfull manie beast cattell wearinesse excessiue trauell abundance bootie wherewith ouer charged scarcely could get home campe houre within night residue night spent taking rest passed still great quietnesse without bonfire without noise clamor shewes token victorie reason prince epyre shewed selfe sad pensiue accustomed newes baleze ouerthrowen rased therefore within campe anyscanderbeg pensiue razing baleze thing discreetely soberly disposed framing countenance altogether sadnesse melancholie conforme themselues humour ioyntly sometimes confirming good pleasing speech sometimes raging hatred mallice enemie agreeued thought pensiue imagination prince would admit comfort accustomed rest long often called remembrance outrage ingratitude scutarians regard benefites clemencie tasted receiued scanderbeg therefore hauing appointed left according custome two thousand horse thousand foote gard frontier next morningscanderbeg spoileth territorie scutarians reuenge razing baleze breake daye departed residue force taking prisoner wellneare best choisest bootie tooke way siege dayna learned marin span certainely particularly thing passed made longer abode whilest renewed repaired troups immediately without delay fresh force caried extreame losse calamitie inhabitant scutarie passed ouer riuer drynon dispersing horsmen ouer countrey whatsoeuer found tilled sowen place quarter end autumne destroied wasted spoiled vineyardes cut vp close ground tree bare frute felled downe pesants rustickes themselues saued slaughter many found resist enemie put sword residew sacked euill entreated thence turning furie vpon townes venetian territorie pursued sorte good cause giuen curse rash exploite scutarians baleze inhabitant al force remained within countrie reuolt adioine themselues take part scanderbeg rather would taste rigor discommoditie ruines destruction thus see scanderbeg largely blame reprehende immoderate choller nephewe could acknowledge infirmitie owne passion detested indiscretion young courage could temperate moderate owne anger impaciencie countrie thus ouercome made desolate brought vnder dominion strange lord also began growe terrible townes place chiefe regard notwithstanding extremitie rigor cold winter beginning approch continuall falling raine without ceasing driue home againe wil made retire tent winter vnder wonted walles dayna trouble alteration gouernours venetian prouince magistrate scutarie meanes hereof maruellous distresse perplexitie especially regard force shut vp within dayna well knew haue beene brought last point extremitie want necessitie dispatched letter senate venice containing miserable estate confederate time arriued campe certen infidel great andmustapha prisoner ransomed ducketes rich present vnto scanderbeg ransome prisoner agreed vpon payment fiue twentie thousand duckates thereupon mustapha companion deliuered turkes hauing bene bountifully feasted entertained verie honorably rancour enmitie bene vtterly forgotten layed aside guide appointed verie skilfull passage countrey safe conueiance better assurance way violence christian money leuied made deliuerie wholly distributed amongst souldiers scanderbeg desire made partaker reward bene partaker trauels danger warre al attempt made towne reason rigour colde frostes permit thereunto defendant hauing abandoned care remembrance al thingsthe constancie daynians saue faith fidelity abate nothing former wilfulnes obstinacie many infinite discommodities wasted consumed force yet reserued still one minde courage spirites seeme daily waxe liuely resolute though body greatly enfeebled strength much abated diminished thus small hamlet staie force violence excellent soueraigne chiefetaine conquerour inuincible manie famous battelles sawe himselfe surmounted constancie place onely yet shame hereof neuerthelesse whit deterre scanderbeg pursuing attempt resolutely determined winne famine could otherwise bring reason time certen secret speech vncertaine rumor amongst common sort seigniorie venice verie willinga treatie peace betwene scanderbeg venetian enclining peace reason whereof scanderbeg bare himselfe mildly gratious towardes enemie roades incursion made thenceforth vppon countrie albanois discharge choller mallice gentlenesse lesse extremitie many day past newes brought certaine ambassador sent vnto order direction senate venice entreat newe agreement peace amitie betweene time comming hourely expected scanderbeg therefore according vsage custome great personage hauing sent chiefe nobilitie great traine meete entertayned honorably hauing feasted verie sumptuous bountifull manner theconditions peace offered scanderbeg next day gaue full audience deliuer charge commission effect whereof prince epire breake vp campe dayna withdraw force bene receiued gard protection venetian state therefore soueraigntie absolute iurisdiction towne fully peaceably rest continue handes scanderbeg liew counterchaunge thereof haue whole rightbusegiarpeni part demesne scutarie extending riuer drynon towards scutarie lying conueniently scanderbeg towne dayna oration scanderbeg vnto venetian ambassador vpon conclusion peace betwene seigniorie certen countrey lying vpon riuer drinon circuit land called busegiarpeni conditio peace sooner propounded presently accepted albanois without delaie refusall held himselfe well contented satisfied ambassadours appointed vnto wherefore peace concluded agreed vpon assurance thing else well orderly dispatched generall silence commanded worthie magnanimious prince prepare himselfe make speech vnto giue notable shew token magnificence liberalitie thus began say vnto hartie wish desire prince yet liuing amongest v whose death beginning first occasion iust griefe wearisome warres haue whilest sought recouer possession dayna stayned blood citizen mishap vniust warre would time haue seene prouince christian friendes ally ouerwhelmed many mischieues would haue gloried obseruation peace amitie inuiolably honorable worthie senate interruption troubling whereof present happening vpon small trifling cause hart long time greatly grieue breach debate grew vpon another occasion taking armes excused disloialtie others sinister peruerse counsel easily estrange alienate hart good affection ladie malitiously certaine affectation flatterie didbossa conceale agreed betweene lech author dayna yeeld selfe protection therefore found selfe much agreeued neither take armes conuince iniustice yet impute anie ambition greedie desire empire vnto venetian yet age euer heare haue enterprised authorised warre vniust equitie one thing litle displease lesse trust affiance requisite whilest gaue care builded vpon tale reportes thought ambitious led desire trouble contention therefore seeing right armes onely lay hold vpon occasion warre manner cast vpon euen put handes gladly doe laie aside weapon god himselfe willing haue selues required euen territorie ordinance senate haue giuen recompence dayna confirmation league amitie holding selfe well satisfied onely good francke offer senate doe willingly embrace good friendshippe liberall magnificent prince thing neither desire accept occasion serue neede territorie haue whole estate good substance yea life vow consecrate child maiestiepeace proclaimed betweene venetiant scanderbeg empire scanderbeg hauing finished speech tooke order heraulds sent throughout prouince publish vnto people glad tydings ioyfull newes peace much desired siege also broken vp raised sconce fortification made siege beaten downe razed souldiers mirth ioy laying aside hatred malice publique priuate friendly entertaine welcome towne inuite tentes pauillions immediately also vpon treatie andrew volcathagne deliuered permitted goe large thought good thing bene lately taken scutarians neighbour village castels fortress like rendred redeliuered ambassador day following many triumphes many goodly shewes manner publiquely solemnized ambassador dismissed without many rich sumptuous present scanderbeg naturally liuely stirring disposition beingscanderbeg leauing siege daina marcheth spoile turkish territorie impatient rest able endure idlenes presently led troupe turkish frontier intent wast spoile vsually accustomed gathering one olde garrison rest company incorporated together seemed haue good faire armie sort man would haue thought force sufficient onely pill spoile field purchase vpon enemie sword force armes hereof grewe prince neighbour wont way mirth iest callthe turkish territory scanderbegs treasurie territorie enemie scanderbeg treasurie afterwardes parting losse liues except baptized become christian also left nothing shewed fauor gaue liues libertie furie sword followed rage flame fire kindled house deforme disfigure thing burned ash sort campe amurath happened time haue come epire hope haue found victual haue maintained much one day except caried brought earth therefore left bare naked emptie onely shew markes desolation scanderbeg caused ensignes albanie ambassador giuing high praise commendation senate conceiued exceeding ioy incomparable gladnes prouince long fierce warre might thenceforth take breath rest themselues willing honor vertue venetian territory epire amurath consulteth counsell concerning warre scanderbeg consent posteritie created citizen venice enrolled number noble family citie common wealth besides vniuersall good liking senate appointed sole gouernour lieutenant general common wealth quarter letter forthwith sent away effect diuerse rich princely present nothing spoken turkes neither heard made anie road ordinarie inuasions attempted thing vpon epirots rude discomfiture ouerthrow mustapha terrified abated courage amurath durst stirre duke albanie fearing like enterprise formerly vsually assailed rather augment strengthen force able either breake diminish seeing many great army euen till entred epyre inuasion scanderbeg part either destroied left dead vpon field else shamefully discomfited put flight brought seruitude captiuitie serue laughing slockes enemy triumph ouer fit matter encrease glorie reputation supposing therefore reuenged disgrace requisite make farre greater preparation march another maner puissance spent whole houres day diuerse consultation still prolonging occasion great honour vainely conceiued promised himselfe iorney report peace made venetian spoiling prouinces many discomfiture one happening necke another comming eares heart mightily addicted inclined warre much incensed sharply pricked forward wherefore old man thus full care thought would decree thing leuying souldiers caused certaine nearest person sent call visiers priuie councell tovisiers councellours great turk one mad verie anger full furie choller discouered end secret long conceiued hatred hart termes hitherto worthy trustie councellours haue well nourished orat amurath councellours warre vndertaken scanderbeg much augmented prosperous temeritie fugitiue occupied vrgent necessitie warre hungarie haue long deferred due punishment hate full enemie multitude outrage contumelious abuse hath freely without chasticement incensed maiestie ottoman empire neither eares endure heare reported eye abide sight fierce furious madnesse shame speake encreased farre growne passe dareth force aforehand v assaulting v openly condemne v faintnesse want courage auaileth heere recount vnto misfortune haly bassa like mischance many captaines leader neede goe take view coniecture image estate onely miserable prouince macedon vnderstand continuall roades inuasions burning brought extreamitie henceforth haue little hope left see therein markes token prouince filled rather replenished enemy euen late enter armie leauied purpose spending whole day spoiling dispeopling countrey long shall endure attemptes wicked seditious wretch shall suffer long till selues fettered put iron vpon owne leg high time wee suppresse pernitious endeuors feare least negligence fire increase late mind misgiueth begin frame complaint seeke remedie vaine considering enemie contemned neglected small meane beginning manie time doth amplifie enlarge force lifteth vp hissentence head ruine aduersarie thing master doe inuite warres seeme minister meanes vnto reason induce v thereunto yet neuerthelesse onely regard lamentable aspect misery calamity subiects alone sufficient solicite courage men braue valiant daylie captiuities imprisonment many friend smoke townes vilages side fiered burnt euen call crie themselues reuenge would make v euen blush verie shame suffer haue often heretofore restrained repressed rage hungarian haue continuall memorable defaits left greece mourning owne sorrowes lament haue broken force many mighty redoubted potentate brought euen naught shall suffer timerous kind pusillanimitie trouble tumult epire gather strength encrease vpon v shall yet endure see prouince late tributarie vnto v stand contention braue v armes hath land albanie suddenly late engendred another sort epirots possible new vnaccustomed kind enemie issue forth vnexpected v determined againe make triall nation fierce vntameable hardie haughtie courage obstinate proud prince brought vnder accustomed yoke subiection must henceforth stand vpon point subtiltie vaine pollicies must seeke surprize enemie ambushments neither doth time serue diuersitie leader chieftaines ordinarie troupe one another fill hatefull soile blood souldiers see one kind misfortune doth follow leader army whereas made choise v seruice haue serued endammage rather selues enemy shall commit another armie haly bassa ferisey besides wound deformed reliques owne force haue brought v much one standard ensigne enemy shall follow vnfortunate aduise counselles mustapha minister paye vnto christian ease charge maintaining force caried onely desire extinguish free infamie bond imprisonment haue bene often vanquished taken prisoner ransomed briefe often beaten discomfited haue reason henceforth abhorre ashamed owne estate condition must therefore take vpon v charge warre best meanes vtter endeuors behooueth v vndertake force employ great puissance march epire mightie hoast countrey may scant able containe yet sustaine force violence armie meanes without losse bloodshed shall purge clense countrey notable discomfiture enemy either expelled chased quite away vtterliesubdued vanquished shall reestablish townes auncient forme fashion disloialtie fierce nation hath bene withheld v peruerse obstinacie obdurate stubbornesse people likely vsuall vpon rash desperate resolution inconsiderate desire defende prince betake themselues armes vtterly destroy wretched soules euen long deserued punishment singular reuenge haue long desired recompence old wrong iniuries haue done v publique priuate duty valiant worthie men vndertake warre wont doe hungarian enemy farre greater wrath indignation slaues fugitiues mischieuously affected haue made shewe insolent hatefull mindes long time lay close concealed dissembled effect tended clamor continuall speech orator fullamurath resulued person warre vpon lerb maketh preparation effect rage choller insinuate nothing else eares people againe attentiuely hearken vnto approuing inuention warre epyre vndoubtedly perswaded could fall answerable honour dignitie greatnesse one voice consent agree preparation speedily made al possible diligence iorney least failing make prouisions time season might delay negligence loose occasion opportunitie spring winter beginning waxe milde top mountain couered snow began shew forth discouered immediatly therefore without anie delay commission directed proclamation made throughout prouinces nation vnder turkish obeisance throughout realmes ally confederate city townes name sultan thought conuenient furnish many thousand horse foote readie speede repaire vnto andrinople yet greece lost feate noble famous emperor constantinople neither time cause mourne lament dolefull funeral happening afterwards time came buried throwen downe vnder yoke subiection miscreant rumor preparation huge prouisions brought great feare terror neighbour nation adioyning townes successe vertue prowesse repeat willingly doth depend faith constancy rest people albany men haue eye fixt vppon either commend condemne follow imitate vertue need vse speaches wanting rather worthy dibrians meditate selues aduertising ouer much care curiositie might seeme many wordes haue conceiued secrete doubt mistrust faith loialty time castriot force assembled partsamurath leauieth mighty whilest ottoman force part daily take head together amurath amurath consulteth bassaes maer proceeding war scanderbeg almost ended great preparation assembled great mighty puissance hee called counsell bassaes moste expert chiefetains propounded debated vpon diuerse meanes manner commencement beginning war held opinion without temporizing daliance necessary send epire running campe horseman call alcanzi achimzi may wel resemble toalcanzi aduenturers without pay aduenturers cruell brutishe kinde people giuen extreamelie robbing stealing outragious tempest comming vpon sodainely surprizing vnawares notable violence destroy confound turne vp side downe enemy carrying themselues wary circumspect vnder colour fained fight deluded deceiued troupe drawen forth fight sort maiesty following neare hand proper person grosse whole army might easily entirely oppresse vanquishe others ofa contrary aduise perswading case forbeare meanes prouoke incite enemy feare either giuing occasion christian prouide themselues thing necessary long tedious warre least themselues might runne headlong first traines counterwayes late slaughter sustained others sufficiently taught besides intelligence euery commonly reported whole prouince albanie throughly prouided prepared already armes townes strongly fortified fortress garnished souldiours defence preparatiues good quantitie place passage streightes purposely possessed full souldiours scanderbeg residue troupe dayly ride vppe downe visiting prouince searching viewing thickettes secret corner woodds forrestes intent might againe conueniently according minde lodge happy fortunate ambushments pernitious thing imagine preuaile cautelous warie enemy warring manner ought rather take course better assuraunce issue euent might yet againe reproue condemne done time past let sayd might miscarie vnder sword albanois succour ofa campe heauily charged able retaine wherefore preuent christian bloud slaughter people presate vnto selues good fortune warre held better march whole armie intent might length deliuer empire ottoman labour burthen troublesome warre neither opinion allowed third indifferent betweene caried way matter fitte commodious qualitie time honour reputation enterprise concluded therefore third part little lesse whole army aduaunce foreward residue supposing number would suffice onely repell keepe enemy going forward neede set vppon sodaine comming able disturbe course enemy affaire purpose consequently prepare free passage army royall maiesty according conclusion immediatly chosen sent away sendeth part army besiege sfetygrade light horseman whose ordinary armes sword target lance plate maile mace iron commission march directly next shortest way towards sfetigrade begin siege place according amongst selues aduise deliberate amurath counsell ended commaunded residue army mustered raunged order battell infinite almost number leader commander forthe order diuision turke armie flambur saniacke colonell horseman timariot horseman subassides leader horseman ordinarily trouppes deuided diuers regimentes charge call flamburats saniacks gouernments prouinces vnder doe march timariots lesse number horseman vnder charge foote band likewise asia europe haue order certaine distributed seuerall company vnder captaines like manner auxiliary force extraordinarie succour time warre furious manner stopping horse turned making head swordes drawen went drew neare encounter enforced necessitie either incurt last extremitie danger else opposing body turning face make resistance long deferred yetsfetigrade battered turkes fully concluded agreed placed therefore two piece artillerie exceeding greatnes brought vpon certaine high place directly towne walles open discouered three notice night espial appointed keepe watch seuerall place thereabouts therefore giuing neere coniecture secret intent purpose amurath first doubt mistrust least within towne pressed exceeding multitude assailant able sufficient power repulse besides ruine wall side augment feare suspition wherefore debated many matter mind concluded length would diuert take vpon himselfe part perill labour would somewhat ease besieged trauels midnight therefore taking withscanderbeg approcheth nearer turkish camp victual one day onely leauing rest baggage campe went entrench himselfe within fiue myles enemie place last layed ambuscado sent two chiefest nobilitie musache gnirize de vladrenne men notable singular conceipt subtiltie take view camp enemie marke course would take assault himselfe meane time abode still without noise till time returned might resolue vpon proceeding accordingly seauenth houre morning returne gentleman generall time asappi ianissaries men contemned regarded peril brought foorth trench armed purpose notable resolution marched vp mountaine horseman could doe able get aboue three steppe aboue bottome foote hill reason steepenesse roughnesse placesfetygrade assaulted therfore standing aloofe shooting arrowes towards rather feare repell defendant breach whilest raskall multitude vile baser sort turkes drawen present themselues first furie christian intent tyred wearied killing slaues raskals citizen otherwise occupied drawn away escaladoes defence place assigned custodya stratageme vsuall amongst turkes others might afterwards find lesse resistance geater ease make themselues maisters rampiers meanes might disfurnished defence attempted side violence cannon made breach sudden mounting place selfe naturally vpright steepe rising easily beat backe assailant ech stroke giuen neuer litle turned vpside downe defendant also spent night repairing fortifying breach casting vp rampier countermure fashion platforme trimmed planck boords basket made osier well supported borne vp strong postes fastened round great heapes stone verie height downefall place make dartes shot weakely throwen deliuered either flie staggering without force beaten downe backewardes vpon pressed forward could scarcely find stay rest plaine smooth place get themselues footing pressed assault yet stop stay body tumbled rolled downe repulse side towne especially towards gate place plaine open rising falling ground seeme easie pleasant souldiours asappi target pauishes placed round forefront behind appointed two great chosen squadron hargabussiers crossebowes thicke shower quarels deadly bullet might make within quit abandon defence walles intent ianissaries followed might easily carie place make themselues maisters towne helpe scaling ladder pressed forwarde furiously countenance resolute obstinate forgetting care feare wound yet death whole sound others wounded may med approch walles gotten vp laid hold vppon toppe battelments side walles felt diuelish rage furie cannon neither helpe receipt appeared carrie place onely scalado notwithstanding labour striuing much higher gotten ground skaling walles much lesse force keep stand many ouerborne proper weight burthen owne heauinesse tumble downe ground heeles vpwardes ladder vpon broken ouergreat weight clymed others hauing finger cut enforced forgo hold weapon falling first hand themselues followed body tumbled likewise chief principall furie fight stone like cast downe alofte exceeding great noyse offence mightily spoile encomber assailant armour furniture beit though fell continually innumerable heades downewards yet number assailant nothing diminished still came others fresh lustie place wounded wearied succeeding roomes still maintaine assault rushing furiously ouer carkasses bloud lay dead greater desire reuenge great hope preuaile without apprehension feare death herrible noise tumult made hast seize battelments ouermuch hastinesse striuing mount ech euerie one able get would attempt laboured tooth nayle employed bent force puissance defendant meane intent might preuent sodaine commingferibassa appointed army resist inuasios scanderbeg assault sfetygrade castriot inuasions might keepe still troupe might disturbed withdrawen towne assault discontinued sufficiencie thisferibassa praise co mendations chieftaine great notable good conceipt aduised full courage one continuall practise deed armes brought haue reputation worthie souldier excellent captaine hauing receiued charge ordered force neuer ceased coursing vppe downe side sending foorth scoutes discouer euen remote farthest place campe great impatiencie choller rest grieued discontented faire occasion honour commendation long delaied detayned attend expect enemie singular desire deuotion wish euen beene mightily doth immutable destinie heauens inueglesentence blinde eye licentiousnesse vnaccustomed libertie maketh v oftentimes hardie audatious either reason necessitie requisite ferybassa vnskilfull iudge owne strength puissance long since determined trie himselfe priuate particular combat scanderbeg vpon first opportunitie could get tumult armes furie fight time great part towne beaten downe certaine fortificationsassault sfetigrade ouerthrowen turkes likewise filled walles ladder sortes weapon especially long great hooke assaile presse vppon stoode vpon walles whilest others though vaine cease hollowe caues mynes digged earth haue made themselues way towne wanted also cast balles wildefire diuerse quarter citie yet mortyers vse knowen soone fire quenched inhabitant without sparing liues carefully guarde defende walles side chiefest stirre whole daunger manner towardes great gate mahometans helpe great number ladder long plankes bordes heaped together raised vp certaine tower plotforme manie might get vp hauing gotten good footing might afterwardes ayde themselues shotte dartes make defendantes forgoe place number enemy resorting thither increase continually assoone sawe matter intended nowe founde way enter towne brought great long beames strengthen enlarge newe building others made secret lodging couert close adioyning walles brought diuerse instrumentes pick eaxes barres yron like digge vndermine wall prouided likewise store arrowes dartes stone flying weapon might oppresse defendauntes toppe building nowe beganne heate furie assaylelantes ech side partes towne little little waxe colde thither drawen daunger violence conflict besides tumult horrible crie without make thing seeme fearefull terrible feare dispaire mingled together mightily seized vppon heart christian busily occupied defence place saw matter brought issue extremitie enemy could neither remoued yet hindered obstinate pursuite endeuors much repulsed beaten downe slaine much number still encrease fresh men continually succeeding roomes heapes mount vpon walles giuing time rest breathing anie intermission sort defendant want weapon repell force strength began faile perceiuing therefore resistance smally auaile fearing imminent daunger least towne side wonne enemie sent speedily call gouernour brute terrour running one alreadie come eares perlat summoned make hast thitherwarde meanes whereof sent call found neere hande comming place withall possible speede good diligence accompanied good troupe citizen people olde young men confounded amazed neither lesse heard towne beene alreadie taken turkes yet suspence vncertaine matter ranne thither sighing sorrowing yet desirous see issue lamentable sight spectacle presence hardie stout chiefetaine verie first onset beate mounted vppon wall certaine standardes turkes found raised vppon rampier quickely pulled away great crie clamour caried market place intent sight bootie might encourage hearten companion free former care one thing yet remained especiall importance breake peeces beate downe massye heape woode great beames timber lay neere wall vnder couert whereof haue saide souldiers lodged vndermine foundation pickeaxes iron barres furnish assaylants diuerse thinges needefull assault besides enemie yet standing firme aloft vppon tower pressing defendant furious eger vineger seething water boyling whot continued long force violence thereof often stroakes stone thing cast aloft plankes tower whole frame ladder ioyned helde together beganne length broken laide euen grounde like case engine instrument enemie broken buried vnder ruines frame besides hundreth common souldiers also two chiefe captaines crushed death smothered deadly fall building towne freed deliuered feare tampiors newly repayred walles furnished guarded fresh souldiers scarce one left either vnslaine vnwounded placed first gouernour traine went speedily thence oppose himselfe elsewhere attempt enemie time like debate conflict risen place turkes presse hard get aduantage walles towne seemed hard estate great daunger within gouernour departure mahometans beene repulsed beaten backe assault fresh supply men came hauing litle withdrawen themselues wall assoone knewe gouernour absent imagining former heate christian somewhat abated beganne againe goe hande former worke vndertake taske beene forced leaue vnfinished raising vp therefore againe beames timber walles yet fuming bloud companion seemed giue defendant new representation forepassed daunger last assayes fortunate former reason sudden arriuall perlat little labour ouerthrewe worke newe begunne stuffe scarcely yet brought together intent purpose quickly dispersed cast ground middest contention variety fortune assault presented selfe another kinde fight farre notable worthie regarded able haue withdrawen thoughtes haue staied handes one side haue made armes beene laide apart choller rancour quite forgotten pursue attempt stande still wholly attentiue successe companionsscanderbeg commeth inuade turkish campe prince epyre approched neere armie come almost within sixe hundreth pace enemie determined suddenly breake vppon campe side ferybassa readie prouided receiue force sultan giuen purpose thinke albanois anie intention onely faint false allarme hinder assault begunne make turkish bandes retyre walles euen chiefest furie wherefore preuent point made towardes would suffer himthe battell betweene scanderbeg feribassa passe forwarde till debated vppon matter scanderbeg feigning kinde feare beganne softly retyre drawing enemie still followed seuenscore pace farther force well ordered battell marching againe forwardes directly charged furiously turkish captaine beene euer desirous battell anie sort refuse hauing seene small number christian nine thousande men little scanderbeg left residue troupe fifteene hundred musache mile quarter safegarde others anie misfortune betide opposed footemen foure thousande horse placed front made head againststratageme feribassa enclose scanderbeg albanois receiued shocke rest horseman wylie fine stratageme caused secretly withdrawe themselues bodie armie farre fetch compasse intent might get behinde albanois backes hauing enclosed entangled side might shut vppe passage bereaue meanes possibilitie saue themselues perhappes also take scanderbeg aliue olde beaten expert souldier presently discouer deuise wherefore leauing moses maintaine fight middle battell himselfe troupe horseman readie resolute setting spurres horse turned aside right hande first sight hee staied course enemie hastened haue enclosed afterwards comming handie stroke pressing rudely vppon made giue ground ende change determination looke owne safegarde turkes foure thousand horse whereas albanois fully make two thousande neuerthelesse hope victorie rested indifferent party courage equall though fortune alike fell farre greater number circumcized musache likewise hauing beene called foorth albanois charged paynim left hand force kept rest employed manner army deuided tripartite represent one side forme three sundrie fightes combat moses behaued selfe wonderfull aduisedly seemed vse rather pollicie force enemie neither would giue bridle furie souldiers would aduenture hazarde ouer hastily till time perceiued two winges beganne haue likelihoode good successe made entrance victorie intent might reserue strength vigour men fresh lustie till therefore helde rankes battell firme close ioyned together kinde subtiltie seemed temporize prolong fortune fight till comming companion made feribassa fierce insolent presse vpon without intermission oftentimes would vse encourage hearten souldiers like speech good souldiers vse fauour god take benefit victorie whilest sword christian doe stand amazed whilestencouragement feribassa hu souldiers battell scanderbeg force doe growe faint goe seeke head vowed slaughter cut peeces cursed body see faint side scarce discerne token enmitie enemy neither doth countenance voice gesture make anie shewe haue minde stande vppe long may doe purposely delay combat attend comming night theeues robber vsed night behoueth aide selues light must keepe policie take opportunitie hand euen whilest exceede number surpasse valure staie night lesser number equall greater coward match valiant hardie would submit selues extreamest ruine desolation admit condition peace neuer vniust dishonest rather would drink water accordingly imagined came passe night wretch hauing polluted water carrion dog threw well next morning thing perceiued rumour thereof moment dispersed abroad one another ouer towne whereuppon began strange murmuring throughout street city enquire author detestable act found matter grew well neare sedition dibrians discomforted much possible extreamely grieue see themselues brought estate exclayming werethe notable superstition dibrians betrayed shortly die bruite beastes pure thirst want drinke see strangenes case much one rather make choise made slaue infidel drinke water cried loft ought set fire towne burne ash furious sally enemy prouide safety else die valiantly neuerthelesse mischieues held least fall composition enemy litle litle therefore griefe began vanish noise grew appeased part thus matter small moment trifle fiercenesse couragious stomackes dibrians abated faith quite exiled left forsaken superstitious conscience infidel easy accesse liberty repaire vnto eares began graciously encline conference enemy souldiours generall commotion without care regard dutythe dibrians determined surrender towne amurath water polluted deuoire prepare selues owne accord goe vnto amurath demand shamefull ignominious condition late gloriously refused reiected number citizen much lesser dibrians therefore farre inferiour vnto force puissance meanes whereof ability either put sword expell garrison towne besides bene able haue cleared town yet owne number fewe small suffice keepe watch ward vpon walles notwithstanding poore men murmured side sometimes exclayming infidelity sometimes accusing foolish blinde superstition charging euen scanderbeg absence braue valiant men fellowes companion die vnreuenged yet restraine forwardnesse willing mind others secondarie assay faint contemptible nowe better acquainted enemie hardened kinde daungers trauels b side giue libertie take breath would haue leasure also resolue themselues confidence fortifie town stronger defence much better therefore fresh new force attempt place force vttermost whilest yet wearied sore trauelled late labour defendant see thus obstinately bent couragiously resolued either would themselues abandon defence must needes faint perish vnder burden vnsupportable charge amurath vpon perswasions followed aduise caused great force lead conducted walles much tumult began renued moment might fortune selfe forsaking victours would haue fauoured new attempt mahometistes defendant notthe assault renued great diligence foresight prouided like case receiue good sort readinesse occasion fresh men opposed fresh men without great paine hold good possession place maintenance honour reputation barbarian went still onwards brute senselesse beast especially side leadeth towards port although way passe streight narrow two horseman could hardly march front together yet notwithstanding went horse backe euen close walles launce rest runne gate giuing thereby greater occasion rather laugh foolish sottish carelesnesse contempt liues admire commend hardinesse courage walles defendantes trouble enemie one forgotten former passion malice hatred lost feruencie desire fight wherewith lately possessed greatly hand desire leaue fighting stay assault welcome continuall sleepe victual night tidings brought scanderbeg victory croians gaue good cause ioy gladnesse presently imparted good newes vnto prince people next neighbour side thenumber turkes slaine first assault croy enemie great sorrow discontentment seene many dayes sad pensiue notable losse day worke hard digested hauing lost seruice good souldiers croians verie little losse without great slaughter speake reported amurath kept himselfe close shut vp within tent two whole dayes together debating vpon diuerse counsel opinion captaines visirs counsellers aboue others young mahomet shewed himselfe notably vexed discontented spirit boiling fury choller youthfull yeares yet vnacquainted crosse fortune aduersities turned passion griefe anguish meere rage madnesse thenceforth tooke vpon deale affaire campe carefull eye viewing reuiewing seuerall company shewed himselfe greedie reuenge spared labour himselfe extreamely night day verie watchfull time take aduantage fit occasion principally eie side albanois lately endammaged campe placed strong puissant court garde dressed many ambushments oftentimes would watch selfe whole nightes proper person intent fortune present good opportunitie oppresse scanderbeg might escape againe handes deuises turned nothing vanished away smoake prouident circumspect cariage expert chiefetaine prince albany day day enformed thinges either came render themselues vnto espial sent abroad purpose helde himselfe still quiet campe season ordering prouiding safetie affaire drawing enemy delayes notwithstanding could endure remaine long idle desirous enterprise shold surpasse others glory reputatio aduised self fine stratageme purposed surprise intentiue intrap one night therefore trussing vp baggage secretly remouedmonticlea army place called monticlea whence might comodiously trauel disturbe enemy left moses tanusee tume ista accompanied horse hauing set downe certaine prefixed time course comunicated enterprise willed set vppon trench enemy litle midnight next ensuing side last inuaded thea policie scanderbeg giuing canuazado turkish campe assoone giuen false allarme made shew forcing barrier campe suddenly speedily make away without giuing enemie meanes come handiblowes himselfe meane time hauing set thing good order leauing men guarde campe would side breake vpon tentes enemie residue armie according conclusion little distance time betweene allarme made moses comming scanderbeg assoone perceiued sudden rumour terrour allarme raised thea canuazado scanderbeg campe turkes dibrian side bare full strong carrer charged part litle doubted suspected manner campe infidel full doubt feare confusion ranne making great haste side oppose themselues violence christian one wakened another cry enuironned rounde beset enemie moses indeede put feare reason souldiers beene lately placed quarter mahomet easilie repulse especially forward night hindered fro pursuing suspected ambushment good cause doubt especially time dammage scanderbeg wrought cannot recounted campe part beaten downe foully deformed disordered sword fire yet inuasion continue long time reason sudden comming readie arriuall turkes whose presence great multitude soone determine ende conflict christian making retreate durst hazarde oppose themselues huge force vnited especially place plaine euen tyranna gaue charge vppon enemie neuerthelesse christian beganne retire infidel great desire follow might haue paid well warie circumspect warrior placed infanterie horse neere hand intent gard vnto behind backe serue casualty might befall company receiued retreate great ioy high cry clamor passing forward spent rest night trauelling campe reported scanderbeg neuer doe anie exploite vppon enemie lesse losse bloudshed brought backe troupe safe sounde without losse one man leauing vnto barbarian aniething saue woundes teares lamentation testimony sort slaughter foule discomfiture make manner quite forget calamitie late losse croy man durst thencefoorth open mouth vnto sultan aduise enterprise accident hauing succeeded notable infamie seeme reproue counsel deliberation time past present wherefore recourse generall astonishment wonted policie proued profitable yeare siege sfetygrade amurath fortifieth camp ordinance inuasions scanderbeg fortifie assure trench side artillerie drew downe therefore many small peeces planted walles bestowed conuenient place round campe according thought best greatest part placed quarter late found greatest danger vehemencie heate encombrance infinite baggage lodging deuided dispersed great distance one farre possible furnish fortifie endeuors long concealed christian wanted fugitiues good espial giue aduertisements certified continually doings enemie especially preparation beleeued likely example like vsed yeare last past wherefore scanderbeg also resolued lie still time hold himselfe contented aduantage alreadie gained enioy pleasure thereof till time might find new opportunitie happie action besides matter withdrew thought whereof hescanderbeg remoueth campe prouide victual haue care scarcitie dearth victual beganne fall short left countrey liuing creature could looke reliefe wherefore intent would want would refresh armie extreame heate summer determined remoue campe leade force certaine place singular recreation vpon riuer inhabitant call isme lyingriuer captaines euen friuolous cause offence small priuate quarrell haue say spent time waxed olde siege city fortress haue receiued many outrage many indignity many contumely disgrace disloialty albanian notable reproch leaue vnpunished vnreuenged euen day euer obtaine memorable victorie sorte blouddie remember battell varna honor glorie victorie doth scarce admit comparison vnpossible tame enemie fierce haughtie without expence losse blood difficult thing doe come happie issue onely extreame labour hard trauell vpon croy onely doth depend consequence whole warre discretion shalbe euer freed enemie countrie place gained principall fortresse epire scanderbeg aduenture continue much one day wherfore plucke vp heart good frends away feare faintnes courage must make triall fortune haue follow dearely bought cost twentie owne company defendant though altogether free dammage yet good suertie neither hazard losse towne besides helpes naturall strength situation place made attemptes miscreantes vaine purpose yet notwithstanding time defence place depend vpon valure defendant deuoire good diligence euer shew themselues al hand stout valiant gaue maruellous proof faith prowesse iourney hauing dispersed certaine troupe horseman ouer fieldes destroy vine thing bearing frute throughout countrey dismarched therefore great secrecie possible arriued within three myles barbarian chose foure thousand good strong horse charge vpon open plaine field foote force residue horseman left moses placed high hill neare high waye hope enemie passe willed saw infidel flie way order dispersed suddenly fall vpon charge fiercely perceiue hold good stand firme maintaining fight equall fortune valure without mouing speedily come forward company ioyne himselfe force doubted case enemie durst abide either make pay buy resistance verie deare else driue shamefull dishonorable flight flight nothing deceiued rest fell otherwise expected sebalias aduertised comming christian sentinel set watch purpose vpon signe giuen made force gather together keepe neare vnto excepting scattered farre became easie prey albanois sight enemie poasted thence another way knew scanderbeg marching thus nothing done time worthy speaking rather castriot kept force following regard footemen able without excessiue toyle trauell endure long iorney pursuing besides perpetuall care croie greatly restraine forwardnes fierecnes held wisedome reserue armie good plight continuall want necessity towne one side therfore turkish chieftaine returned amurath great ioy contentment abused scanderbeg kept day troubling trench side epirot returned campe extremely grieued lost oportunitie perplexity mind tooke croy whence accustomed farre absent himselfe report goeth met many vpon way gaue notice turkish commissary abroad victual conuoy prouided safe conduct whereupon disguising himselfe hand simple attire ordinarie policie vsed warres beingambuscado scanderbeg whereby surprizeth turke victualler attended hundreth souldiers habit followed victualler tract passed hauing learned way returne put himselfe companie ambuscado sent two souldiers men good iudgement experience go lyssa willing get notice beare good espiall vpon troupe enemie carefully obserue whether returne take way passed thitherwards poast away speede giue intelligence victualler returning way went fell hand scanderbeg hauing slaine tooke others prisoner corne beast carriage horse conueyed campe distributed booty amongst souldiers done moses returning backe campe besides isme brought thither troupe foote leading whilest amurath carefully great diligence set forwarde mine croy much carefull neuer ceased molest besiegedturkish campe croy victualled macedonie often continuall allarmes skirmish intent keeping busied defence walles might lesse able discouer drift new deuises secret practises receiued diuerse message one acquainted discomfiture victualler taking corne thing else passed alchia brought newes certaine corne comming macedon latter gaue cause ioy contentment former renue wonted griefe discontentment one partly recompence turkes much moued matter laying aside care matter instant souldiers applyed care studie new supply prouisions might brought safetie campe wherefore consent prince appointed strongest able men whole armie conuoy victual intent also made prey christian lately bene default good strong conuoy safeconduct scanderbeg time sufficiently busied conueying bootie towards owne campe might better auoide enemie way encounter returne fetched long compasse diuerse wayes force bene present readines think would haue bene desirous pursue set vpon enemie hazard himselfe mightie puissant multitude moses great incertaintie perplexitie prince epire reaso certified good espial departure troupe campe turkes doubt least prepared confusion wherefore sent forth light horseman diligence celeritie great iornies go seeke scanderbeg aduertise particular tidings till returned people charged spoiles slaine enemy graine taken likewise mahomatistes without lette disturbance made speedie returne corne victualles prouisions campe meanes whereof thus prouided necessarie sustenance body made take good heart againe reuiue strength courage trauell without ceasing vndermining wall howbeita myne made turkes croy excessiue labor work swallow vp many within earth notwithstanding pioners seuerall time houres particularly proportioned vnto ech like order also obserued throughout squadron amongst souldiers euerie tent within campe continuall labour obstinate resolution men easily surmount difficultie daylie continue skirmish loose fightes walles purpose abuse citizen albeit daie passed without death slaughter yet account losse amongest many thousand fighting men infidel sort spend time ioyfully contentmentvenetian subiectes succour turkes campe croy victual reason ouer aboue store abundance victualles lately arriued macedony also great number marchauntes next townes vnder obeisance venetian serued plentie corne wine oyle sortes victualles day day campe neither want mercerie ware diuerse brought thither purpose traffique prouerbe like fly drawing honny repaire flocke thither quarter knew estate campe great penurie prouisions excepting money onely scanderbeg see verie well yet would offend subiectes friendes confederate hinder prinate gaine particular tooke great patience willing people also dissemble well himselfe without giuing offence person either word deede howsoeuer ignorant though hindered traffique betweene yet enemie haue wanted place reason nearenesse macedonie thrace seruia therfore busied braines greater matter affaire importance might force armes dint sword famine want sustenance expell outragious enemie epyre made haue especiall care regard matter deeply considered encrease augmenttanusee moses sent scanderbeg leauie new supply souldiers force eight thousand men leauied beginning warre litle lesse thousand wonderfull counsell aduise would willingly leaue angle corner realme exposed iniurie violence aduersaries time leauie made scanderbeg croians importuned daily alarmes infidel could longer containe themseluescroyans sallie vpon turkes within walles often time sallying towne great good happe successe encounter one day aboue rest seruice notable time issued forth garrison hauing well beaten enemie many cut peeces residue put flight earnest forwarde chase pursued euen within trench made mahometistes sawe christian hardie couragious temeritie drawe vppon good fortune grieue verie much companion lay slaine hope soone reuenged hope made vaine meanes vranocontes though sawe souldiers returne little dammage yet neuerthelesse wisely weighing danger hazard dayes seruice politique subtill disposition enemie would thence foorth permit set foote without porte greater griefe notable slaughter scanderbeg brought vpon amurath force new bandes vnited incorporateda second canuazado scanderbeg campe turkes croy bodie whole armie deuided three part one moses tanusee third reserued himselfe shutting euening caused ensignes march verie secretly directly towards campe enemie gotten farre monticlea distant two mile trench discouered turkish sentinel great suddaine tumult vnderstoode comming tent lay neerest daunger wherefore nothing omitted barbarian neither leaue anie remedie vnattempted vncertainety darkenesse night could aduise vnto either repelling backe debarring entring vppon gathered together great haste tumult eight thousand men opposed themselues made pause little softer pace leasure march forwarde mahometans aduaunced selues encounter huge crie handes first beganne fight christian refusing ioyne fight litle litle recuiled backwardes intent drawing farther trench fury might abated diminishedmoses tanuse inuade turkish campe hereupon moses tanuse hauing sodainly entred rampiers barrier part appointed filled al campe exceeding feare confusion entred surprized oftentimes seene forgotten aide themselues day began appeare prince albany giuing place vnto enemy withdraw himselfe middest chiefestscanderbeg retireth enemy heat fight retired mile hinder getting vp began slacke pace scanderbeg would stirre till certainly knew people approach yet could policy conueyed cunningly barbarian perceiue easily turning bridle vpon hearing noise men comming seeing vauntcurrours contented approach nearer great hast feare casting many ensignes ground made awaiethe turk flie speed possible neuerthelesse great bast altogether preserue sword enemy
