either attempted determined day christian report next day scanderbeg small traine attending according wonted vse seene barbarian walke vpon top mountaine hangeth ouer croy therespeach amurath touching scanderbeg seeing vpon mountaine euer croy haue conference vranocontes reported person shewed vnto amurath men pointed hee blamed folly inconstancy people dogges laughter saying told best way let alone furious vntamed lion thenceforth feede vnhappy beast bloud men peraduenture might length brought reason owne rage proper fury rather force armes vsed litle dishonour scanderbeg heare wordes vttered mouth aduersary likewise taken marke singular honour power draw testimony enforced enemy harbour conceipt matter whole army barbarian great sorrowe ignominy demeaned selues rather men besieged besieged others besides mishappes also added ensueth lesse importaunce also greatly encrease misfortune secret working mine come knowledge thethe mine turkes discouered ouerthrowen croians inhabitantes whereupon one night issued forth towne see done therein know went done silence secresie sodainely ouerthrew scattered part worke discouered doings enemy without seene perceyued skoutes till time hauing marred implement prouisions retired towne safety beleeue well made choise dead time night men soundest sleepe represent image shape death yet doe deny sallied forth time knew meanes enterprise enemy suppose turkes well able conceale fraudulent inuention secrete working christian countenaunce demeanour coniecture grow suspition intent whereupon soone began grow doubtfull matter presently deuised surprise preuent deuise say place certaine basonsa deuise discouery mine pannes brasse mettall full water diuerse place beating sound blowes working vnder ground counterstroakes rebounding noise made force stroaks would euidently shew place mine vnderneath earth although sufficiently discerne entry mine neuerthelesse fearing least surprised conueyaunce thereof vnder earth might digged turning winding great vncertainety whereby enemy might brought towne side least suspected therefore deuised inuented remedy mischiefe doubtfull vncertaine may one assertion true eyther hath likelihood probability howbeit latter ingenious former iudgement trueth thereof likely soeuer one thing doubted denied though croians litle nothing feare endeuours enemy yet make prouision good aduise exact deliberation thing within towne whereby might preuent interrupt pretence ottoman might deuise therefore soone amurath knew mine discouered townes men chearefully fortifie themselues kindes resistaunce gaue ouer conceipt fantasy surceased proceeding purpose fallen deceipt remained still hidden concealed citizen yet notwithstanding would end haue discontinued worke owne proper motion vndermining ground many rockes strong banckes hard stone euery place euer hinder worke reason nearenesse proximity mountaine much haue cleft pierced would haue beene endlesse labour worke inestimable difficulty yet would haue obstinately perseuere care remoued resolued employ thoughtes proue way deuise whereof litle profite see could manner meanes money corruption bring croians deuotion held amisse haue recourse policy inuention seeing neither force fraude menace threatnings could preuaile profite thing hee sent therefore vranocontes one bassaes man high degree andan ambassage sent vranocontes amurath intent corrupt make betray croy great authority person one greatly commended dexterity witte iudgement taking two seruaunts onely handes full precious giftes rich presentes sumptuous ornamentes turkishe fashion instruction giuen made mention yeelding towne offer present vranocontes name amurath better thereby prepare minde disposition intended decided parley done willed subtelly sound andinstructions giuen amurath ambassadour search depth thought see affected large promise gold siluer practise induce deliuer place hand shew easie thing chiefe commaunder gouernour garrison seeing number citizen small slender might drawen either loue constraint allow souldiers accept like likewise souldiers would contradict thing thinke meet moreouer assure besides offer presentes sent vnto people want place degree honour could desire court ambassadour turke hauing charge instruction giuen take way directly towards towne approached neare port stayed guard till time gouernour aduertised comming vranocontes speedily sent arriued turke deliuered summe commission first presenting giftes amurath labour glorious wordes insinuate worke fauor good liking christian thinking allure cunning perswasions get credence message intent might cutte spending time tedious enough sayed gouernour haue adorned goodly present goodly elegant speaches let v heare rest message bring v maister shall wespeach vranocontes ambassadour amurath ready receiue giftes accept largesse shall know summe demand otherwise may thinke way bind selues vnto curtesies sort tied vnto bond benefites tending perhaps infamy reproach vnlesse first see end vse liberality exceeding extraordinary may either accept safely reiect iustly present word shall haue made cleare manifest intent meaning heart barbarian nothing abashed speach gouernor replied thereunto immediately howsoeuer quoth matter haue brought giftsanswere turkish ambassador vranocontes vnder pretence deceiue man way deale slaues child free valiaunt person although vranocontes thing proceeding enemy suspitious thou hast sayed well wisely whereof selues also ignoraunt yet durst without blushing present selues thee saying handes voide empty neither oughtest thou condemne gratitude mindes thou man thou seemest thou art reported generally receiue therefore take good part presentes shall way wrong thee impediment thou maiest freely full liberty dispose thy affaire continue thy former rightes ordaine thou pleasest whether thou doest refuse reproue request thing haue say vnto thee perhaps doe much concerne thy good whether thou doe approue allow present offered thee franckly freely sort obiect reproach vnto thee nothing held esteemed base vile seruile giue expect profite gaine gift come vnto thee gentle worthy captaine freely owne accord speake bottome heart doe seeke surprize thee neither wordes giftes haue often proued inuincible armes dint sword doest repute thing inferiour vnto thee greatnesse thy thoughtes cause amurath loueth thee doth admire rare vertues enemy cause doth desire meanes may haue thee neare vnto doubt place neare presence great monarke far fit conuenient thy merites excellent magnanimity thy courage dexterity thy spirite shall able finde way meanes mount highest supreame degree glory good fortune condemne scanderbeg euen selues enemy doe glorifie recouery countrey defending often valiantly yet thy succour assistance principally thou art worthy another maner prince better higher aduauncement spend thy yeares consume thy glorious life obscurity vility basenesse estate moreouer scanderbeg good fortune vanish away euen moment destiny haue opposed enemy mighty endure continually wel may punishment deferred season cannot auoided extreme incredible hatred hath ottoman prince conceiued ouer aboue incomparable force hath assembled destruction hath sworne protested spare costes expences trauelles daungers depart epire till time haue subdued imposed deadly mortall yoke vpon head see originall mischiefe doth begin principally croy heare euery day sounding eares counsellours like speaches rather shamefully abandon forsake imperiall city andrinople dominion estate empire quit possession place leaue city vnconquered wrath shall fully satisfied slaughter butchery dismembred body doubt doe doe tremble foretell though one enemy amongst infinite others yet man haue humaine passion therefore hardly eies able endure suffer miserable sight obiect pitifull lamentable condition assure selues faile chaunge mindes taking benefit long sufferance patience accept safety light liberty peace freely offered vnto go say god name fortresse vnmatchable walles inaccessible valour rest shall preserue defend long pray doe thinke ottoman raise siege remoue campe middest chiefe heate war shall see cost shall feele griefe losse though force profite preuaile though attempt endeuours doe proue vaine bootlesse yet say shall see still eies shall continually behold wals enemy tent till time extremity importunity offamine mastereth ouercommeth thing doe end enforce yeeld submit selues hope haue left pray whence greedy desire peril danger hath seized vppon obstinat hardened heart shall scanderbeg supply want victual imprisonned within wals constrained keepe close hidden continually forrests wandring vp top mountain ouerloaden ouerwhelmed side care trauels scarceable sustaine miserable body venetian send succour prouisions daily bring furnish v store sustenance necessary war euen excesse superfluity wise therefore braue valiant well aduised take wit vnto behold enemy warneth haue persisted long enough obstinacy neither countrey liberty ought wilfully defended oppose selues wil pleasure diuine maiesty behoueth yeeld giue place fortune bend knee puissant mighty liberty wherof speake vnto true liberty true rewardes perpetuall tranquillity life power amurath prouide therfore selues whilest affair sound good estate whilest haue yet time determine vpon whilest enemy exhort entreat loue entertain rather companion friend good liking slaues prisoner force constraint maner barbarian deliuer message framing conforming singu good grace countenance voice hauing finished attend obserue alteration could perceiue spirit affection copany purposing thereupon haue taken occasion treat part secret gouernour vpon residue ambassade knowing affection mightely estranged liking subiect discourse men knew contemne sword enemy word onely hearing souldiers begin mutter murmure wrong offred rather perswaded yeeld themselues praid gouernour giue leaue vse word two vnto himselfe alone secret likewise accorded vnto much rely trust vpon sage wisdome constancy personage assured would vndertake thing aduantage maiesty realme albany profit ech particularly began wily fox declare secret committed vnto sultan couering detestable hatefull message affected plausible speech possible vranocontes vranocontes reiecteth turkish ambassador dismisseth threat menace foreseeing venome pernitious practises cut interrupt middest talke enioyning presently get sight thus wholly confounded ashamed ambassador depart man accepting bribe expresse commandement gouernor otherwise doubted licentiousnes greedy desire souldiers would haue needed intreaty lighten varlet cariage time trim orator turkishe prince retiring ready depart vranocontes recompence painted fine language denounce vnto sentence straightly charging commanding neither thenceforth hardy part behalfe ottoman repaire againe town demaund parley protesting assured besides losse handes nose eares haue body wholly hideously deformed tormented bassa returned campe receiued multitude common sort great confusion long expected great deuotion come forth desirous vnderstand resolution besieged maner hope wherupon build getting croy finishing labor perceiued present receiued saw hand bassa seruants knew well nothing done concluded moreouer heard reported obstinacy croians made answer sort already declared one conceiued heart either sorrow feare fury acording naturall inclination euery one particular agedamurath turkes agreeued repulse ambassador prouide assault croy sultan aboue al rest ouercome impatiency recourse arm purposing force towne aslault earst giuen ouer surceased wherin rather content wrath choller way reuenge disgrace dishonor commanded therfore make ready ladder engins assault next morning spending almost al whole night idle vaine labor placing artillery forgetting also prouide security surety campe knowing castriot eie alwaies open deuise mean annoy cause left men wel appointed held horse alwaies readines still bridled next morning aboutcroy assaulted th rd time day break souldiers conueied placed neare wals first beginning roaring cannon went one side seeme contend deuoure bloud cause greatest mortality shot christian fell fortunatly infidel litle respectiue people enemy whilest assaied driue men defence wals made many owne copany forsake fight reason deadly wound regard euident danger feared ordinance done thundering came scalado wherein much appeare perfect valour true courage much matter still find aduenture losse liues moment bloud seene side runne downe streames earth euery couered senslesse breathlesse body amurath could anie longer endure cruell selfe notwithstandingturkes repulsed assalt enterprized last attempt meere wilfulnesse obstinacie wherfore causing fight cease retired pauillion one enraged mad griefe anger passed residue day owne hand violence outrage aged white haires pulling himselfe chin eye lifted vp heauens powred forth many iniurious blasphemous speech reproching euen god selfe complaint exclamation seeme question reserued hoarie haires andamurath impatiecie enraged ill successe exclaimeth god aged yeares many misfortune ignominy whole race forepassed life name ottoman altogether disgraced dishonored glorie mightie conquest atchieued many yeares last obscured darkened meanes one poore base castell epire maner vile paultry village bassaes familiar labour comfort diuerse discourse recounting vnto world example ancient moderne sudden fall misfortune great mightie prince manie straunge foraine king emperours vaine crased mind would admit comfort notwithstanding day following old man albeit verie weake ill disposed bodie vehemencie griefe hauing euen almost spent wasted nothing yet fall counsell certaine chieftaines greatest peeres report goeth foure number two bassaes one romania asia andamurath consulteth vpon proceeding siege croy two call vizirs counsellers long time deliberating vpon summe consequence war deuided three diuers opinion one continue siege long till extremity famine worn besieged secod aduise leaue croy pursue scanderbeg force mean though haue wil force armes yet might peraduenture enclose shutte vp place famine bemaster last opinion seeing sufficiently tried al mean aduentured fortune al hazard meer folly continue longer shame infamy vpon despite indignation onely consume destroy owne army good rather send ambassador albanois deale perswade vpon tearmes become tributary ottoman case giue eare vnto demand crownes yearely tribute opinion allowed safe amurath consider selfe would good honorable colour shew victory departure epire might prescribe condition enemy impose yoke subiection vpon prouince albanie continue siege found inconuenient many reason foresee thousand discommodities winter would bring vpon besieger would sooner wearied besieged moreouer default want victual maintenance many thousand men long time thing importance daily course inuasions enemy like make vppon campe litle feared neither amurath like take pleasure lose time running wandering vp downe mountain albany scanderbeg seeing thing also could effected without singular daunger wonderfull hazard himselfe armie matter therefore thus resolued ambassade committed toisup sent ambassadour amurath scanderbeg coclude peace care wisedome turke whose name isup personage great credite authoritie amurath hauing bethought himselfe might summe would seeme great vnto epyrote warned ambassadour refuse condiscend submit selfe great tribute abate one halfe one thing yet remained seemed somwhat difficult meanes meet scanderbeg go wandring vp prouince seeke without knowing place certaine countrey armes seemed matter daungerous little safetie notwithstanding name ambassadour euery sacred inuiolate butsentence eased care meanes certaine dibrians prisoner turkish campe couenaunt vndertake might haue libertie conduct barbarian safe sounde presence castriot graunted deliuered lead way taking course campe christian first place came mountaine tumenista finding prince epire went right towards riuer isme vpon sea side missed also night hauing remoued carriage retired open countrey inhabitant call red plaine whereof dibrians hauing notice certaine thatthe red plaine dwelled thereabouts departed thence within lesse houre came place farre riuer isme entred campe one guide leauing mahometan others went duty scanderbeg know pleasure concerning ambassador dibrian knowne owne squadron entertained welcomed many salutation embracement entermingled teares reason longing desire see speedily conducted soueraigne hauing seene welcomed souldier hauing heard message without delay sent tanusee well accompanied good traine horseman footman go conduct ambassador vnto conueyed presence prince day deliuer thing touching message charge maister night began approch entertained great curtesie feasted sumptuously passed night within tent christian meane moses good number horseman mounted horsebacke commandemetscanderbeg great care prouidence preuent sodaine surprise enemy scanderbeg ridden forth course vp round discouer side far neare vallies woody place watch also doubled quarter campe feare lest vnder faint shew colour ottoman attempt exploit nothing else done almost night campe christian assoone day chiefe principall armie called assembled together scanderbeg gaue audience turkish ambassador formerly prepared oratio artificially framed deuised thought haue perswaded ingenious free spirit sort condescend vnto purpose began therefore maner could wishe scanderbeg god would haue giuen v minde affectionoration isup sca erbeg long agoe wherewith come vnto thee though perhappes late ought made wise owne harmes neither partes seene many goodly army consumed destroyed one destinie neither shouldest thou dayly behold thy eye thy realme pitifully dismembred shouldest thou haue heard many complaint lamentation side amongest thy subiects hath nature ordained appointed impossible attaine perfect peace rightfull equitie without bloud violence armes let v therefore hold selues contented take good part resteth let v preserue small reliques remainder better fortune sufficiently hath land albany bene ouerflowen bloud mankind many yeares sufficient deformitie desolation prouince sometimes pleasant beautifull flourishing seate great famous king god hath giuen vnto amurath mighty force puissance doth maner exceede beyond humane desire whereas thy dominion scanderbeg thou compare may speake freely small nothing neuerthelesse valour thy people thy vertue exceedeth thy great admirable fortune haue made despised whereof thou hast made glorious triall whole course thy warres selues though thou enemy haue oftentimes publique priuate greatly wonder admire doe well remember proude people hungary greece abounded infinitly good wealth easily tamed subdued weapon nation continueth inuincible vtterly impatient dominion flatter thee thy enemy would god thing speake true onely countrey thing see haue made shew either valiant fortunat reason would prosperitie albanian ought held somuch suspitious end wherof though may happen fall miserable hath puffed vp spirit ouermuch credulity already embraced perpetuall possession thereof end ruine confusion yet set eies particularity good fortune lingring war hath bereaued likewise sort strength reputation albeit hitherto haue held war v without great losse diminution force yet sfetigrade ample large territory become multitude mannors building rich farmes well planted husbanded wonted beautifull shew aspect thing wherefore goodly region wasted spoiled large garner storehouse corne wherewith town next adioyning italy selfe wont stored relieued conclude without touching matter noble goodly wals croy battered deformed seemeth scarce left shew token countenance defendant euen breathing life retaine part former estate wonted condition scanderbeg thou doest expect thou seest thing hasten bring vpon thee million mischief vexation thy town taken lost pressed strong mighty siege croy capitall city thy countrey maner brought nothing remaineth nothing obstinacy people though hold season yet end soone ouercome pure want amurath hath resolued augment force continue siege al winter yea another summer need many yeares till time sworde cannot maister yet famine shall make stoope vnder subiection otherwise case thou bee desirous thy owne misfortune doest shewe thy selfe vnwise refuse condition peace come vnto thee behold ottoman stead thy mortall enemy content accept thee friend tributarie raise campe croy lead away ensignes epyre brought hither enemy neuer returne againe holdeth pretious without bloudshed binde prouince stipendary vnto acknowledge greatnesse benefit seeke impose vpon endlesse cruell seruitude greatnesse benefite demaundeth small charge easie burthen content take ten thousand crownes yearely tribute thing appertaineth either owne due demaundeth none well may albanois thou also scanderbeg without dishonour without dammage consent accorde one point onely iust demaunde amurath regarde many townes epyre many possession many goodly thing thou doest enioy hold right inheritance onely vsurpation meere violence ismorea named peloponnesus greece morea thing lesse noble epire thecaramania cilicia caramanian prince way inferiour vnto thee nobilitie puissance richesse let speake vnto thee without reproofe besides many people nation excellent renowne antiquitie willingly without constraint cause tributs brought dayly euen andrynople much reason hast thou yeeld vnto like seeing imposed vppon thee way bondage seruitude rather certaine bonde strict obligation thy fidelitie examine well thy owne force prudent politique prince consider good happie fortune let excellent occasion slippe away time thy handes thou shouldest reiect condition alliance offered thee may hereafter thou wilt desirous haue graunted wilbe late time estate thy affaire chaunged thou shalt finde countenaunce victour austere much loftie imperious labouring thus earnestly carefully perswade thee matter doe standeth either maiestie ottoman grauitie ambassade neuerthelesse reuoke thing haue spoken rather enemy may thing preuaile pray entreat require beseech whilest yet time whilest old man good minde would haue regarde consideration owne estate ioyntly one doe thinke fall vnhappily peace obtained amurath wilbe discontented shall haue cause wearied greeued certainly therein particular interested onely men shall smart vppon whose heades whole mischiefe like fall fulfilling pleasure satisfie furious appetite passion must vowe slauish body prodigally expose aduenture liues hazardes accident owne bloud must satiate wrath malicious minde euery day must bowelles must continue shedding others bloud till time either one two glutted mischiefe long perseueraunce certaine kinde vnhappie fate destinie doth altogether deuoure consume party ambassadour would haue proceeded forward speech assemblie grewe sodaine tumult commotion murmured others reioyced triumphed see amurath enemy persecutour able harme wearied euen worne toyles trauels long continued warres one already vanquished ouercome valour could forbeare laughing heare condition ambassadour seeme offer propound vnto glorious shew ostentation good word frowned muttered amurath vnder shadow colour peace amitie intend cunningly worke submit themselues yoke yeelding person tributary enemy able subdue conquer dare say one like better reconciliation offered war still continued nay much estimate meete matter debated voyces full common councell mightely mindssentence mortall men puffed vp prosperous happy successe affaire ala become brightnesse glorious renowme nation noble generous spirites seede inuincible vertue epirots magnanimity epirots dayes scanderbeg see estate empire miserably rent torne townes taken others straightly besieged landes patrimony auncestours couered ouer men armes wiues child remoued exiled farre sight euen languishing pining away griefe continuall feare lamentation body friend fellowes dayly slaine dismembred eies thing flowing drowned bloud cruelty yet euery one take delight pleasure remaine continue meane low fortune stand vppon guard maintenaunce liberty great expence losse bloud though without hope good successe rather would sort yeeld vnto infidell giue vnto enemy least shew confession faintnesse cowardize wherefore scanderbeg whose minde also euer vndaunted vtterly vnacquainted passion feare timerousnesse appeased murmuring noise raised amongst turned himselfe isup would seeme returne maister ottoman disdaine suspence without certaine resolution made aunswere manner thou hast propounded vnto v isup time thinganswere scanderbeg isup ambassade remember heretofore offered v ayradin first comming crowne letter brought vnto v name sultan demaunde v certaine place epyre macedonie touching point full answere giuen time sufficient haue satisfied doe thinke estate much empayred manner augmented face shewe honestie seeme time offer condition long discourse recounting losse sfetygrade battery ruine walles croy spoyling wasting fieldes territory doe scarce account losse long heades safetie long souldiours health well disposed long people securitie wilbe easie matter beleeue recouer whatsoeuer lost repayre destroyed god aiding assisting v nothing destroy reedifie thing want quicke handes good workemen haue vndertake aunswere pray thee seeing thou hast delight reckon vppe misfortune dearely haue bought payed continually losse store bloudshed haue bought sfetygrade albeit prowesse carried superstition besieged siege croy many best souldiours hath cost goe hold still god name braue manner might alwayes proceede continue happynesse part doe enuie well content see ensignes alwayes continue within epire suffer townes besieged assaulted fieldes pilled wasted whatsoeuer good macedonie spoyled destroyed long beare like markes token good fortune testimony valure protest vnto hold better expedient v entreat depart epire buy departure high price set v god forbid age time see man liuing euer heare prouince become tributarie long scanderbeg aliue assure selues ottoman would restore vnto whole entire possession macedonie patrimonie ancestours nay amurath would deuide make copartner empire would neuer suffer name albanie stained blemished blot disgrace infamie vayne therefore doest thou heape vp example stranger forreine state vayne doest thou represent eye subiection peloponnesians seruitude asia example president whatsoeuer great weight efficacie may moue free liberall hart subiect submit selfe base villanous andsentence fowle indignitie turke made reply vnwilling stand longer vpon thisamurath sickneth vppon griefe melancholy matter therefore held needelesse also make offer lesser tribute follow instruction giuen sultan sawe mindes generall abhorre heare submission counsell therefore risen conducted trayne dine scanderbeg owne lodging great cheare honorable entertaynement giuen tanusee certaine horseman conuey myle campe feare least vpon fauour shewed licentiousnesse souldiours might sortworke iniurie outrage vnto scarce gotten sight albanois scanderbeg armie doubting ambushments enemy speedely remoue thence march away presently tumenista placed gardes scout side far greater care vsed time returne isup amurath lay tyranna lesser greatly augment former griefe conceipt thereof redouble violence disease sickenesse daunger whereof day day aggrauated growing suspitious made bassaes quit almost care armes deuise vpon nothing else cure succour old sultan maladie vncertaine disease vnknowen vnto saw better receipt remedy minister vnto entertaine store good wordes pleasant talke deuises sickenesse engendred impatiency griefe discontentment require lenified mitigated thing confortatiue purposely applied put away melancholy cure wrought new pleasant delight might cheare vp drooping thought reuiue spirites greeuously perplexed estate affaire time turke founde selfe thus sicke quiet notwithstanding could yet sort giue audience speake vnto people without much payning himselfe able giue direction prouide manie accident seemed requisite necessarie till time scanderbeg aduertised indisposition crazinesse person altogether draw bodie litle strength vigour remained yet left either member courage meanes two three inuasions made vpon campe first second time much harme done scarce hardy courage scanderbeg taking benefit night time proper naturall procure tumult feare confusion marched horsmen towards tyranna place plaine easie horse serue mean therof tent turk wold subiect inuasio enemy past midnight christian foote coming wasa third canuazado scanderbeg campe turkes croy discouered noyse neighing horse darknesse greater vsuall accustomed heauens couered obscured thicke grosse cloudes yeeld forth light clearenes therefore hardly could thing done ordained violence furie albanois neuerthelesse according opportunity time prouide remedy souldiers disposed order according could best imagine hearing hauing sight enemy neither quality season lesse cotrary suspitious christian also howbeit ordinarily assailant hath resolution assurance party surprised yet certen horror seize vpon seemed somewhat daunt courage durst set forward march one another midst doubtfulnesse staggaring one part scanderbeg taking hundred horse vauntcurrors seuering himselfe bodie troups aduanced forward great furie euen enemy trench prouoke issue hauing incensed high cry clamor casting dart amongst drew forth appointed station separated themselues companie purpose set vpon hope haue defeated greatest mischiefe lighted vpon themselues part ouerthrowen residue glad quickly returne fro whence came scanderbeg continued time coursing vp downe one deluded dalyed sought meanes haue drawen forth greater troupe charge seing time passe away vaine friuolous expectation darknesse night little little bganne weare away drawing approch day returned companie without fayning dissembling ordered troupe excellent good skill deuided betwene streeze tanusee moses left infanterie tumenista hauing readily instructed lead enemie first onset shot wherwith plaied one vpon another fight order albanois doubt least rankes ioyne mingled together darke night souldiers scarce able know felowes fro infidel cause would suffer presse vpon enemy neither come handystroakes beene long turkes selues presuming vpon huge multitude cause strong battallion horse make towardes left side purposed haue enclosed christian betweene scanderbeg seeing little separated rest mayne armie presently withdrawe selfe trench open fielde deuiding troupe also sunder intent fight maintayned pattes made speedily charged great furie behinde first onset barbarian receiued braue hardie resolution expecting fresh succour haue seconded campe long tariance slackenesse supply decrease owne strength litle litle fayled furie christian encreasing together aduantage gotten made length set spurres horse neuer thought runne fast enough till gotten within campe great number turkes christian also left liues conflict infidel betooke themselues flight time day beganne breake multitude infidel beganne growe great encrease mightily constrayned streeze tanusee retyre turkish troupe would gladly haue pursued retreate feare displease sultan layde aside desire reuenge busied themselues recounting owne loss misfortune besides slaughter onely made fight happened disorder within campe neither aine bootie pillage gouen onely small spoyles founde vppon dead body must note fight begunne ended without within trench campe great men chiefetaines armie aduisedly seeke conceale discomfiture sultan intent melancholique humour might haue matter worke vpon neuerthelesse could anie meanes keepe knowledge olde man verie iealous full care meanes generall publique murmuring whispering priuate plaintes common sort easily discouer happened vnto mind already enclyning addicted suspect worst commonly seene none either couragious greater coward popular sort good bad successe fortune turkes goe vp downe campe deuising debating one another saying enemy would one time finde good opportunitie set vpon tent pauilions euen sultan lord soueraigne ottoman greatly perplexed vppon course proceedingesturks great perplexitie vpon sicknesse amurath breake vppe campe raise siege leaue warre vndertaken great courage shewe magnanimitie verie shame would suffer im counselled notwithstanding leaue greatest part force croy continue siege himselfe retire take iourney andrinople meanes prouide owne health safetie absent himselfe bloudie sight enemy viewe tragicall spectacle calamity force desease would little little vanish away abolished health euerie day empayring waxing worse worse breath little little beginning faile knew immutable decree heauens reuoked neither chaunge place succour humaine counsell aduise wherefore although neuer ceased soueraigne medicamentes remedy seeke recouerie health reuiue decayed bodie mindes mortall men neuer destitute hope yet speciall regard sort marriners saylers haue lost pylots euerie man power abilitie prouide procure thinges requisite armie might secured preserued wherefore causing tent drawen closer neerer together lay dispersed subiect violence enemie entrench campe streight circuit within lesser compasse garding defending rampiers good strong force armed souldiers hauing thus ordered estate affaire attend either death sultan therewithall end warre else peraduenture health recouerie minister vnto new fresh plot strengthening reenforcing siege scanderbeg notice matter wanted daily aduertisementes bring newes vnto many also amongst infidel came rendered themselues vnto learned counsel secret deuises enemy almost one day repayred vnto great number seeking refuge campe townes especially publikely supposed commonly beleeued sultan drawing neere end vsually seene vulgar sort doe willingly followe fortune thatsentence partie supposed secure greatest suertie scanderbeg thought best continue ordinarie allarmes inuasions rather referre ouer reserue chiefest violence till time amurath deceased neuerthelesse would oftentimes walke abroade day bycrayna mountaine ouer croy night vpon toppe mountaine named crayna would deuise vppon matter vranocontes else would coursing vppe downe next hilles mountaines diuerse time sundry troups souldiers thinking eyther surprize turkes employed seruices campe else keepe meanes possible continuall terror subiection intermission armes sorrowfull expectation turkes didamurath last end mirrour great person long continue within three dayes amurath departed life left behinde worldly fortune good bad notable worthie mirrour great men earth worlde beeing mynions fortune much puffed vppe happie gale continuall fauours abide strike sayles vayle bonnet one onely storme sinister vnhappie fortune howe men must needes suffer shippewracke sea delitious pleasure gulfe owne greatnesse holde impertinent recount vnto discourse last acte ende tragedie report goeth perceiued limitted houre appointed time approach lay vppon little lowe bed pallet caused himselfe somewhat raysed vppe framing speech bassaes chiefe prince court madecomplaints lamentation made amurath death long lamentable complaintes powred foorth grieuances exclaiming vpon destiny deceiued nowe end issue last action dishonourable infamous whereas forepassed course yeares beene glorious heauens ordaine often repressed proude haughtie hungarian tamed insolencie stately grecian brought name manner nothing nowe constrayned yeeld vppe soule dishonour reproch vnder poore walles little castle viewe contemptible enemie turning himselfe sonne recommended verie earnestly faith fidelitie seruantes instructed admonished touching manie particularity sometimes part sometimes hearing companie albeit bodie euen destitute force strength teares abundance trickling downe cheekes see childe standing euen stoppe vppe hinder course speech yet often reiterate repeate like wordes vnto letspeech admonitious amurath sonne mahomet vpon death bed example quoth hee warning vnto thee sonne neuer contemne despise anie enemie neuer weake feeble hath beene knowe one thing whereof haue much repented life time yea euen worlde leastwise anie part v remayning hath vnderstanding bodie extinguished shall still euerlastingly repent negligent inconsiderate father nourisher domesticall enemie whereby haue purchased calamitie selfe perpetuall blot vnto name empire ottoman giuing vnto whole worlde age time come fit matter talke make iesting stocke ignominious death shamefull ende walles croie euen shoulde fugitiue haue beene suppressed trayterous part plaied hungarie intruded selfe crowne realme epyre first beginning hee yet newly established heartes people yet affected vnto wretch selfe memorie name might haue beene euer extinguished without losse manner anie men fondly foolishly done sende eyther haly bassa gaue first matter encrease audacious fiercenesse beginning good fortune anie chiefetaines whose destruction imprisonment hath nowe grounded supported force hath assured selfe faith fidelitie subiectes wrought selfe credite good opinion people vassalles thing hauing oftentimes thought vppon could hardly haue beleeued euer haue seene great shame ignominie haue befallen empyre could haue beene torne dismembred warre epyre experience schoolemistresse hath nowe taught made feele wonderfull great losse disaduantage eight score thousande fighting men followed epyre accompanie v place doe nowe conferre vppon remainder armie doe take diligent viewe muster left shall finde greatly abated diminished first number fieldes sufficient entertaine regiment nowe howe manie tentes voide emptie howe manie horse doe wander vppe downe without olde maisters howe much empayred lessened force shall returne home andrinople bodie mine see destiny haue vowed territorie epyre wherefore doe impute trauerses crosse accidentes fortune owne ouersight follie seeing first seedes originall misfortune hath beene deriued soyle countrie epyre euen watch set purpose worke v mischiefe seeing hungarie confusion tumultes rebellion incite stirre vp v armes eugenius christian whereby onely soueraigntie royaltie kingdome epyre euen entire possession empire crowne ottoman brought question came tryed battell whole worlde may euidently see trauels labour sustained famous iournyes varna basilia meanes trouble whilest neither time force sufficient wade many weightie affaire power enemie see grew encreased enlarged nowe henceforth stratagemes mainetaine warres expect counsell aduise haue beene greatly mistaken haue made wrong account thing concerned owne good estate owne affayres neuer fortune deceiptfull false vnto anie counsel attemptes warre may thou mahomet sonne shalt finde fauour handes enemie manie honour dignity god hath giuen mee peraduenture hath reserued tryumphe epyre thee thou therefore sonne shalt receiue scepter markes empire principally aboue leaue vnto thee enemie charging thee thou doe leaue death vnreuenged thou haue thing onely continually thy eye thy minde acknowledgement large honourable patrimonie thou art receiue enioy sacrifice neither aged trembling handes grieued departing soule doe require demaund thee discourse ended speech beganne faile drawing neereamurath death towardes ende lay halfe day agonie extasie eye couered endlesse eternall darkenesse hee yeelded vppe soule wonderfull ioy contentment manie million christian hearing thing matter small import worlde selfe superioritie conquest empire estate christian entire dominion whole earth thought changed farre doe last speech differ course forepassed life heard powre forth vile base complaint lament shamefully euen view enemie time past made small reckoning little estimate become haughtie thought vndaunted spirit arrogant imperiousamurath example vanitie inconstancie worldly blisse fortune voice many braue chieftaines leader many troupe legion many thousand armed souldiers wont heare feare trembling oh case altered man another manner visage another kind countenance another aspect head adorned many trophees goodly tryumphes royall princely hande swayed many scepter puissance power strength maiestie commaunded ouer many kingdomes nation people beholde lyeth full low vppon ground deformed filthy stincking carkasse hand closed eye shut feete stretched earst gloriously trample tread vppon earth triumph vppon landes vanquished subdued many infinite rich vnmeasurable wealth huge treasure many honour vaine glorious praise enioyed life time fraile bodie retaineth nothing hath left behind imbecilitie weake condition man nature vaine glorie mortall creature blinded peruerted thoughtes foolish men doe glorifie selues wee puffed vppe exalted doe wee set affection rich authoritie pompous vanity life howe admirable chaunge humaine thing howe fleeting glorie ostentation mortall empire howe great daliance fortune deluding deceiuing foolishe men vanity bodie embalmed pretious oyntmentes sweete odour wasprusa bursa place amurath sepulcher siege croy raised pompously honourably kept preserued afterwardes interred bursa aunciently named prusa bithinia sepulcher auncestors mahomet immediatly saluted lord soueraigne aduised greatest chiefest person death father carefully concealed intent report thereof might come hearing enemie afterwards farre night trussing vp baggage thing prouided arcadines discamping departed dawning day report thatamurath age death yeares amurath deceased middest autumne fiue monethes siege laide croy touching age diuersitie opinion yet generally agreed gainesaied none fully attained fourescore fiue yeares nothing certaine mahomet highly aggrieued displeased leaue siege abandon warre brought great dishonor necessitie enforced thereunto made hasten returne andrinople take inuestiture crowne empire according ancient custome king also represse soundoratio scanderbeg subiects perswading proceed conquest vpon turkes intent meaning thought proue affected began thus speake vnto worthie peeres braue epirotes haue sufficiently filled gorged victorie amurath haue spent whole yeare partly recreation partly repairing townes building newe place haue much visited enemie nowe high time awake giue newe proofe wonted valour euen whilest mahomet hath hand full persian god hath giuen meanes oportunitie without anie effusion bloud reestablish auncient honour reputation albanie reuiue ancient time greatly desired whilest enemie power nowe ill successe last yeares siege terrifie assure would loth leade thinke mischiefe great perill euident great number victory death amurath present occupation aduersarie hath greatly diminished vehement earnest labour notwithstanding valiant man couragious souldier hath scarce anie feeling perseueraunce euen painefully occupied action much lesse afrayed doubt commeth proue difficulty yet haue desire either honour recompence haue reason good companion ashamed spend one yeare raigne amongest idlely nothing yet see suffer house auncesters townes confederate noble markes estate empire alphonsus many deuout catholique prince aided succoured v treasure supply intent keepe v stil idle within dores dwel pleasure delight grow corrupted effeminate rather betake selues armes make proofe sudden vniuersall crie consent wont kinde muttering noise interrupted time stoppes signifie sufficiently mindes souldiers conformable rather different desire notwithstanding though fewe none commend good skilful sailers vse make voyage neither delay thing diminish abate courage adde stomach enemy touching warre persian may speake thinke part repose little trust therein time either wil report skirmish commotion vanish away smoke come nothing else like persian deferre put armes till time better oportunitie notwithstanding valiaunt prince mirrour magnanimitie hinder thy determination thou doest thinke thine owne opinion conceipt point benefite aduantage estate publike common reputation march good cheerefully follow thy ensignes wheresoeuer shall please thee leade v frame fit tongue acceptable pleasing vnto v trauels difficulty hazardes kinde danger shall grieue discontent v long thou art leader commaunder long may enioy happie presence thy vertues may follow greatnesse thy fortune scanderbeg perceiuing subiects affected rather spake nothing true certaine suffered himselfe soone easily perswaded according curtesie bountie good nature wherewith euer draw affection albanois stood stay without mouing eitheir forward backward admiring extreme hardines chieftaine contrary enemy striken exceeding feare began thereupon conceiue certaine generall resolution fly away leaue fighting notwithstanding thinking christian reason darknesse night would stirre farther enterprize thing deferre maine fight till break day stirred held good stood firme rather besides shame ignominie iudged flight vncertaintie darke would farre perilous full hazard likewise albanois little perplexed thought diuerse imagination minde doubt whether attend daylight else presse forward good fortune men warre light inconstant herein found selfe deceiued hope thought haue surprized vnwares found order late ouertaken amezans yet seeing ouerthrown beaten backe first troupe hope would abide gone pursuing backes might obtaine victorie without losse bloodshed owne men therefore perceiued set good countenance matter yet neuerthelesse mammering readie turne back without delay sounded charge gaue onset vpon furiously behind saying vnto souldiersspeech scanderbeg encouraging souldiers giue charge vpon debreas come friend let v vse victorie whilest fellowes thus amazed whilest wound yet fresh bleeding let v preuent enemie flight deuising debating take aduantage get away free safe sight debreas troups endured shocke first verie coldly made repaire fore ranckes animated exhorted behaue selues manfully stand firme good word example owne vertue valour insomuch began receiue christian encounter good resolution made hold bridle stopped pace whilest thus combatting together ech army doubt confounded entangled one within another fight yet verie mortall till time one musaches sent part horseman left wing charge enemie vpon side first rankes beganne breake disordered scanderbeg pressing continually vpon forefront beate vp downe presse hauing vehement desire encounter generall turkes enioyned ofpolicie scanderbeg battell ayme destruction generall enemy saying scanderbeg generall death destruction wont commonly say head first cut rest bodie would tumble alone knew kind creature whole world could suruiue head thereof taken away braue sudden charge giuen musache somewhat hinder purpose scanderbeg debreas leauing head battell kept suddenly make towardes side repulsing enemie redressing rankes againe good order musache disordered might cause temporize yet beare violence enemy till time grew day souldiers vauntgard sooner perceiued generall absent beganne presently waxe faint flacke fighting suffering themselues little violence beaten backe euen middest battallions moses intent might winne honour glorious action brake verie furiously amongst thickest thema hardie act moses snatching ensigne handes one barbarian throwe copanions followed accident made redouble fiercenesse enemie kinde iealouzie incense set spurres courage came trouping thither side men brauely despised daunger feare death beganne slaughter chiefest feare amongst infidel might haue seene many moses might haue seene turkes heapes company forsooke lost standardes question contention keepe fielde euerie man thought best shift himselfe running away misfortune followed debreas made forgetfull good discipline martiall order depriued good counsell without delay man distracted furie feare came poasting thitherwards carefully busied rallying squadron seeking renue battell scanderbeg euer caried eye towardes came vpon launce rest charged point thereof ran cleane litle aboue brest euendebreas slaine scanderbeg vnder chinne endeuoring auoide blowe bending aside head receiued staffe wholly bodie made end life battell fallen horse people couered body long thought liuing still looking remount againe horsebacke perceiuing bodie lie dead without soule man left could vpbraid flying away turned bridle immediately abandoned speedily standardes cariages theirvictorie scanderbeg armie debreas companion enemy held accursed flying hindermost souldiours serued vnder amese last iorney modrissa hauing still mind aduenture fought verie warily carefull liues foremost fortunate flight made certaine reason daylight cruell caused greater bloodshed slaughter musache one side moses pursuing pressing close vpon heeles kill cut chase slaine field fight also taken aliue much large ample doubt victorie bene least respect wounded christian bene seconded archer harguebuzziers launce target courtlaxes weapon vse vpon enemie length gotten good way within turkish confines chase seemed dangerous followed whichsentence fled scanderbeg left pursuing gathered together troupe maruellously glad ioyfull retired prisoner without lossenumber turkes staine battell pologue victory bought giuen christian dammage hauing one men either slaine wounded thus see strange successe battell fortune disposeth purpose men doth sometimes fauour beyond reason consideration turkes lost men therefore christian might well say might vsually victorie bought giuen bootie order prince brought forth common open sight equally deuided amongest souldiers intent continued furie fight following chase vpon enemiedebreas horse armour giuen moses scanderbeg honour valure vertue without care sacking campe spoiling dead might sustaine losse disaduantage moses gaue owne hand horse armour debreas honourable testimonie likewise great desertes commendation rest euerie one share fared better iorney prisoner giuen vnto amongst others musache fortune haue yong turke prisoner whose physiognomy good countenance shewed nobilitie courage betweene master prisoner arose forthwith pleasant controuersie gaue occasion laughter stander impart vnto young man hauing speech musache concerning ransome demaunded summe would content end agreed vpon crownesa pleasaunt question betweene musache turke prisoner turke presently taking litle bagge payed told vnto afterwardes desiring leaue depart epirot began smile telling must seeke elsewhere money make vp ransome reason thinke pay owne money coine else soeuer taken right belong vnto one case condition bodie prisoner taken war could reserue chalenge thing owne turke sometimes reason sometimes entreatie desired let goe make short matter brought scanderbeg purposely commanded one alledge could defence right afterwards turning people vsed wordes truely said pretie controuersie plead whichspeech scanderbeg deciding controuersie betweene musache turke prisoner mine money musache knew bestow vpon thee sir youth ought abuse v wile doe well know euen life wherewith thou breathest borrowed dependeth mercie farre thou canst pretend right reserued thy selfe anie thing notwithstanding reason iudge mine owne cause iudge rightly matter libertie set aside rigour rightes warre fauor prisoner thee therefore musache giue owne free motion prisoner hath thou franckly freely giue libertie rather dutie nature condition euer hereafter fall againe thy hand thou shalt dispose fully freely thine owne pleasure discretion thus young turke verie glad exceeding ioyfull gotten libertie hauing also horse armes franckly giuen scanderbeg departed highly commending without ceasing bountie liberalitie praying vnto god hartily prosper king estate albanie christian trussing vp baggage towardes euening retire thence dibria time aboad commonly seene enterprise succeedeth happily vnto men lifteth vp mind affectsentence greater matter albanois beganne make motion generall councell touching proceeding warres assaulting winning townes enemie end concluded best expedient stay see turkish monarch would discomfiture force least happen incontinently vndertake action either much hastinesse temeritie dangerous would easily effected two monethes therefore limitted discouering matter espial dispersed throughout partes notwithstanding want fugitiues andrinople place came daily yeelde themselues albanois thing thus passed moses retyred himselfe garrison vpon frontier scanderbeg amese rest prince noble tooke iourney towards croy caused batterie continue still great furie two dayes spent sort ditch nowe filled vp ruines wall withdrewe ordinaunce side towne made least defensible nowe time vse furie souldiours appointed next day giue assault make triall valour commaunding ready breake next morning done accordingly ensignes readie displayed souldiours great cry clamour began march good order resolution certainebelgradians demand truce towne came foorth suddenly met conducted presence prince required haue truce soone easily graunted afterwardes demaunding composition yeeld selues quoth scanderbeg due men doe yeeld wit liues saued free libertie depart armour bagge baggage rest belong victours two messenger returned aunswer openly reported defendant generally sadde sorrowfull hard condition imposed vpon thing yet sound good estate whereas case bene desperate towne forced vttermost euen manner vanquished might easily obtaine agreement garrison pensiue sore grieued feare despite made haue manie motion conceipts mind christian sayd neuer word notwithstanding article propounded composition sawe depriued good house true good hope place came handes christian obtaine king albanie soeuer would demaund therefore made shewe howe affected either one side thought condition feare lest renewe reuiue suspition bene conceiued demaunded gouernour opinion refused shew mindes giuing himgouernour belgrade consulteth citizen vpo condition offred scanderbeg answer citizen belgrade gouernour onely answer expect interrogatory commaundements whatsoeuer iudge honour profit generall would maintaine ratifie armed disarmed great part day spent consultation last concluded demaund truce abstinence armes one whole moneth time came succour would submit selues condition offer propounded hope mahomet would endure shame infamie would either person else would send succour speed comming tanusee aduertized preparation made thus pollicie deuice hope preserue libertie towne without bloudshed losse christian deny condescend agreement man resolute prepare selfe good courage defence walles vse vttermost obstinacie obstinate enemy messenger sent backe capitulation campe christian scanderbeg made accompt demaundes reputed worthie laughed willing either better aduised speede else prepare selues extremitie generall assault end sawe fully firmely determined would abate much fiue dayes delaye respite demaunded grewe greater choller night comming vppon put conclusion thereof instant scanderbeg calling counsell consult deliberate vpon matter chiefe lordes eldest captaines opinion thatspeeches noble captaines mountaine whereon citie seated part admit giue anie easie accesse vnto labour clime great stonie rock naturally arising many place round town wrought arte circuite walles seruing fortification towne many place would easily scorne force violence ordinaunce make power vertue regard whereof might occasion siege might long continuaunce alleaged moreouer soeuer fell whether truce either graunted denied defendaunts yet beleeued sultan would faile ayde send succour daunger would much greater feared hee come finde wearied sore laboured whereas came foreslow comming might obtaine towne without bloudshed without losse hazard people case come good time rescue yet might take choise time occasion according offer selfe thing would fall conueniently aduauntage fight would furtherance victory penance light credulitie vaine shall repent losse time past shall constrained meane time depend wholy vpon pleasure faith enemy soeuer many thing alledged touching difficulty siege occupation sultan also sufficiently assured garrison moses hath readinesse vpon frontier matter bene long debated discussed fro notwithstandingtruce sixteene dayes granted belgrade anie thing bene sayd contrarie cleft head almost twaine many blowes past betweene bloud drawen neither partie let sworde fall hand immediately turke verie actiue pressed close horse clasping armes necke forsaking stirruppes horse whole weight bodie hanged vpon shoulder scanderbeg thinking haue forced haue pulled ground together himselfe infidel desirous aide companion gaue presently enuironned epirot prince side labour vaine scanderbeg hauing cut heade bodie hang vppon freed himselfe burthenacmath slaine scanderbeg enemie may sure acte notably encrease courage christian made follow desperately generall beating downe great number barbarian began shrinke committing great mightie slaughter amongest beginning firstfruites victorie minister occasion much sorrow vnto infidel vnto christian great ioy comfort taken good signe happie token returne good fortune strength body daylight also fayling one alike enforced time giue place vnto night sebalias first made shew either feare durst wearinesse could endure fightsebalias armie retireth first battell anie longer whereupon company commaundement captaines made close vp colour retyred themselues mountaine darkenesse night ouertake field prince epyre farre spent labour trauell full griefe sorrowe insupportable like also armie seizing vpon mountaine distant two mile enemie stay till two houres within night time dislodged verie secretly neither selfe hisretrait scanderbeg souldiers hauing refreshing either sleepe victual poore soules neither thing eate neither desire thereunto reason extreame griefe anguish heart tooke care meate drinke bassa night enter towne hauing store victualles brought burgess belgrade lodged armie partly mountaines partly suburbes placing good strong court gard sentinelles side celebrated victorie great ioy triumph perswaded christian would haue stayed rest night next morning fresh fasting men vsed beaten would seeke repaire honour lost would haue aduentured themselues second battell wherefore hauing set thing readinesse good order breake day descended playne sending foorth many company skirmish christian drawe foorth fight although two houres night heard noyse discerne signes might signifie departure yet beleeue remoued onely place might eyther rest securely commodiously dresse ambuscado entrappe armie also cause durst sende foorth force ouerrunne spoile countrie doubting least might thereby disgrace honour victorie thing verie vnusuall turkes haue hand epyrots besides inconstancie fortune ordinarie chaunce warres thing whatsoeuer therefore much discontented either flight christian lost opportunitie fight againe belike induced thereunto exceeding iealouzie aduantage vnaccustomed good fortune befallen desirous loose gotten thesebalias want courage pursuing victory albanois former day iourney seeme testifie lesse first sounded retrait therein bewray either confessed himselfe wearied faint harted hauing worst else vnwilling renue fight great desire meddle enemie make doubt sebalias corage haue forthwith haue charged vppon enemie euen kinde naturall father seeth owne sonne standing behauing selfe insolently damnable desire rule wilde youthfull disposition impatientan elegant comparison yoake hath drawen armes loaden surcharged care griefe euerie moment doth temporize seeke delayes marching forwarde slowly seeketh first though vaine sweete wordes perswasions conuert disswade obstinate generall first lead thee waye goddesspeech ahimaz moses desiring leaue fight combat themselues haue layed open thee attaine vnto present glorie seemeth vnto know vnfit thing nothing agreeable vnto right vse armes come abruptly trye fortune force pitched maine battell beginne fight small light attempt desire souldier soone approued permitted arme himselfe combat withall send trumpet king epyre vnderstand pleasure would consent beginning fight one part make tryall manner valure good fortune trumpet seene approach scanderbeg imagine according wished dybrian would haue drunke water wine combat fewe person exempt two army perill hazard set fielde thus time trumpet one side retyre answere turkish armie side one epirot horseman zacharie groppe followed clamour owne companie came forth couragiously great haste presented himzachary groppe desireth leaue fight combat ahimaz selfe prince desiring giue honour preferment combat scanderbeg receiued courteously good speech highly commended magnified vertue companion helped arme prayed vnto god giue strength valure hardinesse courage onely fortune good happe manessey made choise ordinarie vsuall weapon onely wore vpon armour certaine rich ornament guise souldiers paynim nothing inferiour aduersarie first tooke fielde imagining scant durst anie man come encounter assoone sawe partie haue deale come fielde throughly armed launce vpon thigh marching right towardes addressed selfe vnto cryed aloft soft faire soft faire quoth noble speech betweene ahimaz zacharie groppe combat knight shall haue time enough seeke owne misfortune therewithall entreated might talke together hauing enquired name degree estate epyrot beganne propound certaine condition much vnlike propounded scorned paul manessey like action whereunto zacharie interrupting speech vaine friuolous replyed could wish heart better meanes content desire fortune make victorie glorious saide ech turned withdrewe themselues apart gone farre full course horse might makecombat betweene ahimaz zachary groppe stroakes violent setting spurres horse giuing reynes tooke carreer eche launce rest neither fayled course notwithstanding stroke vaine launce piercing target couered barres steele flie peeces without hurt done vnto body yet holding carreer encountred together body rudely horse men tumbled ground two champion yet whole vnwounded speedily got vp vppon feete leauing horse sword drawen affront ech beganne fierce cruell conflict fortune would sight combat diuersely enriched beautified imparting fauour equally vnto hauing continued long time fight bloud drawen neither side swordes fell handes might long crookednesse heauinesse cimitaries fittest horseman lesse easie fight foot peraduenture reason wearinesse lacke aduisement ouermuch heat hastinesse fighting hauing lost sword cast away target also two strong mightie wrastlers vnarmed bare handes fastened eche others bodie best worst wrastling ouerthrowe ech two hoastes stood behelde equall like measure hope feare thus long time wrastled tugged together resting themselues nowe among neither able moue force throw ech ground came length last proofe force strength lifting vp one earth tumbled fell together turke vnderneath belly vpwardes epirot full vpon quickly nimbly setting hande dagger stabbed throate ahimaz little little beganne waxe faint handes leauing holde vanquisher hauing freed himselfe great ioy triumph infinite acclamationsvictorie zachary gr ppe ahemaz staine albanian got vp vpon feete laying hold vpon sworde lay neere cut head enemie yet gasping drawing breath thus loaden spoyles went way faire easily towardes fellowes comming meete must vnderstand horse beginning combat gotten fled campe christian common sort interpreted good token victory good fortune zacharie lesse recompence reward giuen scanderbeg manessey like desert praise commendation giuen whole army farre exceeded difficulty variety combat seeme amplifie merit champion adorne beautifie honour victorie good happe hauing giuen vnto christian assurance entry entier fauour fortune hauing put moses maruellous anguish griefe heart notwithstanding troupe terrified ill successe companion disswade meanes possible yet giuing spurres hismoses challengeth scanderbeg combat horse galopping ouer field yet smoaking bloud turk went apart towards scanderbeg high voice challenged combat suddennesse strangenesse act astonish amaze epyrots kind horror detest noueltie rarenesse wicked insolent action insomuch stood still men stricken mute dumbe accident yet loue pietie quite banished exiled heart king albany standing time doubt mammering himselfe loth defile hand bloud old friend familiar perseuering importunate defiance withall vpbraiding iniurious despightfull manner made forget right equitie insomuch filled wrath anger though noble enforce themselues haue retayned would haue taken vpon reuenge yet would perswaded made towards dibrian staied moses soone hemoses flieth presence scanderbeg comming combat saw comming suddenly turning gallopped towards companie ashamed durst abide speake word vnto causing whole army presently set forward made ready battell prince albany meane time returned force nothing discontented adieu betweene especially turkes partes glad knowing well great manifest inequality betweene two party compare brauerie challenge made defiant shamefulnesse flight would thinke either moses ashamed promise made sultan willing acquitted ill debt terrified present daunger made turne backe else foolish rash presumption thinking scanderbeg would haue stirred place meete himselfe confessed lesse afterwardes time returned albany part rather minde god euen great god hath established king earth theirsentence throne hath imprinted countenance certaine character diuinitie maketh venerable terrible aboue men moses neuer seene king choller displeasure could beare endure maiestie angrie visage herein verified olde common prouerbe namely eye seeth neuer saw heart thinketha prouerbe neuer thought immediatly vpon retrait albanois beganne make forwardes sending forth part cry clamor vsually heard army victorious scanderbeg albeit strength resolution force number horse foote many good signes auguriesnumber scanderbeg force moses manifestly foreshew certaine assured victorie yet omit thing notwithstanding might serue obtayning either perfect exquisite arte cunning setting ordering battels encouraging souldiers returned vaine defie giuen moses vsed speech vnto haue great reason good souldiers assure selues day oration scanderbeg souldiers encouraging battell moses victorie ouer enemy god hath sent manifest presage assistaunce two champion whome one losse head shamefull flight hath giuen assured pledge good happie successe part could haue bene content haue employed strength furie armes else insolencie infidelitie rebell would haue permitted mee seing one transported reason honestie doth seeme contemne despise friendshippe kindnesse hath beene shewed doth confound rightes diuine humaine charitie resteth extended vnto fight valiantly countrie wiues child prince borne dedicated onely libertie tranquilitie wretch miserable fugitiue seeketh depriue endeuouring bring bondage thrauldome haue heretofore endured many speech perswasions vse vnto begunne ended great noise crie amongst souldiers went presently enemie made lesse thousande first charge encounter enemie like number ordaine backes place also bestowed especiall choise manie stoutest resolute souldiers stay former either affraied happen flie enemy also aide harde misfortune befall prouide himselfe suertie securitie dybrian enuironned part epyrots hee purposely assured flanked selfe language manner nation familiar vnto might commodiously counselled also ayde bene confiscated andmoses restored former liuings office dignitie deuided amongest particular person restored vnto together land office whereat people tooke great pleasure contentment thus milde nation vertue deceiue shall yet haue greater cause euer enuy winter season begunne fieldes naked bare gra e fruites put scanderbeg hope time freede preparation trouble enemy good apparaunt occasion induce mind beleeue amese would attend stay spring yeare setting abroach new plot enterprise cause retired traine croy taking anie care leauying force preparation warre spent consumed winter oftentimes visiting garrison dibrians preparing selfe espial ordinary gardes readinesse trauels daungers shortly ensue sight amese much moue turkish monarch afterwardes speech hee vsed vnto valour sufficiency personage caused haue admiration hee hadde heard himdescription amese person quality speake knew prudence wisedome grauity discourse sounde reason touching stature small vnsightlie first appearaunce could yeelde shew secret rare perfection minde recompence defect person hee hadde heart extreame haughtie quicke sharpe conceipt delicate subtile spirite none could men impatient could least away ease idlenesse men couetous desirous empire principall chiefest partes gette honour good grace euery man liberalitie courtesie whit inferiour vertues euer got either purchase owne vertue valour fortune warres beneficence bountie vncle wholly depart distribute amongest souldiours friendes officious seruiceable men familiar easie acquainted occasion require could dissemble singularly excellent good skill cunning quality gained great authority good liking heartes men next scanderbeg doe know one man beloued reuerenced people souldiours much haue affirmed wanted diuerse priuate inward friendes vncle often admonish take good care regard minde stirring suspitious would perswaded credite conceipt make litle account thereof notwithstanding processe time flight rebellion came knowen manifested sooner drawen beleeue report thereof moses began call minde naturall disposition man beene better obserued marked others himselfe purpose amese admitted presence mahomet fill eares idle insolent promise vaunt moses done colouring cause reuolt repaire sultan one onely reason intent speech might accounted either vaine inconstant fained dissembled began manner speake vnto thrice happie inuincible monarch lawfull v recall memorieoration amese mahomet errours iniuries haue time past committed thy maiesty might well rightly sayed come receiue worthy deserued punishment offence rather hope expectation honour dignity wherein could wee haue trespassed offended grieuouslie empire ottoman action heretofore executed warre hungarie time equall lesse infidelity betraied thy army battell morana tooke epire deceipt fraud thy hand true originall fountaine many mischiefes calamity enterprise practises doe confesse partner consort behoueth presence maiesty stand vppon defence iustification doings onely plead contrition repentaunce hold vaine thing stand feare doubt prudent gracious prince considering age time youth inclining owne misfortune minde badly staied deliberation counsel perhaps deceiue beguile lead beleeue vncle suffer selfe simply perswaded many thing entised desire rule gouernment disease properly incident age much credulity forsaking thy seruice followed hope faire promise vnderstanding encreased year soone began discerne secrete disloialty vncle reuolt ottoman obeisance pernicious labour aide hath scanderbeg recouered amplified estate long stay attend see would offer part portion possession mine owne inheritaunce descending vnto auncesters yet right father looke hee haue yeelded recompence reward many trauelles peril endured within got himselfe wife begat new heire new successour crowne concerning litle shame world driue doe perceiuing could honesty suffer mee still remaine continue within court priuate person assigned litle corner epire vilest worst place countrey whilest vsurped rest vnto selfe haue spent consumed dayes obscurity base account much doe moderate selfe heart able digest ignominie neuerthelesse qualitie time naturall pride arrogancie man enforce conceale dissemble thing feare least vnder pretence colour suspition might sodainely circumuent surprize late george streeze sister sonne suborned accusation supposed crime hee despoyled well neare liuings dominion willingly would worthie ottoman haue hadde recourse vnto thy maiesty would gladly haue forsaken abandonned ingrate vncle infamy empire remembraunce former rebellion many outrage done crowne dignity ottoman terrifie detaine vntill present time wherein diuine permission following assuraunce thy faith promise come vnto thee glad ioyous thou haddest sooner giuen signe token thou haddest sooner called inuited speedily diligence conformed thy came running vnto thee mind long time bene affectioned defer put comming neither stay till misfortune might befall scanderbeg thy good fortune increased moses lately thou hast cause thinke coniecture either feare doubt iminent daunger make haue regard rather owne good fulfilling thy commandements trueth noble mahomet haue left matter suspition either thee distrust fidelity countrey epire whereby desire returne thither hereafter behold assured bond aduised settled determination perpetuall gage faith fidelity euen wife child behold mahomet good nature hath graunted vnto whatsoeuer wherein take pleasure delight life euen deare precious eies mortall men thou hast presented vnto thee haue brought vnto thee precious iewels hand enemy labour free euen pledge may make faith howsoeuer doubtfull suspicious firmely tied bound assured loialty thing saue haue left behinde hasty secrete flight could possibly make prouision cariage necessary albeit might leasure security haue trussed vppe brought baggage honour hadde bene bring vnto presence puissaunt rich monarch ordure dreg former estate fortune greatest thing present vnto thee faith loialty truth vttermost ability afford thou require certaine assurance submit selfe wholly order whatsoeuer maiesty shall ordaine come hither giue prescribe lawes take lawes commaunded promise fifteene thousand men ouerthrow thy aduersary tame pride albanois misfortune haly bassa many braue valiaunt chiefetaines fresh rare though bloudy victory sebalias may serue example teach learne promise thing beyond power ability protest vnto thee puissant ottoman thou shalt want mee readinesse willingnesse best seruice fidelity matter either concerning euent affaire reuenge thy iniuries outrage thou hast reason lord maister slaue expert approued warriour vnskilfull simple souldiour expect looke counsell thinke giue aduise direction quicke dispatch souldiers well husbandman imploied businesse conueyed corne partly sheaffe partly threshed townes castelles haue safe sure handes enemie meanes well sufficiently prouided men victualles many monethes scanderbeg hauing left moses commaund ouer residue armie went croie stayed three dayes taking order diuerse matter vrgent affaire especially remoouing queene houshold petralba thence returning dibrya beganne goe hand businesse watchfull eye diligent care prepared himselfe receiuing nephew determined entertaine vse mortall andisaac amese turkish army enter albanie meere enemie time hoast infidel cut ouer greatest part macedonie nowe entred vppon confines albanie hauing sent foorth vant urrours warily discouer countrey farre wide handes intent might fall vsuall accustomed ambushments scanderbeg report onely consideration amese would neuer suffer marche night affirming vncle would neuer foolish encounter stay mightie puissant enemy either day time open champion countrey would assay rather fauour benefite darke night put practise accustomed stratagemes suttle traynes vsuall familiar martiall exploites scanderbeg side although long hand prouided thing readinesse retrait neede require yet would meanes dislodge till true perfect intelligence turkes come neare might manner perceiue dust theirscanderbeg retireth turkes horse trussing vp baggage speedily discamped forsooke place sorte followed came behinde might well discerne hee marched turke would follow put himselfe pursuit reason difficultie roughnesse way feare ambush onely sent certaine horse giuing charge trouble molest much could possibly learne course way hee helde whither hee went wherefore armie infidelles entred vpper dybria way alchria marche still fayre easie pace continually discouering searching farre wide side coast founde cleare safe enemy turkishe companie exceeding great ioye disperse themselues abroad ouer countrey kinde manner victorie easily gotten pleasing gratious vnto souldiours waxing insolent security lesse grieue afterwardes could finde meete pillage fieldes light vppon fit matter satisfie couetous mind inordinate appetite thus held march till houre noone would stay returne vauntcurrours also would rest refresh selues long iourneis extreame heate weather beganne make stand went lodge selues neare oronichea dibria neare adioyning place men enemy souldiours take great delight curiously suruey place men late encamped walked vp downe side yet without suspition daunger much neither durst disarme selues yet leaue watch ward part kept continually neare standard guidons horsebacke thus two houres least patientlie abide keeping good watch ward till time hadde bene sent abroade discouerie returned againe bring report seene learned time couetous finger itching faire shew goodly thing forbidden finde fit matter whereupon seize lay hold departure armie bassa hauing made prayer god would vouchsafe graunt grace able tame insolencie albanois obtaine honour trophees victory befallen scanderbeg manie yeares together called amese vnto ordering andamese proclaimed king epyre isaac bassa turkish army disposing regiment openly graced manie goodly prayses commendation caused voice souldiers proclaimed king epyre long superfluous inuectiue detesting disgracing scanderbeg worthy deedes notable exploites amese refused good fortune thence forward shewed himselfe prompt cherfull dispatching affaire singular diligence currying fauour good people deedes word thing thus done hoast barbarian hauing sent forth vantcurrours discouer beate ouer plaine countrie beginne march forwarde part baggage put vaward part following rereward armie way tooke conduct direction amese part epyre lyeth eastward croy distant thence mile least furnished force seeme easily exposed prey pillage besides intention also troupe approch neerer vnto walles occasion serue might vnder one make themselues lordes towne neuerthelesse reason continuall vehement heate went farre day neither finde vppon fieldes least recompence paine trauell wilde wast countrie appeare partes beene meere solitarie desart made mahometan redouble feare suspition besides ambition man mightily trouble torment least christian eyther absence continuall delayes refusing fight constraine returne vnto constantinople without purchase increase honour reputation kinde bootie found ordinarily esteemed part victorie neither ready meanes without artillerie get honour besieging townes wasting spoiling corne frutes tree burning fireing townes like calamity ordinarie appendants warres commonly oftentimes reserued last extreame rigour deede doe seeme rather testifie declare certaine rage furie benefit commoditie reuenge besides hope also come fight scanderbeg bring prouince vnder subiection durst present himselfe combat may especiall cause consideration detained withheld act hostilitie heate sunne growing litle litle abated reason declyning towards west sweete pleasant shade yeelded great refreshing body souldiers sore wearied well neere spent extreamitie heate harde trauell long iournyes intent therefore might take benefite sweete refreshing doubled way began ride hauing nowe gotten farre sight enemie went vnto partes countrie laye vppon frontier albanie manie diuerse passage prouince enemie might easily surprised abide day attending setting sunne leauing
