valley verie neere vnto watch last spake determining depart remoue thence deliberated taken counsell proceeding might take direction signe token made vnto streamer scant fayre day breake bassa drewe troupe foorth campe hauing purpose determination preuenting heate day enter plaines emathia vnderstood remayning bootie would abandoned prey souldiers pawsing therefore vponisaac bassa turkish armie plain field pharsalia matter beganne march forward verie early whilest leaues grasse fieldes yet moyst dewe morning troade foot greedie prey pillage vpon fieldes euen yet famous bloud slaughter auncient romaine intent case accident maruellous shortly ensuing might without presage many doe affirme generall standardbearer hauingsignes token prognosticating great slaughter future battell betwene turkes christian stumbled ruines old wall many quarter doe bound landes possession priuate person horse man standard also fell rudely ground companion constrayned take vp halfe dead helpe againe horsebacke notwithstanding made account matter onely tooke warning residue looke better feete eschewe place may also ought make little account reckoning signes token rather followe vanitie fonde coniectures accident seeing libertie man free leading guyding action good doctrine instruction christian religion doe seeme argue teach v contrarie yet one thing wherein knowe howe gainesay dissent others haue affirmed vulture rauens like fowles vse frequent hunt carrion dead carkasses flie aboundance place foreshewing great effusion bloud likely shortly ensue verie heauens seemed manner darkened huge number besides verie straunge wonderfull signe almost forgotten see reason shoulde neglected regarded ende spring selfe yeare reported sawe heauens raine downe bloud vppon earth signes proceeded acte anie man earthly creature neither power man counsell prudence foresee preuent effect accident manie influence descende downe heauens certainediscourse author vpon celestiall signes prognostication future accident secret vnknowen cause thinges often seene sundry good euill chaunces manifested vnto v operation starres celestiall body whilest doe disdaine obserue wee doe referre meere accident casualtie doe vse eyther seruice ministerie owne prudence industrie owne counselles purchase vnto v fauour blessing diuine bountie turne away anger threatnings heauens reason haue thinke extraordinarie flight manie birdes fowles ayre shewers bloud fell heauens denote foreshewe ruine destruction infidel rather owne friendes christian perhappes sage aduise counsaile temporizing christian chiefetaine dexteritie good inuention starres forced notable victorie manner purchased thesentence heauens saying wise man hath dominion ouer starres celestiall body part doe assuredly beleeue hunger thosesapiens dominabitur astris vulture might well haue bene deluded earth might sufficiently haue beene satisfied bloud onely fell heauens obstinate wilfull prudence men drawen downe vppon selues violent influence destiny truth whereof appeareth ourselues haue anie vertue puissance wee challenge vnto selues right interrest earthly action presage must necessitie followed ineuitable effectes profit auaile commaund admonish men take armes haue recourse iust defence warres resistance vaine bootlesse end surcharge mankinde denunciation long griefes lamentation make eye beholder feeler mischiefe shall neuer befall come vpon assuredly much cheerefully comfortably leaue world depart life hope entertaine feede heart euen last gaspe would make death last end pleasing lesse terrible vnto v howbeit common prouerbe vsuall mouthes men mischieues foreseene least harme offence may besentence graunt true kind mischiefes wont dispose prepare mind man discorage dismay thought cogitation deadly pernitious ministreth vnto men equall abundance teares like rage passion time life death whilest busie selfe know play part philosopher feare doe digresse office dutie historiographer returne therefore discourse discontinued entrie paynim within plaine countrie pharsalia quickely manifested made knowen inhabitantes sound artillerie fortress next adioyning giuing thereby aduertisement people issued beastes feede fieldes vpon signall token giuen may imagine none made haste speedily auoide great imminent daunger supposed dispersed scattered farthest make great haste free themselues enemie left part beastes prey bootie vnto well able vppon extreamitie wherein vse conuenient speede saue preserue violence furie instant likewise streamer placed token vpon mountaines giue scanderbeg occasion dislodgescanderbeg coasteth armie turkes force c nertly amongst mountain campe good reason iudgement coniecturing way barbarian tooke calling backe scoutes arraunging company good order dismarched secretly couerts valleyes secret passage mountaines still following bassa farre without apperceiued till time thought gotten neere enough vnto also putting selfe againe ambush force attending till night rested selfe neere vnto certaine hill named inhabitantes tumenistiola first sent foorth stande scoutes andscanderbeg putteth ambuscado neere mountaine tumenistiola set watch ordering thinges good conuenient sort mahometans meane idle spent employed onely morning whole course march day ouerrunning spoyling ransacking plaine countrie growen certaine contempt licentiousnesse litle litle engendred amongst troupe saw bodie resist encounter way scanderbeg discerne full well deliberation pursue small force scattered dispersed plaine large spacious yet minded giue onset vpon sort might way endaunger force fight rather desire audacitie licentiousnesse still encrease grow manner therefore hauing followed night forbare touch sort meddle campe reason difficulty place able great trouble carrie troupe darke thicke huge forrestes wood also aymed certaine draught policie warre long time conceiued thoughtes meanes certaine drummes trumpet clarion whereof shall said hereafter reserue himselfe straunge miraculous kinde combat cause infidel suffered rest quiet spent night diuerse pleasure pastime euen amese also tooke great ioy contentment see himselfe carried attended though somewhat soone honour thorough campe diuers song ioy meriment amongst common souldiers alreadie obtained soueraigntie peaceable possession estate albanie mind wholly freed feare suspition rather desire mortall men draweth commonlysentence kinde credulitie maketh v beleeue thing fall according owne desire expectation leasure quietnesse three dayes continuance wherein without disturbance enemy cause barbarian frame conceiue vnto themselues vaine license owne conceipts imagination beene alreadie possessed victorienegligence securitie turkish army thence proceeded thing enclining negligence watch lesse carefully regarded insomuch placed scoutes court gard onely side feared daunger namely way coast bending towards lissa darkenesse night chased away comming day light turkes prouiding preparing themselues follow road excursion therefore breake day displaying ensignes fell spoyling robbing part countrie remained yet vnspoiled filling kind outrage beastly crueltie hoast theirisaac turk encampe betwene riuer mathia water albulae baggage also remoued certaine plaine lying betweene riuer mathia water inhabitant name albulae placing gardes sentinel towardes lissa doubted imagined greatest daunger foote mountaine tumenista hath aspect west towardes open champion placed certaine horseman assure passage campe excellently well fortified one halfe armie remained still garde defence thereof finde bassa himselfe manie chiefest principall person armie continue abide campe whilest amese skilfull better practised march conduct force went abroad forrage preysuffades countrey randome ranne vp euen suffades tearme seacoast husbandman peysant withdrawen conueyed away fury spoyle couetousnesse barbarian thinke king would haue suffered long vse license libertie haue beene vnmet withall true might time haue done worthie notable exploit whilest force deuided sunder roundly inuaded campe yet come neere neither could coueniently haue bene done force harrying ouerrunning countrie vpon noise alarme might haue beene called home might easily haue enclosed albanois betwene power hunger heate day hauing caused returne campe bootie deuided amongst souldiers howbeit litle small value rather sharpen appetite satisfie content time men also drawen together gotten vp toppes mountaines seized aduantage place whereupon armes nowe readie handes prepare themselues call mahometans account voyage iorney taken seene scanderbeg busied bestirre himselfe mightan ellegant excellent comparison aptly haue compared one expecting house great companie guest make magnificent sumptuous banquet exquisite dainty viandes prepared ordinary dareth trust seruants yet referre care thereof either friend wife see done owne hand ordaining fitting disposing thing carefully doubtfull countenaunce casteth eye vpon dish vppon partes table especially reason meane estate man preparation sparye conuenient number guestes setting thing best shew skilfull diligent hand doth amplifie encrease may least satisfie fill eye hand belly banquetters like manner king epyre coursing galloping vp downe hilles mountaines neare adioyning stayed long one place placeth moses one quarter tanusee another streezes side others side appointing vnto euerie man particular charge office admonisheth instructeth trusting sufficiencie capacitie case consequence importance affaire sometimes goeth sometimes followeth breife maketh handes eye witness done vieweth reuieweth troupe examineth well still deuising casting dispose order thing best intent terrible obiect prouided enemy might astonish confound vsed sleight inuention shew euerie squadron assigned great number trumpettes drummes suchstratageme scanderbeg like instrument warre ordinarily vsed troups expresly prouided purpose ordered armie horse foot according commoditie place quantitie force reserued owne regiment part armie wit horse like number footemen went without delay seized vppon tumenista bassa armie namely wearied long tedioussecuritie negligence turkes incursion harrying preying countrie morning returne laid along rest themselues ouer large plaine hauing left horse feeding without either saddle bridle besides none kept neare ensignes good order laye shadowe made merrie purchased others hauing fed full lay wallowing grasse slept without feare suspition passing away time play sportes sortes vsuall amongest souldiers ioyfully beguile eye sleepe extreame heat summer albeit scarce able hold vp head wearinesse want sleepe worst time yeare day reason extreame heat moneth iuly height sunne past middest heauen made watch court gard also negligent part campe amongst likewise euery man bent take ease spend away time mirth man armes horse readines part hauing cast away feare doubt enemie laied aside also care consideration good order martiall discipline bassa himselfe great men commander armie amese consultation isaac bassa turkish chieftain proceeding scanderbeg councellour busines especially concerned aboue rest consultation within tent maruellous care perplexitie course resolue vpon next remoue thence side find new subiect honour commendation counsell deuided two diuerse opinion one ouerrunne prouince sword fire make ruines spoiles countrie remaine mark victory propouded amese march right towardes croy sound wils inhabitant whether would submit themselues nephue scanderbeg accept gouernment terrifie threat menace case refuse harken vnto see totall ruine destruction albanie perpetuall siege walles end enforced endure yoke miserable shamefull seruitude bondage build vpon slowe succour scanderbeg trust fond counselles perswade attend depend vpon hope expectation long lingring presence latter aduise approued certaine best opinion part followed onely made stay thought yet best remoue campe till time feruentnesse heate wearinesse body somewhat abated refreshed scanderbeg longer temporize hauing satisfied instructed eye toppe tumenista animated disposed hisscanderbeg marcheth fight isaac bassa turkish armie souldiers telling order obserue keepe inuasions terrifie enemy side charge presse vpon first beholding court garde turk lay foote mountaine sleeping soundly keeping slender watch ward himselfe descended great silence side mountaine eight men onely cutting throat leauinga court gard turkes cut piece scanderbeg keepe euerlasting watch one onely excepted swiftnesse horse flight saued like slaughter meanes troups christian court gard dispatched began descend vpon plaine vnknowen enemie escaped went running meane poasting speed towardes fellowes fearefull crie filled hoast barbarian giuing allarme telling scanderbeg gard cut piece force christian comming euen hand hardly would turk haue beleeued newes feare giuen sufficient likelyhood thereof death companion neither feare danger side neither doubt sudden comming enemie amese mind easily perswaded truth alarme therefore hasting speedily readily troupe enforced quickly mount horsebacke encouraged vttermost power many wakened partly noise enemy comming vpon partly companion caused leaue sleeping nowe scanderbeg saw ambushments discouered commaunded infanterie presently follow great speed celeritie possible immediately enemie preparing receiue charged gaue onset vpon furiously huge clamour horrible cry souldiers augmented encreased brimme noise drummesscanderbeg surprizeth turkish campe sudden inuasion trumpet tamborins purposely placed side annoy terrifie enemie conceipt imagination great mightie armie also giue aduertisements band lay close embusked mountaines amese seconded owne regiment horseman certen others bene appointed garde campe first made head christian stoutly sustaine first charge many also came thither foote hauing leisure great hast extremitie saddle make readie horse tumult terrour wonderfull partes campe turkes stood men mightely amazed astonished great extreame feare seized vpon verie sight name scanderbeg bassa stood firme within campe would moue foot till time saw squadron order good array flanckes well defended treble force choisest horseman well armed appointed preparation seemed heauen earth confounded reason new vnexpected alarme strange clamour diuerse sound ambushments discouered euerie side mountaines next vallies resound noise sometimes men sometimes trumpet drummes clarion sometimes maruellous sound infinite harguebusses incredibly augment feare terror heart eye turkes esteeming themselues men lost vtterly vndone thinke power puissance epyre sclauonie confederate bene assembled conspired together destruction therefore began flie hand euer moses troups alone could get downe plaine mountaines yet flight seeme sure safe enough vnto reason wayes passage manner shut vp taken besides euen horse frayed diuerse place either shake headstals breake bridle thus feared scape hand making readie neuerthelesse amese mistrusting stratagemes politique inuentionsamese encourageth turk epirots vncle soone easily comprehend cunning subtiltie therefore cried vnto companie side case affraied false alarmes deuises part onely hope refuge weake small force quietly attend sustaine enemy without misdoubt vaine clamour iangling noise trumpet brasen instrument ecchoes outcry fearefull voice frutelesse idle shewes purposely doubled augmented put feare terror perswasions drew many euery companie yet great doubt mammering vnresolued whether best flie hold good enemie neither one seeme honest presence captaine thing yet good estate neither sufficient strength resist enemy courage dismayed abated sudden astonishment insomuch would haue required long time haue confirmed good resolution haue put full heart courage againe notwithstanding bassa lesse resolute amese caused histhe battell pharsalia betweene isaac bassa scanderbeg ensignes march entred combat notable resolution aduauncing himselfe aide succour amese hope met scanderbeg oppresse moses residue christian following close backes come vpon open plaine helde short proceeding neuerthelesse dibrian caused men make stand holde bridle staying till tanusee piec manuell charge commaund squadron archer harguebussiers aduaunced came forward farre foorth himselfe drawen vnited together battell beganne grow rough furious side horseman partes rush violently vpon enemy footman partes also wrought wonder harguebussiers plaied vpon troupe paynim saw thickest bestowing shot vaine whereupon bassa hardly pressed annoied mortall shot bullettes constrained giue backewardes repulsed driuen retire within trench sawe squadron disordered rancke footman casting bowes away backes leauing harguebusses beganne verie nimbly lightly come handie blowes vse sword still following pressing hard vpon turkes wounding killing next vnto found scattered order great slaughter butcherie throughout company much blood shed fledde also fought seene scanderbeg troupe bestirre themselues partes would haue wondred admired sight spectacle many mischieues mortall misfortune represented themselues side fielde another manner slaughter made parte battell reason force power greatest might easily worke greater effectes besides infidel side surprized suddenly almost found disarmed vnprouided lying sleeping along vpon belly meanes whereof enemy might freely passe ouer body subiect furie violence might make themselues better way swordes also footemen abandon vse arrowes harguebusses hauing onely either sword dartes pike hand sometimes wound fled behind backes sometimes runne horse belly ouerthrowing mounted vpon hardinesse audacitie feare flight turkes side wholly depend vpon resolution christian fugitiue countenance assured made head albanois one voice another dexteritie valure valiant deedes prowes would aduertiseamese encourageth turk battell troups hold good litle endure patience til time first fury violence albanois broken saying afterwards would vndoubtedly deliuer easie vnbloudie victory small number christian nothing hope furie first charge onset past cooled force also courage would soone faint faile come nothing long could prolong conflict hoping handes dispersed ouer champion would rally themselues renue combat expectation succour grew still vaine frustrate many surprised taken vp way rest extreamitie feare aduised betake themselues flight sort number great ofamese company put light scanderbeg turkes presented themselues encounter iust full battell part murthered like many hogges throat cut albanois moses embracing laying hold vpon occasion goodly opportunitie hauing earnest dibrian christian neuer mind care profit commoditie long chase endured whilest meanes power kill followe execution enemie side bound fettered great troupe yeelded themselues throwen downe armes quarrelling together man giuen mery one delighted iesting bacchus quoth hath made enemy bacchus mar god shall make friend secretly reprehended rebuked sent away commaunding goe drinke together hee willed vranocontes make end contention betweene see ech right share booty equally alike albanois marching towards croy met multitude countrey inhabitant others hidden themselues next forrests till end fight besides citizen croy also wonderfulltriumph scanderbeg ouerthrow amese turkes battell pharsalia ioy high cry sound instrumentes went croy man could hardly haue seene goodly triumph pompous shew gloriously triumphantly march towne scanderbeg make sight beautifull notable caused army follow multitude well orderly arraunged battell array passe euen suburb one neuer base meane least one horse gotten enemy loaden infinite spoiles caused march moreouer prisoner bound tied together two two long traine went king greatly augment pompe shew triumph many better acknowledgement confession victory vsed accustomed present victory seemed haue annihilated entinguished memorie loss discomfiture turk sustained vnder haly bassa mustapba yea honour commendation purchased old later actes talked regard mahomet himselfe lesse amased maruelled strangenes victory shamefull confession owne feare within allow honour iourney vnto enemy saw force broken dispersed learned bassa order battel occasion ouerthrow although perhaps many point wherein generall host deserue worthily blamed yet without maner reproofe giuen sort inueighing swallowed vp silence contrary wonted maner grief bitternes sorrow discontentment behooued thinke vpon redeeming prisoner especially saniake whose imprisonment vexed grieued extreamely made greatly ashamed regard degree greatnesse merites hee concluded therefore take ordermahomet maketh meanes ransoming messeit saniacke prisoner deliuerance chiefest especiall person rest made reckoning wherefore money made ready prouided partly friendes kinsemen prisoner partly coffer sultan custome manner onelie thing stayed scanderbeg set downe summe raunsome messenger sent epire might bring safe conduct deale matter scanderbeg request saniacke nominated two faithfull trusty seruants office dismissed go vnto sultan procure order deliuery summe demaunded fifteene thousand crownes saniacke owne person forty thousand others soone agreed vnto graunted accordingly wherewith sultan encombred thought amisse reason truce certaine yeares demanded scanderbeg ottoman empire might breath selfe many mischiefes till time might finde better oportunity bring fierce vnruly enemy vnder yoke subiection second opinion seemed allowable middest many ambushments stirring spirit albanian safety weake small garrison send thither anie strong puissant force amiddest many newe accident commotion trouble warres could done conueniently without thousand discommodities councell profitable albeit smally honourable sort base seruile best allowed greater part assembly mahomet part though counsell litle displease alwaies abhorred make shew base vile humor yet could well compasse matter settle affaire hauing many enemy conspired estate manner rent sunder distracted many great occasion proud haughty courage thinke thing soeuer either shameful infamous dishonor hereupon caused onemahomet seeketh haue truce scanderbeg called cary ransome companion opened whole secret order destiny may bring vppon man yet determined time point alter mindes detract thing former resolution repute al kind amity shamefull ignominious long see many outrage iniuries offred side vnto christian long see many wound much bloud lately newly shed wherewith greece fieldes hungary ouerflowen shall recompence late losse morea peace shall base cowardly truce shame disgrace notable victory late glory hungarian belgrade let mahomet long seeke peace v purchase quietnes sword hauing gotten attained sword likewise seeke maintaine rather excessiue iniuries notorious disloialty certaine naturall disposition hath made v enemy hatred wherwith one v armed hardened perpetual immortall part enemy euen birth natiuity enmity beare hereditary desire much get honor reputatio vpon seeke iust deserued reuenge bloud friend haue shed bondage selfe people albanian fully resolued neuer make end trauels till time haue either restored citizen auncient estate rendred life vnto hatefull could make saniacke desist pursuite putting mind variable succes war withall repeating vnto many accident diuers age time past fit example purpose effect told take great pleasure desirous war might truce expired returne armes could neuer want occasion reuiue war demanded truce ten yeares time force courage albanian might greatly repaired might better able attaine notable reuenge purchase themselues new honor reputation scanderbeg litle litle suffred himselfe perswaded began somwhat relent first obstinacy seeming hearken willingy demand saniacke neuertheles would case yeeld abstinency arm much moneth except sfetigrade belgrade might bemeisset saniacke turkes prisoner ransomed yeelded vnto recompence thus without thing concluded messeit companion returne owne country howbeit truce granted till time onely acquainted turkish monarch condition propounded scanderbeg case peace proceeded many turkes permitted depart company saniacke besides ransomed vnto king epire freely magnanimity owne mind grant liberty suffring without ransome returne country rest also remained deliuered prison becommingscanderbeg sendeth present ambassades christian prince perswading concord take armes turkes christian baptized plant themselues dwel epire residue dipersed abroad present maner king christendome king france spaine besides slaues sent great quantity horse spoiles sort prince sent like present citie rome bin filled renowme victory replenished many trophees ornamets thus scanderbeg determine vttermost power bind vnto curtesie almost whole world together giftes present send solemne ambassades giuen charge exhort prince christian concord amity earnestly pray would length awake long dead sleepe would chase away mist darknes wherewith bin blinded consider aduisedly imminent ruine threatned christian liberty religion would last seeke redeeme miserable wretched yoke seruitude infidel mahometans otherwise well assured plague litle litle grow within bowel would end pierce heart scanderbeg sent also may omit diuers present vnto great friend alphonsus magnificent caried shew beautifull goodly triumph amese nephew sent also together presentes vnto naples kept straight close prison sultan tooke care deliuerance made motion doe assure selfe golde world would haue redeemed condemned perpetuall imprisonment mind last resolution king epire touching treaty peace related vnto mahomet esteemed slightly matter would vouchsafe aunswere haughtines fiercenes minde notwithstanding hard pressed side infinite affaire great importance partes hungary daily diet assembly knew well continually gathered throghout christendome procurement earnest meanes pope holines prouided therefore strong puissant garrison sent epire surety hishamur synam sent two sundry garrison defend turkish frontier albanois countrey according lately told bin decreed priuat secret councell hamur synam charge commission expert polliticke warriours ech horse foote number iudged sufficient weary force epire haue terrified euen stout puissant enemy notwithstanding ech expresly forbidden attempt thing whatsoeuer occasion oportunity offered recommended vnto gaue charge looke defence limit assigned vnto whole sommer spent maner one side middest autumne time troups dislodged constantinople report thereof preuented coming brought eares scanderbeg ignorant practise relied vppon word saniack expect answer sultan whether would either accept reiect summe demaunds cause departing croie speed possible went presently dibria hauing leauied new force renued old company attended aduersary great deuotion staid long came within mile albanois encamped sort enter vpon confines scanderbeg stirred hearing infidel approched presently ordered troups ready fight kept quiet within camp common bruit ran vpon comming force giue great puissant made himhamur synam force encamped neare alchria macedony imagine enemy would come seeke place would sticke assault campe afterwards hauing notice espial skouts placed vpon mountain encamped vnder alchria al cariage disposed place supposed morning next folowing refreshed band would make towardes offer giue battel wherefore darke night great silence secresie filled certaine woddy place vallies neare adioyning armed men thinking haue enclosed middest force haue surprized come forward according expected two day night expect maner could neither haue sight enemy yet heare newes tidings wherefore scanderbeg impatient delay determined day following go visit prouoke forth fight word broght hoast infidel deuided two part hamur abide stil alchria sinam residue army take champion plaine field pologue towards mocrea commo entry lowersynam marcheth half turkish force towardes mocrea lower dibria dibria modrissa alchria hamur make abode adioyning vpper dibria sfetigrade thus notable aduise lay close vpon prouinces dibria intent might hold albanian continual alarum one side betweene two garrison army mile least much modrissa sfetigrade wherefore king epire hauing drawn together ambushments lay dispersed hauing ioyned force one campe determined leauy new supply strengthning bandes intent might conueniently part seuerall quarter prouide preuenting peril either side thing sufficiently prepared troups quickly augmented footman newly leauied possible sodainely readily leauie horsmen deuided speedily though like equall number tanuse one streezes limittes whichtanusee others appointed defence lower dibria sinam prescribed sort aduenture vppon enemy onely defence owne safety rest army scanderbeg retaine himselfe vpper dibria hauing also moses company wherfore hauing thus reserued better part force especially horseman considering passage free open enemie enter side albanie determined could draw forth infidell hazard fortune field aduenture decent conuenient towne burnt destroied leaue holy precious relique lewes lately made king idle meane presently put execution practises newly concluded betweene pope martin queene naples philip duke naples ransomed sforce force fleete duke milan land armes frauncis sforce sonne ssorce cottignole lately deceased much without great violence effusion bloud recouered queene yeare one thousand foure hundred twenty foure queene ione happily restored reinuested estate made entry naples hauing company graund seneschall late eschaunged twelue catalan spanishe noble liberality curtesie sforce afore mentioned might haue hadde foure score thousand crownes raunsome lewes also adopted elected sonne shee created duke calabria title ordinarily giuen eldest sonne king prince naples time returne citie naples nowe albeit altogether free exempted trouble towne sometimes endommaged artillerie castell noue still deuotion spaniard neuerthelesse liued sufficiently well happily realme vntill yeare thousand foure hundred thirtie two time graund seneshall till time happie prosperous fortune commaunded manner absolutely ruled realme ouertaken ensnared queene shall perceiue followeth within solemnized marriage sonne one daughter iames caldore euen sawe selfe man may say sitting aloft vpon wheele fortune one monday midnight lodged within tower capouane certaine person speciall commaundement queene noble confederated went vnto lodging knocking calling chamber doore willing arise speedily make hast come queene saying reason sudden accident befallengrand seneshall naples slaine great daunger perill death seneshall rising suddenly make selfe readie commaunded page open doore thereupon without armed entred chamber slue hand hauing almost cut one legges caused caried naked capouane without anie pompe vile wretched creature liuing mostsentence immoderate loue fauor womakind vain man build fortune lewes third duke aniow calabria death miserable vnhappie example inconstancie fortune may serue notable instruction admonition person relying vpon fickle loue immoderate affection woman kind found greatnesse fortune vpon vaine vnconstant fauours lewes sent commission queene iohn anthonie vrsin prince tarentum taking part alphonsus trouble molest calabria came cossence fell sicke feauer dyed yeare lord thousand foure hundred thirtie fower great griefe sorow whole kingdome prince singular curtesie benignitie especiall hope good cariage behauiour queene liuedione queene naples death long hauing raigned twentie yeares departed life hauing ordained last testament rene duke barre brother sayd lewes heire albeit doubt last say itrene duke barre ordained heire queene ione falsified counterfaited death thus house familie dura bene notable famous manie descent came nowe haue end likewise fatall humane earthly thing duke rene called sent principall person chiefe noble realme could go take inuestiture kingdome naples reasonrene duke barre prisoner burgundie long time held prisoner burgundie bene restrained libertie losse battell blainuille yeare thousand foure hundred thirtie one earle vaudemont marshall burgundie therefore sent thither isabell wife child ayded succoured pope eugenius power three thousand footemeneugenius pope vnder leading conduct patriarke aquileia brought certaine place vnder gouernement obeissaunce side king alphonsus fortune meant striued ballaunce party equally alikealphonsus taken prisoner duke millan vnderstanding death queene hauing besieged gaietta vanquished battell sea philip duke millan genowayes taken enemy ledde prisoner millan found italian duke gracious friendly vnto burgonian angeuin besides great respect wherewith vsed millanois good entertainement receiued handes oftentimes meeting falling familiar discourse seuerall deuises one manner speech fashion good behauiour alphonsus absolute accomplished prince exceedingly please content humour duke regard inward rare amitie familiaritie acquaintance bred betweene may well sayd misfortune readie way good fortune purchase realme healphonsus set libertie duke millan earnestly affected duke millan growing suspicious power puissance french loue spaniard renounce friendship alliance fraunce leagued selfe enemie recouerie conquest naples sort hauing suddenly graunted free libertie alphonsus first set foote within kingdome naples meanes whereof prouerbe first come first serued right preuailed reason absence rene insinuated selfe verierene duke barre set libertie regaineth naples fortress naples besieged alphonsus highly fauour affection prince noble people countrey neuertheles within rene also deliuered burgundy entred naples yeare lord regained castle strong holdes one peece another till time bene custodie possession arragonian alphonsus increasing strength day day came length besiege naples fifteene thousand men land ten gallies lying hauen port citie perseuered obstinately siege dayly passed many goodly exploites gloriousanell mason betrayeth naples deedes armes betweene assaylants defendant notwithstanding troupe might haue dwelt long enough walles naples bene holpen aduertisements certaine mason named anell pricked hope gaine aduenture life augment glory good fortune alphonsus conueying selfe closely priuily foorth towne shewed auncient cesterne water course couertly led vnder ground towne conueyed two hundrednaples taken alphonsus men hardie resolute issuing forth citie pit hollow vault seize vpon certaine turret maintaining fight long season whilest catalan meanetime partly escalado partly breaking port genare make selues way gayned towne meanes became lord citie hauing constrained rene retire selfe castell noue thus alphonsus yeare thousand foure hundred fortie two one twentieth first expedition obtained kingdome citie naples bellisarius nine hundred fiue yeares recouered gothes thatrene enforced forgoe naples princely chieftaine bellisarius meanes conduit water course remained yet three castels fortress namely capouane mountaine castell saint hereme castell noue king rene able defend succour followe estate condition residue towne became arragonois realme prince aniow forced forgoe doubtfull turbulent possession kingdome held space sixe yeares thereabouts alphonsus hadalphonsus king naples death great rest securitie quietly enioyed royall scepter sixteene yeares together depart life leauing behind one onely sonne illegitimate named ferdinand fernand appointed father haue inheritance crowne kingdome naples yet meanely fauoured beloued countrey enioy like quietnesse publike tranquillitie occasion hee vsed meanes possible diligence secure assure vnto selfe quiet peaceable possession kingdome first thing make pope pius second friend andpope pius wellwiller siennois borne late substituted place calixtus compasse bring passe mediation intreatiedutchy spoleta restored church ferdinand crowned king naples pope pius duke millan restitution likewise yeelded franckly vnto prince tarentum nowe perceiuing good successe prosperitie followed angeuin beyond credit expectation would longer dissemble malicious euill minde ferdinand made open friend alphonsus lesse affectionate ferdinand besides considered scanderbeg comming sea could hinder deny landing apulia might open passage towards italie neede army force league might haue free liberty also come side cannot place greatly wonder sort also doth litle grieue see ingratitude writer person whose valour hath well excellently deserued whereas diuerse sortes haue written diligently recorded summe warre betweene ferdinand french yet hath spoken much one word scanderbeg though beene may well speake principall chiefe cause happy successe warre nay may lawfully saie truth true eternall glorie beginning diddest create thing nothing gouerning guiding according thy good pleasure eternitie hast forechosen holy christian faith effusion thy precious bloud bloud thy holy martyr apostle hast laide foundation wonderful maner hast caused dilated dispersed throughout vniuersall world hauing appointed blessed peter vicar prince apostle hast giuen successor whole full authoritie binding loosing heauen earth hast willed commaunded men liuing especially christian elect people obedient admonition comandements sustaine maintaine defend catholique faith church rome euen death behold lord humble poore sheepe altogether vnworthy one thy fold haue free heart willing taken vpon burthen iorney expedition direction commaundement intent vnder conduct protection thy mercy may maintaine power defend libertie thy holy church thy catholique faith citie rome countrie italy haue inuaded professed enemy wherefore mercifull god almightie father art venerable fearfull inuocate thy diuine maiesty humbly require thee fauourable enterprise reach thy hand thy outstretched arme send vnto michaell thy archangell thy holy messenger minister whose fauor may may accompany day night gladly reuerence honor may giue vnto furnish force strength courage voyage passage may happy prosperous vnto may attaine health safety army country apulia enemy discomfited put flight may triumph soon coast shore albany within arose thickscanderbeg faileth towards italy foggy cloud mist couer sight ech could scarcely discerne keepe gallies beating one neuerthelesse holding course made saile till drew towards night time beganne discouer little isle pylot demaunded king whether direct course thither might easily perceiue tempest comming waues sea beganne swell autumne scanderbeg hauing willed bend course isle whole fleete come harbour within port hauing cast ankers rode eight dayes together reason outrage swelling sea length growen calme winde ceased early morning rising sunne hauing heard diuine seruice put againe sea made saile day night following next morning breake day came within sight coast apulia scanderbeg enquired lande appeared farre tolde mount saint angell god thanked saide scanderbeg bende youror mount gargan course thitherwardes haue euer great deuotion saint michaell presently assoone sight mountaine fell knee desired god first discouery apulia might nauie albanois side epyrots resorted towne ranged vp downe field village busying employing theselues diuerse matter ell sadling bridling horse others make ready curasses armor euery man employed himselfe one thing generally prepared selues warre beene presently fight enemie next morning scanderbeg taking small companie men went forth forage vpon land rebel ferdinand soone returned well loaden souldiers estate condition much vnlike ouer sea farre owne house owne countrie vppon territory dominion enemy amongest stranger altogether destitute voide hope without meanes returne againe owne yea affaire brought passe impossible v resolue whether better v stande still goe forwarde considering besides armes horse courage wholly bent addicted deedes armes haue nothing else left v relie build vpon hope life safety get notable victorie vpon enemy courage master let v consider diuine pleasure maintaine patrimony iesus christ house god seat church doubt send v euen heauen easie speedie victorie vnder whose name protection fight soone shall confound enemie shall returne countrie conquerours ioyous triumphant hereof make doubt question first call remembrance ordinary wonted valure set eye many goodly victory haue gotten vppon enemy thus confirmed confidence vertue prowes haue cheerefully vndertaken present voyage hauing learned armes breake discomfite greater army farre better opposed v much reason haue companion esteeme small troupe haue alreadie seene onely brute hearing name euer anie sight v man may say betake themselues flight durst tarrie landing remoued siege retyred v remaineth therefore pursue whilest feare astonishment yet would haue aduised good friendes happen enemie dare abide v come fight v doe beleeue counsell first onely holde play loose light skirmish doe endeuour wearie ouercome trauell trouble continuall onset often charge eyther shall put sworde get aliue prisoner weight heauinesse owne armes doeth sufficiently plague afflicte fight barded horse neyther readie pursue yet nymble flie v lightly armed mounted haue great aduauntage able coursing vppe downe annoy disorder ease goe braue couragious souldiers let euerie man see horse armour good readinesse aide helpe god determined morrowe goe visite enemie albanois desired nothing see enemie enflamed speech next morning breake day presented themselues readie resolute march enemie hauing serued god tooke fielde ensignes displayed full intent goe seeke thescanderbeg troupe skirmish french french came encounter ioyne whole bodie force plaine set battell onely taste light conflict intention albanian prince yet make full tryall fortune onely sport little enemie proue manner souldiers could demeane themselues armes backes skirmish lay dead vpon place thirtie french partie twentie taken prisoner albanois one eyther slaine taken foure wounded returned great ioy bari next day following councell called master campe chiefetaines armie king ferdinand ledde scanderbeg propounded eyther must aduenture battell march abruzza open passage troupe confederatesferdinand scanderbeg free passage abruzza conioyned goe encounter enemie conclusion take way abruzza thereupon order giuen souldiers king albanois readin esse euerie man furnish himselfe victual readie drest fiue dayes done towne assured good garrison armie beganne march king scanderbeg present passed close good order great silence secresie darkenes night fauouring sort discryed french campe lay far held course directly towards country abruzza arriued comming suddenly vpon kept garded passage charged vpon vnprouided furiously behinde flanke side hauing dispersed scattered part orferdinand scanderbeg ioyne force league hauing taken cut peeces wayes passage made open free company league vnder conduct commaund frederick duke vrbin alexander sforce vnited incorporated one army went encamped nere vrsara towne stood king ferdinand farre remoued bari considering deale one subtle politique warriour able expert souldier liuing namely pycenin thought might eyther sollicite place reuolt vpon feare absence trauerses vnconstant fortune present theselues towne might happen ease cary obtaine therefore thought conuenient send thither good sufficient chiefetaine good strong force secure towne need preuent enemy enterprise done dispatched returne againe ioyne one campe commission sufficient difficultie none enuie vnto scanderbeg therefore offering himselfe requesting haue execution seruice liberally freely accorded vnto good deuotion great desire see french againe speake pycenin neerer hande arriued barie owne bandes found thing desired wherefore hauing taken order accidentes dislodged thence speedily marched directly towardes french campe immediatly vpon approach sent defiance challenged battell vsed alwaies vanquish carrie away victorie made nofight betweene scanderbeg french long delay forwarde meete ech partie therefore tooke fielde good order well resolued albanois deuided armie three partes moses dibria led one battallions second guirize commaund thirde reserued himselfe hauing intent therewithall affront pycenin thus thing orderly disposed fight hee made towardes enemie three seuerall wayes whole day spent almost skirmish light conflictes albanois making sometimes though fledde feigned themselues affraide sometimes wheeling casting suddainely againe often sudden charge retraites coursing vppe downe breadth plaine wearie molest french ende battell fell selfe expected manie slaine outright many duke side taken prisoner onely one albanois slaine manie hurt verie fewe taken count quicke conceipted politique wisely foreseeing newe kinde fighting scanderbeg souldiers well exercised long practise vse discipline put worst yet like enough giue handes full bethought selfe therefore could get speake vnto might peraduenture obtaine staie cause himpolicie count pycenin surcease fighting cause aduaunced selfe alone head squadron huge voyce called scanderbeg name inuiting requesting come parley albanois courteous generous disposition without anie apprehension feare knowing countie disdaine speake put himselfe likewise head troupe two chiefetaines beeing thus separated company made choice place equally distant two army discouered rounde side free suspition anie ambushmentes mette conferre parley together count greatly maruelling presence king epyre stoode still without word spoken attentiuely beholding head foote scanderbeg first dismounted horse approaching count tooke bodie man verie litle stature lifted vp aloft ground afterwards hauing kissed custome let downe againe easily count colour subtiltie feigned hadcount pycenin notable dissimulation great matter entreat could expressed short conference promised contriue thing either frenchman leauing quiet peaceable possession realme naples ferdinand auoidepycenin parley scanderbeg apulia returne ouer mountaines would worke confusion proceeding friendly louing discourse saide fully assured frenchman naturally proud insolent beare deadly mortall hatred italian get sure footing realme naples would rest contented portion would aspire dominion italy inhabitant whereof respected regarded slaues brute beast vnreasonable creature many thing else promise doe benefit greatnesse ferdinand also reputation immortall renowme scanderbeg ende requested would cause people sound retrait readie part like souldiers side might take breath might refresh themselues labour trauels endured day long affirming vse custome euer obserued warres amongest italian growing towardes night souldiers side faint wearie held expedient two army retire tentes euery man might betake himselfe rest also entreated courtesie would meete next morning small company intent duke iohn french men might doubt suspect nothing place would assigne might conferre full vpon matter fraudulent plot pycenin conuey singular dissimulation equall malice despightfull humorcount pycenin dishonest practise scanderbeg drift bring albanois within daunger either aliue dead act dishonest litle practised amongst true knight least wise thought drawing parley length gaine time bring passe night separate perceiued full well albanois aduantage dayes iourney scanderbeg giuing faith credite speech reason personage great renowme authoritie simply plainely condiscende request causing sound retrait cease combat meane time moses guirize late skirmish taken prisoner foure squadron enemy present vnto generall picenin seeing beganne blush shame sore troubled mind stood bene dombe afterwards come himselfe spake againe prince albanie according wonted dissembled manner effect perceiue quoth noble generous prince cannot abashedspeech count pycenin scanderbeg see thy captaines souldiers doe shewe themselues haue small discipline haue litle regard respect thy commaund thou seest set downe order published one voice consent souldiers army withdrawe themselues battell men notwithstanding haue assailed forced squadron obedient edict haue brought hither prisoner vnto thee great reproach dishonor thing iudgement vniust iniurious contrarie thy faith reputation neuerthelesse trusting thy vertue valure haue euer reputed thee prince great magnanimitie faithfull thy word haue good hope thou wilt obserue faith promise thou hast giuen wilt cause souldiers set libertie vniustly taken made prisoner count went away without aunswere scanderbeg replyed vnto manner certainly count iames cannot chuse greatly maruell thou aanswere scanderbeg count pycenin man famous renowmed wouldest either speake much thinke speech onely vaine friuolous litle truth appearance say captain men armes haue taken defeated thy squadron disarmed publication edict agreement thou thy selfe hast seene contrarie thou maiest denie verie first wee two met together place men foyled taken prisoner euer abstinence armes either concluded signified throughout army therefore know matter seeme strange iniurious vnto thee troupe thy selfe hast confessed haue bene fight day long possible agreement short space published made knowen throughout quarter campe thy men seeing force still armes fight could simply layedowne armes giue ouer fighting must needes thinke whilest thy souldiours would shew themselues thou sayest precise obseruers thy commaundements iustly shame made prisoner vnto v rather despight willes ouercome right armes haue lost victorie haue deserued captiuitie moreouer cannest thou call account men either rebellious carelesse discipline many time fewer lesser number spoken without boasting haue broken ouerthrowen many puissant mightie army barbarian haue tamed subdued made captiues many proud braue chieftaines turkes infidel speake truth obedience order militarie discipline dare auow feare reuerence leader generall doe stand feare enemy concerning request thine thy squadron right warre made prisoner freely restored redeliuered vnto thee truly thy demaund shall vaine furie fight hath spared aliue vse custome depriue either life libertie number taken scanderbeg deliuered armour gaue freely vnto pycenin parley ended betooke himselfe campe albanois went towards bari whence next albany freely left vnto souldiers time ottoman emperour sent turke one hisassambeg armie scanderbeg victorie scanderbeg assambeg ocrida chieftaines also named assambeg another armie men scanderbeg hauing gotten somewhat side ocrida made yeeld good account voyage vanquished rather vtterly broken wholy oppressed one onely battell fortune good experience aswell curtesie clemencie enemy martiall force fury turke furiously valiantly fighting battell gardes body slaine side left open horse sore hurt though deadlyassambeg wounded great extremitie losse battell ocrida also wounded right arme arrow hard plight difficultie thing confounded discouraged aswell remembrance fresh discomfiture griefe wound troubled ouertaken darknes night badly accopanied euery man present danger aduised withdrawen themselues way standing feare enemy discomodities way darke night keepe themselues close secret anguish say griefe body minde assambeg retired rested himselfe vpon little mountaine rather thicke wood farre border christian foure myles campe countrey altogether vnknowen vnto wholy ignoraunt wayes pathes passage stayd long ere discouered vigilancie souldiours albanois one bene sent day discouer make search ouer coast hauing diligently surueyed place came speedely vnto captaine acquainted whole matter onely one point deceaued reason shadow place thicknes ofassambeg hidden wood discouered founde scanderbeg wood thought number enemy greater deed assured vnto generall much scanderbeg selfe mounting horsebacke make hast great heate seize vpon relickes victory accompanied cauallary turkes discerning co ming farre need doubt troubled greatly acquainted chiefetaine matter aggrieued immediatly fell consultation resolued vpon course perhaps vnbeseeming great chieftaine braue souldiers yet safe necessary march without armes without horse go meet conqueror captaine author counsell led way vnto company formost went ouer deformed bloud filth much vnlike marke anthony time fled battell modena mutina lepidus triumuir came neare tooke scanderbeg horse reines bridle three foure good wordes saued liues selfe companie found enemie wonderfully passionated misfortune vpon speech vsed vnto whither goest thou quoth scanderbeg wouldest thou forspeech assambeg scanderbeg thine honour still vanquish ouercome thine enemy suffer pray thee suffer thy selfe sometimes ouercome vanquished thy victorie shall greater thou wert victorious glorie commendation shalt thou recken triumph thy clemencie amongst thy victory thou hast purchased vpon thine armed enemy christian prince smiling turning people nothing said hesentence answer scanderbeg speech assambeg subtile aduerse fortune nothing sharpe conceipted politicke necessitie wisely eloquently speake conquered conquerours know taking hand sayd vnto assure thy selfe friend thou shalt haue neither harme iniurie helpe hauing sent away commaunded wound well looked vnto want nothing afterwardsclemencie scanderbeg assambeg sentence caused certaine people conduct place suretie thing honorable commendable know willing vse mercy pity enemie conquered miserable afflicted scanderbeg marched armie coursing vp downe side finding prouince cleare ambushments enemy returned campe thence neare croy solemnized rest ioy gladnesse victorie within dayes came iussumbeg sent likewise epirot iussumbeg sent armie turkes scanderbeg followed course fortune companion done much likely beaten came weake feeble estate seeke aduersary newly victorious yet embrued bloud enemy entred scopia chiefe city macedony eighteene thousand men presumed determinedscopia macedonie thought would march euen heart bowel epire considering selfe looking late mishap assambeg rashnesse temerity comming reported king albanie made greatly wonder men could straungely wilfully forget selues rather immoderate desire vnsatiable thirst bloud life turning souldiers thus spake vnto goe good friend companion borne trauels ratherspeech scanderbeg soldier encouraging iussumbeg continuall victory let v go meete new enemy new captaine let v refuse doe honour first shocke dare assure giue v good matter honor glory euery man loud clamour acclamation applaud wordes prepared selues follow chiefetaine drawing neare scopia hearing vauntcurrours enemy taken field gaue signall vnto souldiers giue onset vpon barbarian preparedthe battell scopia scanderbeg iussumbeg neither courage resolution combat receiued notwithstanding yet seemed doe countenaunce one came rather talke matter fight thinke scanderbeg would haue either greatly contempt disdaine hardinesse selfe durst farre owne frontier come hazard fortune battell within territory enemy fro whence vanquished could haue escaped could either repaire force though victorious well assured safetie reason painim euen beginning loosing strength courage find course better expedient turne head make hast away shewing way vnto people shamefull ignominious flight kept companyvictorie scanderbeg iussumbeg like maner excepting thereabouts preferring honor liues died valiantly armes hand fled found themselues worse case flying expected whereas supposed might haue fled safetie haue bene pursued enemie reason owne countrey vpon owne dunghill therein greatly deceiued fellowes whichnumber turkes slaine battell scopia slaine fight made vp full number least taken prisoner reason great difficulty discommodities hindred safe conucying also length retrait make paisants might haue assailed way iussumbeg thought haue rallied troupe haue layed ambushment haue dressed deuise entrapping enemie souldiers would meanes hearken vnto holding scattered course greater desire returne home though displeasure prince returne home excused themselues vpon discomfiture wherefore good scanderbeg often call minde matter wherwith age time delighted moreouer remembring thou hast heretofore done seruice empire house ottoman glory enlarging crowne dignitie desire endeuor loue make much thee possible ardent affection protest god nothing happen vnto acceptable agreeable life see thee neare time enioy thy presence souldiers haue late violently inuaded thy dominion entred vpon thy realme committing excesse outrage yet ought occasion impediment hinder thee comming vnto v whatsoeuer hath done case without command knowledge reason would haue take ill part neither doth sort displease haue bene chastised misdeed recompenced according desert omitting matter let v returne ancient amitie alliance doth easily perswade induce desire may reconciled may haue peace euer hence forward intent sacred indissoluble league confederacy friendly bond old auncient acquaintance hath maner bene extinguished long continuall absence may nowe againe renued increased strongly confirmed betweene v article accord shall thou thinke good seeme iniurious vnto theeconditions peace propou ded mahomet scanderbeg know desireth demaundeth peace prescribe set downe condition peace first thing demand thee thou suffer armie haue free safe passage throughout thy realme dominion inuade ouerrunne make warre vpon countrey townes venetian thou deliuer v hostage thy sonne iohn promise vowe continually acknowledge respect one owne child traffike trade marchandise may free open subiects throughout thy seigniory like case shall thine ouer part empire besides also offer vnto thee full power libertie securitie safely come haue accesse vnto v case thou wilt gratifie yeeld vnto v faithfully promise thee word faith king keepe obserue true continuall peace friendship thee thy people person soeuer shall deare acceptable vnto v thy selfe vttermost power defend thy countrey troubled molested either owne armes others soeuer matter pray thee giue full credit vnto mustapha agent shall word mouth impart vnto thee dated imperiall citie constantinople second may yeare generation iesus letter mahomet openly read full assembly generall counsell prince lord captaines epire one voyce full greatnesse thy loue singular affection thou doest protest beare vnto thou saiest hath bene ratified olde auncient nouriture education bound deepely rooted long vse conuersation manner conuerted second nature shall flourish endure betweene v perpetually thou saiest also whereas familiaritie laide sleepe manner discontinued reason haue beene farre long disioyned seuered thou hast great earnest desire reuiue recontinue newe league friendship amitie condition whereof thou doest propound first thy troupe may haue free sure passage countrie inuade endamage venetian thy demand cannot may consent agree without manifest breach right equitie without great dishonor royall estate dignitie venetian allyes confederate touching thy desire haue sonne hostage surer confirmation peace betweene v might peraduenture would gladly doe affection father disswade detaine onely childe verie young tender age nowe behoueth nourished trayned vp manner customes cannot taken embracement parent without great singular preiudice himselfe thou requirest concerning thy subiects marchants may haue free passage come go buy sell traffique ware marchandice throughout dominion captaines doe like allow motion selfe also doe desire nothing traffique trade marchandice may haue full free course euerie betweene v moreouer thou doest inuite great shew affection come visite thee doubt doe confidence securitie intent mutuall sight conuersation might satisfie desire long continued absence doe highly commend worthy prince bountie thy minde liberalitie thy good nature disposition regard whereof vrgent affayres letter written effect mahomet beg amira sultan emperour partes world scanderbeg prince albanois epyrots thou hast written vnto mustapha agent condition ofletters mal met scanderbeg peace offered vnto thee one onely liketh thee namely marchants may lawfully freely transport sell commodity vpon condition onely thou doest make offer peace vnto alleaging mind thy captaines content accept touching thy excuse take good part therefore scanderbeg doe promise thee faithfully thou thy part doest demaund gratefull pleasing vnto doe willingly accorde mindes good liking thee thine sweare vnto thee great god call witnesse obserue peace thee sacred perpetuall inuiolable liues thy selfe doest first infringe giue occasion violate end thou shalt receiue present letter signed owne hande sealed imperiall ordinarie seale token assurance strength confirmation peace shall firme permanent cause also desire thee thou please subscribe likewise firme thy accustomed vsuall seale may haue testimonie thy intent meaning moreouer pray thee take order throughout thy dominion vppon conclusion hereof open proclamation may made publique notice may giuen good solemne edict thy subiectes peace league concluded betweene v likewise partes cause done throughout part empire intent loue good towardes thee may apparant thou shouldest vnderstande owne free proper motion franke pure liberalitie doe graunt vnto thee well content thou shalt freely lawfully entirely enioy holde keepe force strong hande thou hast taken wonne amurath late father thou shalt quietly possesse retayne euer beene thy auncient inheritance descended vnto thee thy auncestors doe absolutely renounce release vnto thee right prerogatiue authoritie haue time heretofore vnto doe giue graunt confirme vnto thee protesting hencefoorth approue allow thee true lawfull king epyre albanie alwayes repute entitle thee neither anie time hereafter molest trouble thee force haue alreadie sworne protested prouided thou giue v iust cause occasion thereunto wherefore doe expect thou send vnto v copie present sealed thy seale ambassadour vnto thou maiest giue credence touching thing shall declare vnto thee behalfe giuen imperiall citie chieftaines colonel long debating discoursinganswere albanois ambassadour venetian vpon matter much one desire renue warre mahometist sultan himselfe seemed vttermost power shunne auoide vnwilling enter againe armes rather late caused part bootie restored protested souldiers onely sport certaine militarie licentiousnesse taken caried away epyre hereupon ambassadour hauing heard answere resolution albanois departed thence sad sorrowfull repulse tooke way archbishop dura knew wonderfull good credite king albanie people epyre maruellous good opinion much thing neuer hard difficult empire happie fortunate gouerned men wisedome vertue truth whereof selues doe see cleere daylight verified people estate albanie liuing vnder rule commaund thy maiestie sage vertuous prince peerelesse inuincible chieftaine good reason therefore king potentate thy next neighbor elect choose nominate thee alone worthy chiefe generall sent heauen defend protect crownes estate rage fury ottoman fiercenesse barbarian haue bene hitherto excellently well defended preserued vnder protection thy armes valure thy souldiers well perceiued mahomet subtle wilie foxe lie continually waite entrap beguile christian cruell vehement persecutor christian faith farre exceeding euer liued hauing greedie desire satisfie brutish extreame hatred conceiued name profession christianitie crafty cunning dissimulation thingifamiliar vsuall house ottoman hath gotten procured thee conclude peace condescending gladly vnto lawes couenants pleased thee prescribe vnto onely would molested troubled thy armes stood doubt thing else whatsoeuer ala sage prudent prince cannot discerne discouer barbarian barbarous kind craft deceipt hath drawen thee treatie hath fradulently wonne thee peace onely first roote prince thy neighbour afterwardes might come vpon thee also hath alreadie begunne partly put practise rascian prince king illirians sclauonians become emperour trebysond see traytor euen late owne faith couenantes right lawe nation hath bent force thee also wasting acking thy prouince daily inroades continuall inuasions doth trouble vexe thy allyes confederate expresse immortall rancour tyrant thee doest thou thinke suffer death father huge slaughter army manie murthers captaines chiefetaines remaine vnreuenged possible thou canst repose trust confidence wordes infamous deceiuer canst thou admit excuse doest thou thinke keepe promise faith thee neuer yet anie faith euer day keepe fayth anie man liuing good god number villanies mischiefes fellonous cruell tyrant yet let passe silence vntouched holde lesse plaine impietie inueigh one notoriously wicked make knowen vnto worlde author vice wickednesse thing delectable delightfull greatly profitable beneficiall men terrified example may abstaine mischiefe vitious action therefore vertue ought suffered goe vnrewarded without commendation ought vice likewise checked reprehended one twaine reape like frute benefite exalting good suppressing wicked thing iust reasonable vicious lewdly giuen heare wickednesse openly reproued condemned aboue others turkish tyrant mahomet one farre surpasseth excelleth kindes mischiefe villanies whose life manner detestable deedes hold amisse briefely runne ouer lay open intent may better knowen vnto thee thou maiest sooner shun eschew first say nothing originall ofspring descended scithians issued base village called otmanach whence proceeded family ottoman mahomet endowed notable vigour dexteritie spirit bodie peruerse mischeeuous nature become common enemie mankind cruell bloudsucker chiefe ringleader vice prince wickednesse delighting death destruction men father mischiefes vnsatiable murtherer auncestors litle better disposition hath retayned barbarous fiercenesse intemperance perseuering whole course life one peruersenesse crooked diuelish nature beginning youth hath euer singular delight warres murthers rapine dissentions hath alwayes bene trayned exercised man stout courage audatious withall variable vnconstant full deceipt double dealing deepe dissembler action greedy men good burning owne lustes desire continually couetous thing immoderate vnpossible first grew vnmeasurable desire money afterwardes empire dominion soule plentifully furnished wicked damnable artes wanteth corrupt lewd lustes shamelesse ribaud common adulterer inuenter new vice euen nature selfe hath horror detestation mahomet ambitious humour strangled owne naturall brother notable treachery infidelitie murthered prince rascia king bosnia bloud linage brought miserable bondage seruitude others depriued sight put eye else mangled part body speake infinite others vppon hath practised kindes torment doe verily beleeue end find none elsewhere vpon execute monstrous crueltie spare vse selfe infinitely nature enclined fiercenesse inhumanitie wrathfull fierie rage minde neuer contented satisfied towards god soule mostimpure towards men dangerous neuer ceaseth plotting contriuing worke dammage ruine others maketh account amitie enmitie man serue owne turne regardeth keepe meane measure thing committeth kinde villanies cruelty friend owne subiects spoyleth robbeth temple publique priuate profaneth holy sacred thing polluteth thing seizeth vpon euery thing maketh difference honour dishonour shame shamefastnesse honestie dishonestie diuine thing humaine thing mingleth confoundeth one another euer gaue faith made promise hath contrary faith owne couenants either subdued slaine enthralled therefore noueltie worthy prince perinted mahomet keepe word promise thee especially seeing defiled polluted kind vice doth possesse impietie discent periurie hereditarie vnto trust therefore tyrant build vpon promise shake acquaintance repute peace dissolued broken affraid first infringe violate let cause thee refraine inuading dominion sworde fire prouide say prouide thy selfe thy estate prudent prince feare least barbarian doe traines entrappe oppresse v false traitor well beaten practised fraud subtiltie deuiseth meditateth vpon nothing else may destroy extirpate faith christ thou knowest thou diddest determine yea thou diddest vowe solemne oath thou wouldest alwayes labour trauell euen death doe well remember haue oftentimes heard thee say onely defence preseruation thereof thou diddest thinke thy selfe created borne worlde reason hast thou scanderbeg pardon beseech thee speaking lay aside thy armes wilt thou nowe liue thy selfe alone doest thou thinke thy estate little nothing worse thou olde souldier doest sit still doe nothing shame manshould see ancient liuelinesse quicknesse spirit excellent worthie prince waxe rustie idlenesse vanish away nothing stirring spirit thy good friend mahomet idle doeth passe away time sloth sitteth still thou doest accustometh himselfe waking watching laboureth bestirreth himselfe hasteneth possible speed celeritie defile prophane gospell sonne god ouerwhelme ship blessed saint peter teare rend peeces coate christ sauiour without seame following therein steppe auncestors tradition false prophet ordained name iesus christ persecuted prophane odious bloud innocent faithfull christian spilt follower hence bloudie hangman hath continually pursued faith religion christian mortall deadly hatred thou worthie prince doest display thy armes thou doest aduance thy force thou doe inuade make warre vpon doubted men generally repute hold thee faint hearted fearefull giuen ouer sloth idlenes hast thou heard king prince catholike faith together soueraigne pastor church haue conspired bloudie tirant fully determined god assistance pursue persecute power puissance expell wholly europe alreadie hath holy father sent forth bull published throughout christendome vertue whereof king christian prince haue full remission sinnes assoone shall come accompanie supreame bishop shall march cursed enemie god men wherefore venetian duke senate also haue made incredible preparation sea land pope holinesse likewise christian generall conuite thee call vpon thee nominate appoint thee chiefe principall leader prince worthy charge holy warre expedition assoone holinesse shalbe arriued side sea shall haue made entry within dura determined crowne thee king epyre albany doest thou scanderbeg fortunate happy prince wherefore doest thou temporize either must thou hencefoorth euer giue ouer beare armes forgo warres quietly submit thy necke vnto yoke infidell else thou must contend common enemie thou must case yeelde vnto either patience vertue thou art contend totall summe supreame power soueraignitie stirre vp againe vigour thy haughty courage thy puissant force call together thy chieftaines leauy men souldiers part inuite prince thy neighbour confederate dresse readinesse dispose order thy squadron thy legion march generall assembly faithfull colledge christian conforme thy selfe counsell vniuersall bishop purchase thou pardon thy owne offence thy army likewise behold thy friend venetian haue sent hither declare thing vnto thee summon inuite thee exhort perswade thee intent thou maiest conioyne thy force force thy ensignes ensignes thy troupe troupe thou knowest venetian christian prince bountifull puissant sea land doe promise proffer vnto thee golde siluer men plentifull manner goe scanderbeg neuer shewe thy selfe truely scanderbeg thou art honour glorie prince thou formost man thy band warre vpon miscreant inuade land giue iust cause feare terror euen say hauing broken couenants falsified faith violated peace first prouoke thee betake thy selfe armes lawes right openlysentence permit allow lawfull faith promise obserued towardes haue first violated faith fidelitie march therefore march hardily catholique armie giue first charge attempt vpon thy enemie denounce open generall warre barbarian prepare waye soueraigne pastour christendome behold pope pius behold venetian behold french almaines spaniardes flemmings hungarian bohemian polonians italian brieflie christian nation people doe follow thee doe come helpe second thee therefore pagan mahometist euer able resist many king many prince many nation warlike army soone betake himselfe flight soone forsake forgoe europe pride insolencie ottoman fraudulent deceiptfull dealing secret traines wicked deuises profit litle nothing wonted policy sleightes able helpe neuerthelesse needfull thou circumspect prouident thou must vse singular prudence wisedome assoone wily craftie foxe shall perceiue preparation made speedily send ambassador vnto thee flatter thee entise thee diswade thee taking armes harken vnto alienat thy mind fro wicked peruerse nature stop thy eares flattery smooth perswasions thou art sufficiently acquainted inward affection hart thou seest well enough maner man neuer one world fraudes line house ottoman perfectly better known discouered layed open vnto thee oration pronounced archbishop dura great vehemencie scanderbeg withdrewe himselfe counsell chieftaines souldiers matter long doubtfully debated betweene two especiall yet diuerse different opinion one argued spirit thought albanian estranged deed armes commonly seene sweetnes gaine interrest doth corrupt oastardize spirit litle litle doth make degenerate another naturesentence would case heare speech renuing warre mahomet wished couenants condition peace concluded betweene point obserued fulfilled wdich saied doth proceed great benefit commoditie people townes city growing rich welthy profit like daily augmented besides turkish monarch restored maner pillage bene taken vpon countrie albanois opinion cleane contrarie held case needfull haue recourse armes ought trust wordes sultan neuer kept promise especially christian much rather ought doe first broken peace violated summe capitulation past betweene moreouer litle faith giuen tirant promise tended end draw deceit cunning entertaine faire wordes saw christian ioyned league shortly like feele weight burthen fearefull terrible force singular dammage circumcised onely cause kept feare awe brought point promise wonder otherwise would neuer haue suffered rest quiet would haue restored bootie bene taken therefore mahomet scanderbeg desiring renue peace betwene instice noble princely scanderbeg therfore cannot easily perswaded generous magnanimous prince inconsiderately falsifie faith breake peace established betwene thee giuen vnderstand thou hast great force inuaded land territory turning thing vpside downe pitifull foule disorder thou hast gotten carried away inestimable booty infinite good subiects excesse credibly informed fully perswaded venetian haue bene cause motiue whose instigation enticement thou hast bene pricked forward incited v practises flattery hast thou bene drawen make warre vpon openly shewing thy selfe breaker thy promise violatour rightes law nation wherefore neither attribute litle fault blame vnto thee considering cause ignominie rather ignominy selfe impute whole offence vnto haue bene alwaies sworn professed enemy harme vnto scanderbeg lord commaunder many people prouinces doest thou thinke thou hast done great notable displeasure thou hast wrought great dammage crowne dignitie wasting spoyling field insolently chasing dryuing away beast cattell guise manner theeues freebooter rather true worthie souldiers yet part repute iniurie nay content thou go forward like thou doe continue holde still thy course inuasions thou thinke meete conuenient protest vnto thee prize set thy friendship amitie thing whatsoeuer deere vnto thou knowest haue alwayes loued highly affected thee often recall minde tender age yeares youth wherein nourished brought vp together court amurath cannot chuse assure thee acknowledge selfe thy debtour possible meanes wherein may way pleasure thee wherefore good friend scanderbeg doe hartely pray thee earnestly entreat thee may renew former couenants may againe reconfirme peace solemne mutuall oath betweene v course heretofore taken thought vpon first treatie sure thou wouldest neuer haue suffered thy selfe seduced lead away venetian thou wilt nowe doe request wilt giue credit vnto hope thou wilt sweare protest vnto thee thou thy posteritie shalt raigne peaceably quietly good securitie assurance continually otherwise beleeue thou sure thou wilt repent speedily thou knowest greatnesse puissance would wish thee well aduised consider throughly whether thou able resist neither thy neighbour thy friendes venetian canne protect defend thee iust violence anger wrath furie doest thou see greekes destroyed consumed away nothing emperour trebisond haue despoyled depriued empire prince rascians triballians rooted subuerted illyrian broken wasted realmes asia many prince tamed subdued hearken therfore counsell meanes mercy discretion king epire encamped end valley forseeing well neare neighbourhood enemy could parted without talking nearer together force weakest iudged needfull seeke aduantage therefore vsed speech vnto souldiers good friend companion see well behoueth v day asmuchoration scanderbeg souldiours battell valcala euer make enemy feele ballaban come seeke v make proofe whether fortune friendly vnto shee hath beene predecessours begin march hold best remoue campe mountaine backes notwithstanding must marke soone seeth v departing hence imagine meane flie therefore bethought immediatly charge v possible violence backes doe receiue valiantly haue litle shifted place fained retraite sodainely turne head round braue charge beare vpon strength custome breake disorder doubt shall haue discretion take heede good souldiers pray well aduised haue put flight haue chase follow execution vppon takeheed say enter case within mouth straight valcala stopping course passe forwardes within passage knowe certaine squadron enemie layed entrappe v knowe well well acquainted place pollicies barbarian enter neuer get againe let suffise therefore friend pursue victorie euen entrie place soone thus spoken espied ballaban marching directly towardesthe battell valcala betweene ballaban scanderbeg whereupon sent certaine number light horseman seize vppon hill chosen lodging armie immediatly followed bodie troupe making though meant haue made retrait turkes perceauing beleeuing verelie bene true playne flight galloped without good order great furie held course length valley epyrots begin beare vppe close together nothing astonished clamour violent charge turkes turned hardie resolution receaued shocke ioyned combat began fight grow sharpe cruell bloudy many fell one side victorie rested long time doubtfull vncertaine fine albanois fought constant settled resolution obstinacie infidelles ordervictorie scanderbeg ballaban turkes confusion got aduantage killing beating downe partes draue backe euen streightes valcala tooke breath made stand excepting eight onely christian armie without doubt worthie haue absolute commaunde good great armie transported furie fight heate armes forgetting expresse commaundement generall spurred forward eager desire following chase vpon enemie mortall hatred ballaban drawen ambuscado infidel vnaduisedly entangle themselues ambusqued passing still within valley came last trench barbarian yeeld reckoning comming pay shot vnto hostes neuerthelesse continuing also cruell fight shewed selues valiaunt bestirre themselues valour dexteritie end gayned toppe mountaine possessed infanterie turkes thought haue bene owne companie fell againe new second perill greater former ende infinite prooues theirmoses guirize musache noble epyrots taken prisoner turkes wonderfull prowesse valour wearied striking killing enemy men horse growing faint multitude wound taken aliue ballabanians vertue courage incomparable prowesse historie therefore onely barely set downe name vnto themoses guirize de vladienne musache de augeline gine musache iohn terlat nicholas berisee george chuque gine manesse first offereth selfe remembred great moses dibrian haue often made mention onely chiefe man deare faithfull vnto scanderbeg lieutenant armie next guirize de vladienne neare kinseman scanderbeg followed musache de angeline
