ballaban scanderbeg bodie olde expert souldiers vppon builded chiefest hope confidence placing selfe directly scanderbeg began fierce cruell fight betweene albanois mahometan horrible slaughter one side two general proper person drew eye men towards might haue seene infanterie cauallarie albanie old band croie vsed accustomed maine battelles valiant resolute dibrians make shew notable skill practise arte militarie verie beginning fight trouble vauntgard infidel made ensignes giue ground till time furie fight encreasing cry side growing redoubled againe aduance themselues couragiously first scanderbeg giue newe charge vppon pressing behind enforcing himselfe possible meanes put array cryed aloft vnto people saying friend make hast hitherwardes rid sospeech scanderbeg souldiers encouraging fight ballaban much way make long speedie iourneyes ende purpose shall suffer selues helde short chiefetaine troupe haue many time discomfited chased ouerrunne notwithstanding hauing endeuored striued vaine breake scatter side made choise certaine squadron right wing thought would haue least doe would rather stand idle employed fight causing wheele conuey themselues behinde enemie backes without apperceiued either aduerse party owne companie therewithall strike vppon lefte wing enemie furie celeritie thought haue found haue receiued vpon flancke side battallion suddenly gotten behind charged back sort alchanzes alophages found themselues assailed endammaged side front flancke rereward slaughter began also grow vpon asappi made litle resistaunce part night absented themselues ensignes licentiously dispersed ouer fieldes lay still wallowing vpon ground ouercome sleepe trauell rest present battell wearied late trauell ouerwatching tender soft kind people ill able endure heate yeare hard trauell scarce could abide armes vpon backes sunne highest made case partly extreme heate partly thirst enemy found men halfe dead fell hand heapes taken slaine pleasure ballaban oftentimes purchased great honour commendation like battelles iourney behaued himselfe nobly whatsoeuer partly encouraging men fight partly also hazarding person daungers one egging pressing forward another blaming rebuking backward sometimes recalling fled long time maintaine fight well worthely still animating souldiours renuing conflict many place saw people waxe faint giue ouer last sawe fortune field enclinevictorie scanderbeg fourth time ballaban turkes epirots could longer sustaine violence chaunged resolution setting spurres horse turned backe withdrew himselfe fight christian whole armie like perceiuing rancks scattered disordered euery man began flie ouer fieldes mountaines wood according ech man fortune good bad guide direct fewe following generall escaped together got away swordes enemy slaughter fellowes rest barbarian either slaine taken prisoner happened gotten free furie confusion chase yet cut peeces kept toppes passage mountaines much whole hoast armie ballaban verie fewe left aliue small reliques remained sort pursued sudden rumour report newe fresh enemie comming scarce christian departed valley valcala souldiers yet made ende parting deuiding spoyles slayne enemy came messenger mamisa king sister poast haste petrella ladie lay guard housholde aduertised scanderbeg iagup arnauth sixteene thousand horse entred epyre way belgrade wasted destroyed thing encamped lower tyranna neere adioyning toiagup arnauth encamped argilat epire riuer inhabitant name argilat turke epyrot birth parent christian himselfe hauing beene taken circumcised turkes professe superstition man great hardinesse valure time past asia greece left many goodly commendable testimony prowes vnder mahomet comming epyre haue saide enclose prince albanie cruelty log cotinuance war multitude battels haue hath worne eaten vp consumed force last cast much left whole body part whole sounde may receaue wound neither haue bloud left v may shed bestow como weale christedome wherfore reueret father prince christia brightnesse glory church god holinesse clemencie speedely readily helpe withstand preuent mischief estate welfare albany euer gone lost cause reuerend father hath brought hither hath caused haue recourse vnto haue left great fire kindled flaming house enemy euen doores hath onely destroyed layd desolate wasted prouince hath murthered captiuated people holdeth croy key bulwarke realme streightly besieged resolued depart fro thece till haue brought made turkish doubt go neare succoured greatnesse authoritie whilest time therefore thinke vppon worthy prelate father prouide betimes beseech standeth vppon represse violence bridle rage growen strong mightie threatneth menaceth extremity onely estate christendome church god euen ground foundation religion also hath already inflicted vpon christian people example act inhumanitie possibly inuented sort would lesse difficult troublesome tell would reprochfull heare see holy pastour see reuered father doubt euen certaintie horrible ruine calamitie see religious prelate ambitious prince hath already seized vpon two christian empire part asia slauery thraldome vnder greekes manner destroyed tryballians rascians thracian brought vnder subiection sclauonie subdued force morea seruitude almost macedonie epyre burned sacked made desert furie outrage see reliques many prince many chieftaines macedonie greece haue heard soueraigne prelate reuerend father many warres many trauels tedious exploit toyles auncestours haue periured faithlesse nation selfe haue one day one minute rest quietnes without ceasing yeres haue sharp bloudy conflict prophane people especially fierce beast mahomet hath afflicted estate many ruines mischieues haue way giue place vnto haue eue till day resisted opposed selfe haue almost continually diuine bounty gone away victory time holy father wearied many trauels discomodities past present wasted consumed many battels hauing lost many excellent captaines many souldiers subiectes slaine destroyed haue part auncient fortune left v generous hart deuout soules whereas barbarous scithian may sinnes haue bene cause hath encreased force hath amplified empire beyond discourse humane reason humbly therfore holy father prostrat selfe holines inuocate call vpon sacred name implore aide succour worthy prelats cosult beseech make prouisio take order may haue meanes resist many tempest stormes war may lesse perill life preiudice affaire able beare sustaine brunt thereof priuate miserie soldier nothing moue afflictio chapion passionate leastwise let comon necessitie imminent perill flock future desolation estate christedome stir vp perswade seruitude greeuous turkish bondage accidet happe bitter godly christia soules see infant vnited vnto christ holy baptisme redeemed pretious bloud son god eternall comunion societie faithfull afterwards againe cut away separated nusled execrable blasphemy mahomet made open professed cruell enemy christ church make warre heauen perish eternall death damnation thing hard lamentable see owne child issued owne bowel become enemy see made onely meanes minister cut throat worke ruine destruction cannot seruitude bondage christian soules euill much greeuous intollerable death selfe oration king epyre harkened vnto lesse attentiuenesse accepted allowaunce good liking whole consistorie euery man sayd openly requisite necessarie succour speede diligence christian brother suffer noble prouince vertuous people deuoured swallowed vp cruell bloudthirsty enemie smooth speech fayre wordes goodly promise whereof gaue plenty proued end nothing else court fauours vanished smoake cause thereof know happened departure thence soone litle andscanderbeg ill succoured christian small succour pope paul second though venetian borne yet badly affectioned towards owne countrey scanderbeg inward faithfull friend ouer besides strict ancient knot friendship confederacy beene preserued nourished great deuotion betweene commonwealth three thousand crownes deliuereddemetrius franke treasurer scanderbeg hand demetrius franke one chiefe principall citizen driuasta cosin countrey minde haue gone farre venice taking aduise vpon matter finding expedient reason piteous estate wherein left kingdome countrey epire contented himselfe send thither secretary let senate city vnderstand hard successe voyage rome animate perswade ministersome aideaide giuen venetian others scanderbeg reliefe croy turkes lech nicholas ducagin succour vnto obtained shall heare scanderbeg vpo way return towards epire went first scutary iosaphat barbare great command authority haue spoken heretofore hauing made notable leauy subiects venetian adioyned owne force like maner lech ducagin nicholas brother brauelie mounted came vnto valiaunt horseman many footman expert skilfull souldiers adioyne selues hundreth men armes armed white footemen italian pay entertainment seigniorie venice within scutarie besides good horse three thousand footman gathered amongst scutarians driuastines antiuarians lissians dirrachians much aide vnited incorporated one make vp full complet number chosen men note prince people epyre macedony sclauony dalmatia leagued allyed together faile send ech certaine force made rende vous place appointed command disposition scanderbeg deuided two troupe one part whereof committed conduct leading lech ducagin aboue named knight lesse policie hardinesse warres nicholas nicholas moneta gouernor scutarie moneta borne scutarie vaiuoda gouernor citie gentleman emathia pharsalia situation croy seated vpon high crest ridge mountaine circuit compasse thereof part enuironed many steepe downefals excepting one place hardly approached deuided cut mount cruyna nigh continuing euen close towne doth seeme much higher haue commaund thereof mountaine runneth long side castle croy hanging ouer deepe cliffe small descent doth deuide selfe diuerse hils litle mount place ballaban placed campe hauing drawen thither masse maine strength armie gotten possession mountaine cruyna hauing fortified garded great strong garrison presse towne hard grieuous siege leauing encamped let v returne troupe plot laide mentioned bandes deuided scanderbeg force went first visite enemie come saide mountaine receiued aduertisement ionyme brother ballaban marching towardesionime brother ballaban co ming supply turk brother surprised scanderbeg brother good number turkes report went alreadie past mountaine bulgarie immediatly vppon newes scanderbeg singular promptnesse resolution tooke choise flower army hauing caused residue keepe themselues still quiet roade night extreame speede diligence meete ionyme hauing surprised sudden vnprouided soone broke dispersed taking himionyme sonne heder taken prisoner aliue heder sonne likewise night lesse speede went forwarde returned companie victorie next morning brought foorth presented sight ballaban brother nephew bound tyed together thereupon giuing braue charge vpon garrison turkes lay vppon mount cruyna chased fromscanderbeg chaseth turkes mount cruyna thence seized place tooke vp lodging vppon toppe mountaine giuing present order confederate haue notice thereof hande nowe ballaban promised selfe intelligence within croy wonderfully abashed see christian suddainely come neere manner ouer head might commaunde wherefore hauing newly encouraged reassured part people somewhat troubled alarme letting vnderstande towne surely owne would make haste enter prouide owne safetie whereas otherwise fayled enterprise staie longer croie knowing well loose labour daungers would great continue siege could cost deare saw brother defeated enemie forwarde could occasion great inconuenienceballaban solliciteth croians yeeld vnto vnto thus accompanied good troupe presented himselfe walles went euen almost port citie perswading solliciting within render themselues vnto continue attending issue expected croians incensedsallie croians vpon ballaban presumption made braue sallie vpon falling skirmish turkes enforced retreate made chieftaine know vanitie practises herewithall ballaban enraged euen madde anger making head fresh croyans thought pure force haue driuen towne citizen beginning retyre good order without losse anie one companie happened one george alexie epyrot borne good harguebussier discharging bullet vpon ballaban george alexie hit quite thorough throate giuing mortall deadly wound yet ballaban fall presently found himselfe shotte kept himselfedeath ballaban slain shot croy sure within saddle setting spurres horse h ranne great speed swift pace euen tent sooner arriued tumbled horse fell rudely ground embrewing countrie soyle owne bloud destruction whereof hee bloudilie desired fall death generall put whole campe infidelles extreame feare terrour much night following barbarian great silencesiege croy raised secrecie abandoned siege croie retyring themselues eight long myles encamped fortified selues verie diligently tyranna next morning vppon breake day scanderbeg comming take viewe enemy tentes found voide emptie men fully furnished baggage prouisions want thing eyther corne victual caused remoued carried thence croie manner sufficient victuall one whole yeare himselfe entred great triumph citie receiued great honour ioy inhabitant highly commended worthily fidelitie good perseuerance adding therewithall many gift reward recompence desertsmessengers armie turkes scanderbeg desiring leaue depart epyre whilest office ciuill courtesy passed betwene scanderbeg citizen came campe barbarian lying tyranna two horsmen seeming person good account reckoning presenting themselues scanderbeg name chieftain commander armie praied grant fauour neuer refused men qualitie namely leauing baggage horse armour might suffered depart liues onely sore affraid least passage forestalled laide haue beene shut vp fortified enclose famish within countrie hereupon king caused prince noble captaines speedily assembled might deliberate determine vppon aunswere giuen turkes might heare aduise euerie man particular tooke order meane two horseman shouldcouncell called scanderbeg consult vpon message demaund turkes conducted tent thereto well gratiously entertayned iosaphat barbare first whose opinion demaunded matter excused himselfe saying seigniorie venice sent thither resident neere person prince onely doe please commaund therefore part referred himselfe matter owne good pleasure lech ducagin spake liberally man fierce forwarde disposition prompt hande quicke inuention one worde acquaint minde saying embetha albanian language signifieth horsebacke sawe reason anie grace mercie shewed people deuoide pittie mightily giuen bloudthirstinesse crueltie ought rather passe vnder edge sworde opinion part assembly especially paul angell archbishoppe propounded set eye example iulius caesar time past hauing march broken defeated pompeyans pursue euen last extreamitie also ought forsake owne good fortune oftentimessentence seeth selfe liuely roundly followed turneth selfe contrarie byas fauour vppon frowned many reason alleage effect scanderbeg replyed vnto manner knowe right well worthie valiant epyrots fellowe souldiersoration scanderbeg disswading souldiers pursuing turkes reliefe croy haue alreadie good experience singular valure notable resolution greatnesse courage whereby haue alwayes terrified discomfited enemy doe thinke euen also haue courage power breake trample vnder feete reliques remainder amazed infidel neuerthelesse gentle warriours behoueth v often bethinke selues call minde sage sentence wise man part propertie fooles wish tempest fayresentence calme weather guise fashion wise seeke mortall aduersarie nowe laide dead vppon ground armie fledde selues rest quiet thinges doe seeme smyle fawne vpon v wherefore seeke haue warte wherefore desire owne torment tempt fortune blinde vncertaine doth depend hande industrie power disposition fortune enemie alwayes redoubted neuer despised neuer disesteemed warre ended victorie obtained yet lesse diligence euen vsed verie first beginning must time rashly vnaduisedly come fight combat enemie wherefore desire aduenture chaunce warre trie fortune fielde enemie v shall endaunger put hazarde god defend owne safetie estate god thanked good case securitie refraine therefore ardent burning feruentnesse courage let victorie haue alreadie gotten suffice content v haue manie great triumphes vppon enemy ought holde selues satisfied many murthers many ouerthrowes giuen manifolde fauours fortune hath hitherto gratiously fawned vpon moreouer see troupe barbarian excessiue manner innumerable baser rascall sort people collected gathered aduentures flower strength turkish force chosen men stout expert ready prouided prepared fight armed necessitie weapon extreame daungerous desire seeke thing else battell eyther reuenge death generall carrie home vnto soueraigne report notable worthie exploit offer rendering themselues coulorable feigned beleeue dissimulation doe make semblance onely feare terrour well acquainted cunning draught disguisements know nothing one subtill sleight guilefull policy wherein men thing else doe make singular profession assure selues desire nothing much come fight reuenged wherefore wise let v keepe selues let v trouble let doe intende anie malice anie deceipt v yet enraged desperate shame ignominie doth presse v affraide thinges feare nothing nothing perillous set vppon men whose safetie consisteth desperate without hope safetie commonly fighteth combattethsentence outragiously hath comfort left relyeth vppon hope anie thing doe put sworde make betake themselues flight yet cannot done without dammage without losse without bloud without expence cost many liues victorie otherwise ruefull lamentable wherefore louing good souldiers beleeue counselled aduised assured haue mercie without fight without vsing sword weapon great want thinges especially bread fayling gotten armie easily vanquished without fighting let v shut vppe wayes passage succour victuall may meanes come vnto let v newly fortifie stuffe towne good strong garrison let v furnish sortes munition prouision many yeares shall see enemy shut vp besieged within confines shall perish die miserably pure famine hunger shall see vtterly ouerthrowen destroyed without sword without armes without bloudshed shewed themselues well pleased oration allow scanderbeg perswasions others would satisfied therewith especially common sort souldiers growen fierce audacious enemy beganne make great noise without tumult andsouldiers scanderbeg murmure disswaded following turkes vproare enclyning mutinie part within campe christian cry aloft loud voice ought march directly presently go seeke turkes alreadie vanquished discomfited expedient matter yeelde vnto motion scanderbeg shewed himselfe growen fearefull fainthearted considering fierce furious combatant neuer refused occasion fighting open plaine battell become fearefull temporizer would seeme disswade armes borne bredde followe armes whose onely desire enemy nowe generall faile wanting souldiers souldiers generall thus heate vehemencie epyrots scarce repressed withh lde captaines master campe till time generally concluded agreed witnes next good friend well testifie three twentieth yeare past expired since escaped impure handes wicked amurath king turkes fledde realme beeing auncient patrimonie inheritaunce auncestours euer since time haue helde endured warres periured faithlesse nation rage furie ottoman particular safetie defence crowne kingdome dignitie publike estate weale christendome time grace fauour diuine clemencie haue happie fortunate successe according heart desire neuer yet saw returne either vanquished repulsed true set battell may speake lawfully alwaies aduantage vpon enemie doe remember euer hurt wounded shot arrow right foote turke yet presently kill euen head front enemie threw downe bloudie head feete according ordinarie course humane thing three score third yeare age olde age growen vpon seized grieuous sicknesse destitute wonted strength corporall force beholde good friend behold deare companion beginne waxe feeble litle litle goe way flesh perceiue friend see well pleasure diuine prouidence confesse doe acknowledge thing subsisting haue whereby thing guided gouerned behooueth lay aside mortall fraile burthen bodie goe another better place must exchaunge breuitie misery life felicitie true euerlasting ioyes protest vnto god thought hereof rather necessitie layed vpon doth sort trouble grieue repine law destiny impose vpon v time natiuitie ought aggrieued find fault suffer according lawe iustice condition borne subiect necessitie mortalitie know well whatsoeuer necessitie cannot accounted miserable man particularly behooueth v end yeeld earth earth obedient nature required v due resigne vp soule eternall immortall spirit heauenly celestiall hath onely lent v time neuerthelesse deare friend companion receiue embrace fatall lot death departure courage cheerefulnesse willing freed perilles danger would eschew shunne trauels labour would withdraw selfe mischieues inconueniences wherein euen till time haue consumed best yeares haue ended dayes seruice god religion christ readie could finde heart expose aduenture life continually like greater hazardes see see well god good pleasure perceiue good god calleth must obedient must retire selfe earthly filthie dungeon miserable wretched prison haue followed nature long enough haue liued long enough haue finished course haue run race pleased god appoint yet soule depart bodie doe leaue one thing hold expedient admonish aduertise haue alwayes vsed case importance able former time better yeares age heretofore life time euen till haue endured trauels labour euen last gaspe safetie dignitie christian religion catholique faith meanes whereof haue made prince christendome fauour honour admire euen hereafter dead gone let onely whole desire heart let onely thing shall set eye thing assure fall easie happily vnto long continue stedfast concord vnitie small thing contemptible grow great inuincible long entertaine mutuall loue fidelitie doe make litle account thing comparison common profit general good empire puissant well grounded falleth present ruinesentence declineth destruction mutual enmity dissentions suffered haue entrie priuate profit particular commoditie preferred publique common good shall ioyne together brother friendes shall liue one another perfect loue amitie attempt practises enemy whatsoeuer shall able grieue hurt scepter crownes shall durable permanent shall maintaine people prouinces wiues child rich quietnesse perpetuall felicitie shall neede feare furie ottoman rage barbarian fraudes subtilties traines cunning sleight shall able harme preuaile doubt tirant doth seeke disioyne disunite force doth lay many plot deuises verie watchfull vigilant doth spare paine labour deuide seperate bring passe doe see neuer litle variance oppresse one another end vtterly destroy consume moreouer good friendes confederate iohn sonne possible care affection diligence hartely father doe recommend vnto doe commit giue dedicate faith fidelitie singular vertue tender yeares infirmitie age yet stuttering stammering make vnfit either foresee repulse imminent calamitie able preserue himselfe tornein piece deuoured fierce enraged tiger keepe himselfe oppressed periured common enemy mahomet kingdome greedie desirous ceaseth watch continually may swallow vp bloudy cruell throt ala worke effect oppresse poore wretch armes valour protect preserue assoone shall perceiue dead cruell tirant make stay come flying sauage wilde beast intent may reuenge many loss many outrage calamity hath suffred endured father vpon poore vnhappie infant intent may execute vpon silly wretch kindes cruelty whatsoeuer barbarous felonous heart put practise let therefore louing friend good companion entreate embrace estate affaire like loue fidelitie promptnes affection haue embraced commoditie glorie dayes life list acknowledge truth speake know haue liued selfe alone child haue laboured toyled selfe day night haue spared paine trauels sake whole course life haue enioyed time space rest leasure neuer place certaine neuer kept houres time limitted eate drinke sleepe night dayes haue bene one alike tooke lesse care prosperitie estate mine owne god witnesse fallen speech matter freely discouer thought vnto neuer dreamed meant fraud deceipt alwaies repute souldiers seruants subiectes haue euer helde loued brother companion one farre remember euer wronged outraged word deed care seruices field duty either scout watch sentinel neuer inferior haue still borne selfe one simple meanest souldiers hauing alwaies desire followed imitated deedes action wordes speech souldiers learne onely good order discipline example imitation thereof also neuer refused labour hazard perill neuer made excuse shewes vnwillingnes dissimulation whensoeuer onset giuen vpon enemie realme kingdome thou good vertuous stable firme thou otherwise weake feeble studie therefore sonne striue preferre goodnes vertue good whatsoeuer thereby thou shalt maintaine make thy estate onely peaceable quiet thou shalt encrease daily make glorious much sonne thy age yet weake vnapt vnable sway scepter crowne thy kingdome thou hast partes great mightie enemy fierce sauage beastes seeke dismember deuour thee mahomet wicked tyraunt common enemy christian thou shouldest young weake yeares take vpon thee managing gouernment thy realme would presently oppresse vtterly subuert thee cause sweete heart assoone thou hast closed couered thy father eye hast yeelded mybodie sepulture get thee presently hence taking thy mother thee passe sea apulia make delay hasten thy owne townes lordship see thou continue abide till time thou growen man estate thou capable sufficient affaire gouernement thy kingdome thou art come yeares make thy repaire noble senate seigniorie venice reestablish thee
